story:
My name is Dr. Kim Perkins and I am the author of Winner Take None. I have always been attracted to subjects that evoke strong feelings and rarely get talked about, and my experience and research in competition has shown me there's a great need for us to talk about what happens socially and personally when you win and when others lose.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover a new consideration of competition and the role it has played in your life. I hope to spark in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for both character-building games and for inclusive community. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you be less hard on yourself and to fully engage in the possibilities open to humanity at this crucial point in our history.

In this book, you'll learn about four different approaches to competitive situations and how to make your experiences and tastes work better for you. You'll hear ...

  • How the body interprets and reacts to cues that someone is competing with you 
  • How to manage people's competitive fire without your office going full Machiavelli
  • What factors make competition healthy vs. traumatic for kids and adults 
  • How people are using “meta-gaming” to get the joy of playing hard without the problem of creating winners and losers 

Winner Take None is a nonfiction book that speaks to organizational leaders and cultural critics who want to look at competition and society in a new way. Whether you love competition or loathe the very idea, you'll find something in this book to that speaks to your heart and helps you get more of what you want.

About the Author

Dr. Kim Perkins is an organizational psychologist specializing in positive psychology, leader development, and motivation. She’s also former journalist and winning pro inline skater and has delivered keynotes at conferences all over the world.

With Winner Take None, Dr. Perkins connects meaningful stories of people competing - or assuming they're competing - with research in organizational psychology, economics, and human evolution. Winner Take None will give readers a fascinating perspective on competition as a phenomenon, and new ways to motivate themselves and others to create sustainable results.

Dr. Perkins coaches people in tech, science, entertainment and non-profits to help leaders develop and organizations to align incentives. She shares a Craftsman house with her badass husband, and works out of her home-office yurt with the aid/hampering of two fluffy cats. 

For more information, connect with Dr. Kim Perkins at kimperkins.com, and at @imperativeform on Twitter and @thisiskimperkins on Instagram.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Fall.
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

The Book

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 (Introduction + Chapters 1-4) discusses about how we got here - the social and biological forces that make competition part of our everyday lives, whether we acknowledge it or not. We’ll identify four ways people motivate themselves around competition and how to get the most out of your method. And we’ll talk about mental models: the unspoken rules to the game that you can -and should - update as times change.

Part 2 (Chapters 5-7) focuses on stories and personal experiences in competition - the great and the terrible, and the lasting impact of both winning and losing. We’ll talk about rivalries and how to tame them, and how to spark a competitive fire if you‘re feeling flat. 

Part 3 (Chapters 8-12) considers competition in organizations - how meritocracy often goes wrong, and what you can do to tame politics while tapping into people’s natural desires to do well. There will be case studies from organizations doing it right, and reimagining approaches for the 21st century.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #winnertakenone and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Kim Perkins

story:
¡ENTREVISTA EN RADIO!

Escúchala aquí!!!

¿Quiénes somos?

¡Hola desde el pupo del mundo!

Somos la Corporación Ciudarte una pequeña ONG de Quito, Ecuador que está compuesta por artistas y comunicadores que elaboramos proyectos comunitarios, campañas e intervención en el espacio público, para brindar oportunidades de participación e inclusión a grupos no visibilizados en las ciudades.

Dentro de nuestras acciones, tenemos al proyecto MINGA DE LETRAS, POR BARRIOS AMIGOS DE NIÑAS Y NIÑOS, que nació en 2008 y desde ahí ha beneficiado a más de 1300 niñas y niños.


¿QUÉ SIGNIFICA MINGA?

Esta es una palabra de nuestros países andinos en Latinoamérica que viene de nuestras culturas ancestrales, significa, trabajar en conjunto, arrimar el hombro, poner todos la mano. Hacer MINGA para nosotros es juntar todos nuestros esfuerzos para llevar lectura y artes a nuestra niñez y así visibilizarlos en el aprendizaje de sus derechos.


¿EN QUÉ CONSISTE NUESTRO PROYECTO?

Realizar un total de 20 talleres de arte-lectura dirigido a niñas y niños de 6 a 11 años en escuelas de las Islas Galápagos en las Islas Floreana y Santa Cruz en Ecuador, Sudamérica.


OBJETIVO GENERAL

Visibilizar a niñas y niños como miembros activos de su sociedad, a través de talleres de arte-lectura que promuevan el conocimiento de sus derechos y la apropiación de espacios públicos, para crear condiciones que apoyen al fortalecimiento de ciudades amigas de las niñas y los niños.


BENEFICIARIOS

Niñas y niños de 6-11 años que asistan a los talleres. Se aspira un mínimo de 30 niñas y niños en cada taller y se puede llegar hasta 60 por taller. Aspiramos llegar a más de 1200 niñas y niños al final de los 20 talleres.


¿CÓMO ES UNA MINGA DE LETRAS?

  • Murga
  • Juegos de integración
  • Lectura de cuento
  • Actividad de aplicación

Duración de la actividad: 1 hora y 30 minutos aproximadamente

También puedes verlo en: UN DÍA EN LA MINGA DE LETRAS


RECURSOS HUMANOS:

  • 3 facilitadores para la realización de la Minga de Letras
  • 1 fotógrafo y productor audiovisual del proceso


***Aspiramos poder realizar al final una FERIA DEL ARTE, una exposición final de los trabajos realizados por niñas y niños durante las 20 mingas en Galápagos***


  • Mira el VIDEO DOCUMENTAL “Minga de Letras 2010” disponible en:
    https://vimeo.com/35011447
  • Mira FOTOS DE LA MINGA en: 
    https://www.flickr.com/photos/ciudarte/sets 

MINGA DE LETRAS 2014 - NUESTRO SUEÑO GALÁPAGOS!

Este proyecto busca llegar a diferentes provincias del Ecuador y este año, gracias a gestiones realizadas, estamos a punto de visitar por primera vez las Islas Galápagos.

¡Sí! las Islas Galápagos son parte de Ecuador y seguro ustedes lo conocerán como un paraíso del turismo mundial. Esta es la razón por la que normalmente es muy difícil y costoso ir para allá.

Y también por eso existen muy pocos o casi nulos programas dirigidos a la niñez para promover las artes y la cultura. Llevar este proyecto ha sido un sueño de muchos años que hoy casi se concreta al haber logrado gestionar lo más difícil que es llegar.

Gracias a una Institución que trabaja allá tenemos ya gestionado:

- Pasajes ida y vuelta para los 4 talleristas

- Un lugar donde dormir

- Alimentación para el mes que estaremos trabajando allá


¡SÉ UN MINGUERO! APÓYANOS...

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Necesitamos recursos para:

- Materiales para los niños de todos los 20 talleres que daremos 

- Honorarios para el equipo de trabajo (5 personas)

Nuestra campaña AQUÍ es para que con tu aporte, podamos contar con materiales para poder realizar los talleres y un pago justo para nuestros talleristas que estarán a tiempo completo por un mes brindando lectura, arte y derechos a la niñez de Galápagos. ¡¡¡GRAAAACIAS POR CREER!!!

Para motivarte y agradecerte por tu aporte a la niñez del Ecuador, hemos preparado unas LINDAS RECOMPENSAS!!

Para saber más de la MINGA DE LETRAS visítanos en: www.ciudarte.org 


Riesgos y desafíos

Haremos lo necesario para no perder esta maravillosa oportunidad y confiamos en ti para lograrlo... QUEREMOS LLEVAR LECTURA Y ARTE A NUESTRAS NIÑAS Y NIÑOS DE GALÁPAGOS!



¡Sé un minguero! ¡Ayúdanos también a difundir!

  • Difunde nuestra campaña a través de tus Redes Sociales de Amigos
  • Recuerda que puedes usar las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo!!

story:
Nuestro Encuentro

El Encuentro Feminista Latinoamericano y del Caribe se lleva celebrando en nuestro continente desde el año 1981, cuando miles de mujeres decidieron reunirse en Bogotá en un canto colectivo a la lucha organizada de los movimientos feministas latinoamericanos.

Desde aquel momento se han celebrado ya 12 encuentros en diversos países de nuestra región. Del 22 al 25 de noviembre de 2014, 33 años después de aquel primer encuentro, celebraremos el XIII EFLAC en Lima, Perú.

Con cada encuentro buscamos contribuir al fortalecimiento de los movimientos feministas en América Latina para afianzar una democracia que incluya en la agenda de los Estados y de las sociedades, los derechos humanos de las mujeres desde una perspectiva feminista.

Nos proponemos hacer del XIII EFLAC un acontecimiento político que reafirme ante un país conservador como el Perú, la lucha de las mujeres y los avances logrados desde que surgió como un movimiento revolucionario que busca transformar y politizar tanto lo más privado de nuestras vidas como los espacios y  ámbitos públicos.

Este EFLAC tiene como paraguas el título de:“Encuentros en la diversidad: rebeldías, creaciones y transformaciones”. Una rebeldía que también se orienta a transformar el sistema capitalista, neoliberal, colonial, patriarcal, heteronormativo y racista, lo que hemos llamado la trenza de dominación que oprime nuestras vidas, cuerpos y territorios. Entre los varios marcos o enfoques que orientan y dan sentido a nuestras luchas feministas en América Latina y el Caribe hoy, destacamos tres: la mirada intercultural crítica, la sostenibilidad de la vida y la perspectiva política sobre el cuerpo.

El XIII Encuentro se desarrollará escuchando y acogiendo la multiplicidad de vivencias de nuestros cuerpos y prácticas políticas feministas. Sera un espacio para propiciar talleres, actividades lúdicas, paneles, performances, diálogos, conferencias, actividades de calle, grafitis, manifestaciones, conciertos, proyecciones, tertulias y propuestas, que dejen fluir los diferentes saberes, desde metodologías animadas por la conjunción necesaria entre razón y emoción. 

Un llamado al a solidaridad feminista

Desde el comité organizador del XIII EFLAC queremos hacer un llamado a la solidaridad internacional feminista para contribuir a la autogestión de nuestro encuentro.

Como saben nos enfrentamos a una situación difícil, el monto conseguido para la realización de este evento es mucho menor que en otros encuentros anteriores.  No obstante, desde el comité consideramos que la falta de fondos no puede, ni debe poner en riesgo la celebración de este encuentro histórico. Es por ello que consideramos de vital importancia repensar la forma de realizar nuestra actividad, considerando esta situación un reto y una oportunidad para trabajar de manera autogestionaria. 

La autogestión ha sido una forma de trabajar que garantiza nuestra autonomía como movimiento de feminismos diversos. Los colectivos y organizaciones feministas de todo tipo hemos hecho de la autogestión una dimensión central dentro de lo político, ya sea a través de actividades para la recaudación de fondos o con nuestro trabajo cotidiano, como activistas y mujeres, muchas veces invisible y subvalorado.

Es por ello que desde las múltiples comisiones que conforman la organización del Encuentro estamos buscando incorporar formas autogestionarias como la creación de una red de alojamiento solidario, la realización de ferias y campañas como esta para la recaudación de fondos. Dado el carácter regional del Encuentro, que convoca a mujeres feministas de toda latinoamericana, las invitamos a colaborar también con esta campaña de recaudación de fondos mediante su aporte solidario.

El dinero recaudado será destinado a apoyar la participación de compañeras de organizaciones de base peruanas con poco acceso a recursos económicos.

Con cada 70 dólares recaudados estarás garantizando el alojamiento solidario y la alimentación  de una compañera  de bases de organizaciones feministas del Perú, durante los cuatro días que dura el encuentro. 

¡Anímate a colaborar con este encuentro, cada aporte, cada mano solidaria cuenta! ¡Contribuye con la defensa de los derechos de las mujeres, y al fortalecimiento de los diversos movimientos feministas de Nuestra América!


Latin American and Caribbean Feminist Encounters

Since 1981, when for the first time, thousands of women from all parts of the continent met in Bogotá to strengthen the collective struggle of Latin American feminist movements, the “Latin American and Caribbean Feminist Encounters” (EFLAC) have become an important place for forging connections between our diverse struggles.

33 years later, twelve Feminist Encounters have been organized in different countries in our region. This november, from the 22nd to the 25th, the 13th EFLAC will take place in Lima, Peru.

Every Feminist Encounter seeks to contribute to the strengthening of the feminist movements in Latin America fighting for a democracy that puts women’s human rights from a feminist perspective on the agenda of state and society.

We strive to make the 13th EFLAC a political gathering that reaffirms the centrality of women’s struggles as well as celebrates the advances gained since Latin American feminist movements emerged as revolutionary movements seeking to transform and politicize the most private spaces of our lives as much as the public space – goals even more central in a conservative country like Peru.

The 13th EFLAC bears the title“Encounters in Diversity: Insubordination, Creations, and Transformations”. Our insubordination is geared towards transforming the capitalist, neoliberal, colonial, patriarchal, heteronormative, and racist system that oppresses and exploits our lives, bodies, and territories. From the varied frameworks and approaches that orient and give meaning to our feminist strugggles in Latin America and the Caribbean today, we focus on three in particular: This Feminist Encounter will be guided by a critical intercultural perspective, depart from a political perspective on our bodies, and engage with the sustainability of life.

The 13th Feminist Encounter will be a space for listening to and learning from the multiplicity of ways to experience our bodies and feminist political practice. It will bring together workshops, activities, panels, performances, dialogues, conferences, street art, grafittis, manifestations, concerts, showings, conversations, and proposals, stemming from different knowledges and from different methodologies merging reason and emotion in distinct ways.

A Call for Feminist Solidarity

As the organizing committee of  the 13th EFLAC, we call for your international feminist solidarity in raising funds for our Feminist Encounter.

Currently, we are faced with a very difficult situation as we avail  of a much lower amount of funding than for the last two Feminist Encounters. Nevertheless, we hold that the lack of funding should not endanger this crucial Feminist Encounter taking place in a decisive moment in Latin American politics. This is why we consider it of vital importance to rethink our practices, seeing this situation as a challenge and an opportunity to work in a self-funded manner.

Self-Funding has been a form of collective organizing that has guaranteed our autonomy as diverse feminist movement. Many feminist collectives and organizations have converted self-funding into a central dimension of our politics, be it through fundraising activities or be it through our – often invisible – work as activists and as women in our daily life.

This is why we, from the multiple commissions that together form the organizing committee of the Feminist Encounter, seek to incorporate and promote different ways of self-funding. We are organizing a network for solidary accomodation during the Feminist Encounter as well as fundraising fairs and campaigns. As the Feminist Encounter is a regional and open event for feminists from Latin America and beyond, we invite you to collaborate with this fundraising campaign in a spirit of solidarity.

The money raised will be used to cover the participation of women from Peruvian grassroots-organizations with restricted access to economic resources.

For every 70 dollars raised, you will guarantee the accomodation and alimentation of a fellow activist from one of the grassroots feminist organizations in Peru during the four days of the Feminist Encounter.

Please collaborate with the 13th Feminist Encounter, every contribution helps! In collaborating, you will contribute to the defense of the rights of women and the strengthening of the diverse feminist movements of Our America!

Detalle de la colección de libros feministas de las recompensas/ Details of the feminist books collection: 
Vargas, Virginia. 
Feminismos en América Latina. 
El aporte a la rebeldía de las mujeres.
Las organizaciones de mujeres populares, tres perspectivas de análisis. 
Olea, Cecilia. 
Encuentros, (des)encuentros y búsquedas. El movimiento feminista en América Latina. 
Tamayo, Giulia.  
Bajo la piel. Derechos sexuales, derechos reproductivos.
Minardi, Giovanna. 
Cuentas. Narradoras peruanas del S. XX. 
Yurbal-Davis, Nirma. 
Género y nación. 
Vargas, Lita. 
Del Salvia y toronjil. Guía de medicina natural para la salud de la mujer. 
Ferrando, Delicia. 
El aborto clandestino en el Perú.  
Villavicencio, Maritza. 
Del silencio a la palabra.
Miloslavich, Diana. 
María Elena Moyano en búsqueda de una esperanza.
story_txt:
Nuestro Encuentro
El Encuentro Feminista
Latinoamericano y del Caribe se lleva celebrando en nuestro continente desde el
año 1981, cuando miles de mujeres decidieron reunirse en Bogotá en un canto
colectivo a la lucha organizada de los movimientos feministas latinoamericanos.

Desde aquel momento se
han celebrado ya 12 encuentros en diversos países de nuestra región. Del 22 al
25 de noviembre de 2014, 33 años después de aquel primer encuentro,
celebraremos el XIII EFLAC en Lima, Perú. 
Con cada encuentro
buscamos contribuir al fortalecimiento de los movimientos feministas en América
Latina para afianzar una democracia que incluya en la agenda de los Estados y
de las sociedades, los derechos humanos de las mujeres desde una perspectiva
feminista. 
Nos proponemos hacer del
XIII EFLAC un acontecimiento político que reafirme ante un país conservador
como el Perú, la lucha de las mujeres y los avances logrados desde que surgió
como un movimiento revolucionario que busca transformar y politizar tanto lo
más privado de nuestras vidas como los espacios y  ámbitos públicos.
Este EFLAC tiene como
paraguas el título de:“Encuentros
en la diversidad: rebeldías, creaciones y transformaciones”. Una rebeldía que también se orienta a
transformar el sistema capitalista, neoliberal, colonial, patriarcal,
heteronormativo y racista, lo que hemos llamado la trenza de dominación que
oprime nuestras vidas, cuerpos y territorios. Entre los varios marcos o enfoques
que orientan y dan sentido a nuestras luchas feministas en América Latina y el
Caribe hoy, destacamos tres: la mirada intercultural crítica, la sostenibilidad
de la vida y la perspectiva política sobre el cuerpo.
El XIII Encuentro se
desarrollará escuchando y acogiendo la multiplicidad de vivencias de nuestros
cuerpos y prácticas políticas feministas. Sera un espacio para propiciar
talleres, actividades lúdicas, paneles, performances, diálogos, conferencias,
actividades de calle, grafitis, manifestaciones, conciertos, proyecciones,
tertulias y propuestas, que dejen fluir los diferentes saberes, desde
metodologías animadas por la conjunción necesaria entre razón y emoción. 
Un llamado al a solidaridad feminista
Desde el comité organizador del XIII EFLAC queremos
hacer un llamado a la solidaridad internacional feminista para contribuir a la
autogestión de nuestro encuentro.
Como saben nos enfrentamos a una situación difícil,
el monto conseguido para la realización de este evento es mucho menor que en otros encuentros anteriores.  No
obstante, desde el comité consideramos que la falta de fondos no puede, ni debe
poner en riesgo la celebración de este encuentro histórico. Es por ello que
consideramos de vital importancia repensar la forma de realizar nuestra
actividad, considerando esta situación un reto y una oportunidad para trabajar
de manera autogestionaria. 
La autogestión ha sido una forma de trabajar que
garantiza nuestra autonomía como movimiento de feminismos diversos. Los
colectivos y organizaciones feministas de todo tipo hemos hecho de la
autogestión una dimensión central dentro de lo político, ya sea a través de
actividades para la recaudación de fondos o con nuestro trabajo cotidiano, como
activistas y mujeres, muchas veces invisible y subvalorado. 
Es por ello que desde las múltiples comisiones que
conforman la organización del Encuentro estamos buscando incorporar formas
autogestionarias como la creación de una red de alojamiento solidario, la
realización de ferias y campañas como esta para la recaudación de fondos. Dado
el carácter regional del Encuentro, que convoca a mujeres feministas de toda latinoamericana,
las invitamos a colaborar también con esta campaña de recaudación de fondos
mediante su aporte solidario. 
El dinero recaudado será destinado a apoyar la participación de compañeras de
organizaciones de base peruanas con poco acceso a recursos económicos. Con cada 70 dólares recaudados estarás garantizando el alojamiento solidario y la alimentación  de una compañera  de bases de organizaciones feministas del Perú, durante los cuatro días que dura el encuentro. 
¡Anímate a colaborar con este encuentro, cada
aporte, cada mano solidaria cuenta! ¡Contribuye con la defensa de los derechos
de las mujeres, y al fortalecimiento de los diversos movimientos feministas de
Nuestra América!Latin American and Caribbean Feminist Encounters
Since 1981, when for the first time, thousands
of women from all parts of the continent met in Bogotá to strengthen the
collective struggle of Latin American feminist movements, the “Latin American and
Caribbean Feminist Encounters” (EFLAC) have become an important place for
forging connections between our diverse struggles. 
33 years later, twelve Feminist
Encounters have been organized in different countries in our region. This
november, from the 22nd to the 25th, the 13th EFLAC will take place in Lima,
Peru.
Every Feminist Encounter seeks to
contribute to the strengthening of the feminist movements in Latin America
fighting for a democracy that puts women’s human rights from a feminist
perspective on the agenda of state and society.
We strive to make the 13th EFLAC a
political gathering that reaffirms the centrality of women’s struggles as well
as celebrates the advances gained since Latin American feminist movements
emerged as revolutionary movements seeking to transform and politicize the most
private spaces of our lives as much as the public space – goals even more
central in a conservative country like Peru.
The 13th EFLAC bears the title“Encounters in Diversity: Insubordination,
Creations, and Transformations”. Our insubordination is geared towards transforming
the capitalist, neoliberal, colonial, patriarchal, heteronormative, and racist
system that oppresses and exploits our lives, bodies, and territories. From
the varied frameworks and approaches that orient and give meaning to our
feminist strugggles in Latin America and the Caribbean today, we focus on three
in particular: This Feminist Encounter will be guided by a critical
intercultural perspective, depart from a political perspective on our bodies,
and engage with the sustainability of life.
The 13th Feminist Encounter will be a
space for listening to and learning from the multiplicity of ways to experience
our bodies and feminist political practice. It will bring together workshops,
activities, panels, performances, dialogues, conferences, street art, grafittis,
manifestations, concerts, showings, conversations, and proposals, stemming from
different knowledges and from different methodologies merging reason and
emotion in distinct ways.
A Call for
Feminist Solidarity
As the
organizing committee of  the 13th EFLAC,
we call for your international feminist solidarity in raising funds for our Feminist
Encounter.
Currently, we
are faced with a very difficult situation as we avail  of a much lower amount of funding than for the last two Feminist Encounters. Nevertheless, we hold that
the lack of funding should not endanger this crucial Feminist Encounter taking
place in a decisive moment in Latin American politics. This is why we consider
it of vital importance to rethink our practices, seeing this situation as a
challenge and an opportunity to work in a self-funded manner. 
Self-Funding
has been a form of collective organizing that has guaranteed our autonomy as
diverse feminist movement. Many feminist collectives and organizations have
converted self-funding into a central dimension of our politics, be it through fundraising
activities or be it through our – often invisible – work as activists and as
women in our daily life. 
This is why
we, from the multiple commissions that together form the organizing committee
of the Feminist Encounter, seek to incorporate and promote different ways of self-funding.
We are organizing a network for solidary accomodation during the Feminist
Encounter as well as fundraising fairs and campaigns. As the Feminist Encounter
is a regional and open event for feminists from Latin America and beyond, we
invite you to collaborate with this fundraising campaign in a spirit of
solidarity.
The money raised will be used to cover the participation of women from Peruvian grassroots-organizations
with restricted access to economic resources.For every 70 dollars raised, you will guarantee the accomodation and alimentation of a fellow activist from one of the grassroots feminist organizations in Peru during the four days of the Feminist Encounter.
Please
collaborate with the 13th Feminist Encounter, every contribution helps! In
collaborating, you will contribute to the defense of the rights of women and
the strengthening of the diverse feminist movements of Our America!
Detalle de la colección de libros feministas de las recompensas/ Details of the feminist books collection: 
Vargas, Virginia. Feminismos
en América Latina. El aporte a la rebeldía de las mujeres.
Las organizaciones de mujeres populares, tres perspectivas de análisis. 

Olea, Cecilia. 

Encuentros, (des)encuentros y búsquedas. El movimiento feminista en América Latina. 
Tamayo, Giulia.  Bajo la piel. Derechos sexuales, derechos reproductivos.Minardi, Giovanna. Cuentas.
Narradoras peruanas del S. XX. Yurbal-Davis, Nirma. Género y nación. Vargas, Lita. Del Salvia y toronjil. Guía de medicina natural para la salud de la mujer. Ferrando, Delicia. El aborto clandestino en el Perú.  
Villavicencio, Maritza. Del silencio a la
palabra.Miloslavich, Diana. María Elena Moyano en búsqueda de una esperanza.

story:
Short Summary

The San Francisco Bay Area and beyond is aware that with all the personal and social issues I deal with I am a reliable producer of videos for the poetry community who has been known to work for free:

  • I have done audio and video since around 2005 generally for free.
  • I will continue to produce my PEG TV Shows for free with perhaps underwriting production costs permitted by PEG TV.
  • I am going to look for funding for my other poetry videos and am trying to get funding and paid work in my T-shirt mug business making swag for artists and authors..
  • I will continue making a fair percentage of my videos for free as a favor for the poetry community.


Why you should give.

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Good video cameras are not cheap.
  • Equipment for making T-shirts, mugs, tiles, etc. is not cheap
  • Starting a business itself involves expenses.

Risks & Challenges

It is very difficult and expensive doing my poetry videography.

  • I think most people who know me have seen good results albeit sometimes I have made hurdles that were a little hard getting thru. These hurdles I will never give up and will continue try try to get thru them (Such as the Poetry Theater now in Hiatus)
  • I am moving shortly and hope to be able to run the poetry theater there. Perhaps in a recreation room

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you have been in any of my poetry videos please tell your friends about my project and try to see if they can help..
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.



Raising Money to Fund: The Poetry Activist Non-profit
My name is John Rhodes and I'm planning to start a multi-faceted non profit  business based on literature and creativity with a goal to continue to do  non-commercial work as an expression of the enlightened nature of this project.
The general goals non-commercial and commercial, of this non-profit are: Videographic productions for PEG TV and Internet, and photo/graphic/text/art reproductions, for putting on substrates such as t-shirts, mugs, tiles, and many other things, for the art/literature community.  
This indiegogo project started with the idea of just getting funds for a project I have been doing with a past producer of public access TV, Eileen Malone which involves remastering all her old, generally literary, Pen Women Presents TV Shows, and putting them back on TV as re-runs and also on youtube.This ran into a snag as I can only legally get money for projects with  PEG TV with underwriting, so I decided to, with my giving nature, do this project  for free. Instead  of asking people to help with that project I decided to gear the Indiegogo project for funding to support my other projects and perhaps, ask that people consider submitting underwriting to be aired on the TV Show as a way to pay for the filming but not the actual people who work on the show.

To summarize more clearly the  general needs of this project is the need for money to register a business and pay for videography equipment, raise money for the T-shirt printing business. The beta stage of my printing business produced all the T-shirts for the Petaluma Poetry Walk for 2 years,  I made mugs for poet Joan Gelfand with the cover of her book and a poem on them, and I regularly make copies of art onto tiles for Salma Arastu in Berkeley. I am also trying to reproduce t-shirts with art from Chris Trian. What you would be directly funding would be paying for my cameras, and my t-shirt printers, and heat presses software and perhaps a bookkeeper/account/ tax-keeper, to name a few costs.
Also, if you are in the Bay area and would like to volunteer, with the possibility of being paid please contact me.
Also, I have a hope to start a multi-producer TV Show that will have it's own app for putting on TVs which I actually already have but it needs extensive development. A volunteer could help with this project immensively. Most of it is creating and sizing graphic Icons and copy and paste in a WSIYWG Roku App.

story:
Canada: F*ckin’ Eh! is our class project, started because we had to do something, but finished out of love. We’re seeking funding to have it brought to life. Currently it’s in a pile of different papers, and we need help to get it out to those that share our love… For Canada!

One day in Canadian Studies, our professor gave us what seemed like an easy assignment. Write a pamphlet on why Canada is great. Well, Canada IS great, so it seemed like a simple process to put it down on paper. But then the old Canadian nemesis reared its ugly head. I have stared into the face of my downfall, and named it politeness, the demon that kills with kindness. Neither I nor any of my classmates wanted to be seen as arrogant or rude, so every time we wrote something for the project we started it with "in my humble opinion". Some of us even started apologizing within our writings!!!

In order to resolve this seemingly insurmountable problem, we adjourned to the local pub and started in on the pitchers of (Canadian) beer. After a sufficient number of pints and a spirited hockey debate (only a small amount of blood; real fights require someone to be carted off to the hospital), we started writing in earnest. Screw pamphlets, we were each writing epic novels! So why not really make it a book? We got together and spoke to our Prof about combining our works into a much larger project.

Which is what brings us here. Your funding will go towards a competent editor (I ramble when drinking), formatting, printing, and getting the word out to all and sundry (an editor would know what that means. I don't. Just read it somewhere and always wanted to use it).

So stop by, read a little, fund a lot, and be not afraid to tell us why you see Canada as amazing. Whether you're Canadian, love one, like one, barely tolerate their presence, or secretly want to be one, it would be great to hear from you!!!!

Any monies gathered will go towards making this project a reality. While the creative has been taken care of, the print and distribution aspects are where the funding will go. Should the target not be reached we will simply print enough books to take care of the perks, instead of printing and distributing extra copies for sale in the book market.

...

Hello, my name is Adam Fortier, and I am a Canadian. I've been one for as long as I can remember, and instead of kicking the habit, I've decided to embrace it. After all, there's nothing I'd rather be. I've worked and travelled abroad for a number of years, and in all that time my heart has remained here. It's with this spirit in mind I wanted to put together a love letter to my country of birth and choice.

You may ask why I chose this manner to present my book, and there are a couple of reasons. First off, I'm Canadian, and we're all a little odd (perhaps it's the cold, it does something to us). Secondly, I wanted to share everything in an unapologetic way, shouting it from the rooftops, and felt this was the best way to keep things unfiltered. So enjoy the writings of the lovely students over at Flurry University, and bask in their love of this country.

While the University and Students are fictional, the sentiments expressed are real. This is a project that is from my heart, but is comprised of many of my own observations, researching, as well as others’. I love this country, but a large part of what makes it great is the people I share it with.

 

I’ve worked in publishing for a number of years, and given the choice of doing anything with my time, this is where I’d prefer to be. Too often do I see people create properties for the “North American” audience, and not just for Canadians, or those close to us. THIS project is for Canadians first, North Americans second.

 

Please make a contribution! We accept PayPal. If you don't have a PayPal account, you can still contribute using your credit card! Click here for info: http://indiegogo.zendesk.com/entries/20501786-how-to-contribute-via-paypal-without-a-paypal-account

story:
“Love is what matters, all we have to do is love everyone from now on.”                                                                                                                                    – Fr.Louie Vitale

Join us in helping to celebrate and spread the words of Fr. Louie who has been an inspiration and shining example to so many people all over the planet.

This is the first compilation of Louie’s written work.  It features a foreword by Martin Sheen, the actor/activist who has been on the front lines of peace and justice (and in jail) with Louie and a foreword by Ken Butigan, decades old friend of Louie and Executive Director of Pace e Bene, Campaign Nonviolence, which Louie helped found thirty years ago.  The book also features a heartfelt, love-filled reminiscing and afterword by Fr. John Dear, a three times Nobel Peace Prize nominee and long time friend of Louie.

This inspirational volume features a photo collection from Louie’s life, personal reflections on living a life of peace and compassion and calls us to take our love into action.  These are the words of a man that has stood for peace, for love, for care and compassion, who has never hesitated to stand with the poor and helpless, and has been arrested over 400 times for his efforts.

Now is the time to rejoice in Louie’s work and to spread his words far and wide.

Thank you for supporting this celebration of Fr. Louie’s life and message.  Please donate, buy books, send them to friends, give them out on street corners, tell the world, because…”Love is What Matters”

story:
Summary in English is at the bottom of this page

Glavni sponzor kampanje je energetska kompanija RWE!

innogy je jedna od vodećih energetskih kompanija u Europi. Ostvaruje više od 40 milijardi eura prihoda sa svojih 40 tisuća zaposlenika u tri snažne divizije: maloprodaja, mreža i infrastruktura te obnovljivi izvori.

Poslovnim aktivnostima innogy grupe u Hrvatskoj upravlja tvrtka RWE Hrvatska d.o.o. sa sjedištem u Zagrebu. RWE Hrvatska u energetskom lancu vrijednosti sudjeluje kroz prodaju električne energije (RWE Energija d.o.o.), prodaju plina (RWE Plin d.o.o., Koprivnica Opskrba d.o.o.), distribuciju plina (Koprivnica Plin d.o.o.), zbrinjavanje otpadnih voda (ZOV d.o.o.), kao i kroz razvoj projekata obnovljivih izvora energije u suradnji s HEP-om (Novenerg d.o.o.).

Prvi srebrni sponzor je:

IoT Net Adria gradit će vlastitu mrežu baznih stanica za IOT (Internet of Things) u Hrvatskoj na koju će se onda moći spajati razne IOT điđe, u rasponu od malih, recimo, očitavača stanja plinskog brojila za kućne korisnike, do kojekakvih čudesa za automatizaciju industrijskih pogona, Smart City sustavi, pametna i autonomna vozila.... Predviđa se da će nas samo do 2020. okruživati milijarde povezanih uređaja, no u Hrvatskoj još nije bilo mnogo primjene te tehnologije. Uvođenje prve nacionalne IoT mreže to će promijeniti i označiti temelj masovnog uvođenja iste u zemlji i regiji. IoT Net Adria hrvatski je partner SigFoxa.

Srebrni sponzor je i Bosch:

Bosch je u Hrvatskoj dio Grupe Bosch, vodećeg svjetskog dobavljača tehnologija i usluga. Od osnutka u Zagrebu 1993., Bosch neprestano povećava prodaju u Hrvatskoj, koja je 2016. dosegla 54 milijuna eura. Pružajući proizvode i usluge osmišljene da izazovu divljenje i unaprijede kvalitetu života nudeći inovativna i korisna rješenja, Bosch je uspostavio široku mrežu kupaca čiji broj danas prelazi 600 lokalnih klijenata u Hrvatskoj. Tvrtka neprestano širi svoje poslovne aktivnosti u Hrvatskoj. Nadalje, tvrtka Bosch Hrvatska 2004. godine preuzela je vođenje poslovanja u Bosni i Hercegovini, a 2014. u Sloveniji. Poseban Boschev odjel Pametna rješenja otvoren je 2016. u Zagrebu.

Brončani sponzori su:

Algebra

CROZ

Ostali još nisu poslali logiće ili kasne s nečim drugim LOL... Pošaljite!

Medijski prate:

Team Tesla

Dakle, pokušat ćemo nešto što još nitko, po našim saznanjima, nije ni probao, a još manje uspio... sudjelovat ćemo električnim autom na reliju Budapest - Bamako!

Što je Bamako? Kojim autom? Zašto je to poseban podvig? TKO SU TI LJUDI??

Nas dvojica smo Saša Cvetojević, poduzetnik, investitor i entuzijast električnih automobila, i Oleg Maštruko, autor, putopisac i fotograf, urednik u IT medijima Bug i Mreža. 

Budapest - Bamako, ponekad skraćeno znan i samo kao Bamako rally, najveći je amaterski reli na svijetu, nastao s idejom da se Dakar Rally učini dostupan i "običnim" ljudima. Glavninu organizatora čini ekipa iz Mađarske, i u prvim izdanjima reli je, kao što ime kaže, išao od Budimpešte do Bamaka u Maliju. Cilj nije svake godine isti - ove godine ide se do Banjula u Gambiji - ali se reli i dalje zove po Bamaku.... baš kao što se Dakar Rally i dalje zove tako iako se odavno ne vozi do Dakra u Senegalu. Usput budi rečeno, trasa Bamako Relija ove godine ide pored Dakra, da stvar bude "zbunjujućija".

Pogledajte video!

 
Zašto Tesla? Pa, zato jer to (koliko nam je poznato) još nitko nije probao, zato jer je brutalan, i to zaista bru-ta-lan izazov, i zato jer je Saša veliki entuzijast električnih automobila i želimo dokazati da je i nemoguće moguće.

U EU infrastruktura za električne aute je prilino solidna, no jednom kad zagazite na afrički kontinent stvari se drastično mijenjaju. Ruta nas vodi "normalnim" cestama i zemljama od Budimpešte do Španjolske, zatim slijede Maroko - koji je, prema našim saznanjima, relativno pristojno elektrificiran barem u sjevernom dijelu; pa Zapadna Sahara, Mauritanija, Senegal i Gambija, koji su u smislu infrastrukture za e-aute dijelom lutrija, dijelom pakao, dijelom čuđenje u svijetu...
 
Nosit ćemo generator. Nosit ćemo karte. Nosit ćemo fotoaparate, kartice, šatore, nosit ćemo fucking big television, washing machines, cars, compact disc players, and electrical tin can openers. Choose good health, low cholesterol and dental insurance. Choose fixed-interest mortgage repayments. Choose a starter home. Choose your friends. Choose leisure wear and matching luggage.... OK ovo je neki drugi, no ne manje lud film....  
 

Kampanja i financije

Iako je reli amaterski, sudjelovanje dosta košta. Amaterska narav relija vezana je uglavnom za činjenicu da sudionici nisu profesionalni vozači, a ne zato jer je sudjelovanje jeftino (nije). Unatoč tome - postoje i natjecateljske kategorije u reliju. Bit će vremena da se sve to podrobnije objasni.

Jedna od skupljih stvari u našem troškovniku je generator. Djeluje bizarno da u autu na električni pogon ipak nosimo benzinski ili dizel motor, ideja je da nam bude samo rezerva za slučaj da se energetska situacija zagusti. Kad dođemo do cilja u Banjulu, Teslu imamo namjeru vratiti brodskim prijevozom do luke Rijeka (to je još jedan veliki trošak), a generator pokloniti nekom selu. To selo najvjerojatnije će biti u Gambiji ili Senegalu, jer su te dvije zemlje jedine dovoljno blizu odlaznoj luci da se usudimo ostati bez generatora.

Ova kampanja ne služi pokrivanju svih troškova relija - troškovi su daleko veći. Financije za ekspediciju skupljat će se iz tri izvora - osobni džepovi nas dvojice, zatim ova crowdfunding kampanja, te izravan kontakt sa sponzorima i donatorima. Najveći perk u ovoj kampanji (Neoliberal Bastard) je u rangu brončanog podržavatelja tima!

Kliknite gore na tab Gallery, tamo je par primjera Olegovih fotografija, koje nisu s ovog relija – logično, jer tamo tek trebamo otići – ali koje vam daju neku ideju kakav krajolik očekujemo i kako ćemo se kroz njega probijati. To su inače fotografije s lokacija donekle sličnih onima kakve očekujemo.

Na par slika je naša Tesla s promo fotkanja u Zagrebu.

Dragi ljudi, to je to! Pratite ovu kampanju i, dakako, sudjelujte u njoj prilogom. Reli kreće sredinom siječnja, a ova kampanja završava početkom prosinca. Kako se kampanja bude bližiti kraju, objavit ćemo i ime i link Facebook grupe te medija na kojima ćemo objavljivati slike, priče i vijesti iz Team Tesla Powered by RWE. Stej tjund!

English summary

Hi, this is a campaign to get funding for Team Tesla Powered by RWE for Budapest - Bamako rally, largest amateur rally in the world. We plan to go with Tesla X fully electric car!

Main sponsor of our project is, quite fittingly, energy company RWE, Croatian branch of the innogy group, one of the leading energy companies in Europe. In Croatia, they are mostly known as electricity and gas providers.

The project is in Croatian, because we plan to write travelogue in Croatian language, for our Croat readers (and others who understand Croatian). We will also post high quality photos. So, since photos do not require any translation – if you like nice photos and/or electric cars you can support the campaign too....

The rally itself is challenging enough, but to go with the electric car makes it almost completely crazy. Check out the video above, with the rough route shown. Follow, and of course participate in this campaign! As the campaign draws to a close, we will publish the name of the Facebook group and the media outlets that will be used to publish the photos, stories and news from Team Tesla Powered by RWE. Thanks!

story:
Help us! help us! We need money or we die!

Y' might know me; (Darren Maher) or y'might know Seamus (Seamus Ryan). Or you might be just a Limerick head yourself, anyway; Seamus publishes a comprehensive online guide to the up-coming w'kends events in Limerick city, and he does it every week.- which is fine for all his facebook friends (that he interacts with often enough to pop up in their feeds), but I reckon a wider audience and a pickuppable, perusable hard-copy is good idea.
If you agree- then giz a fiver or so, and we can keep doing this. Otherwise, we can't, and that maketh me a sad panda.

Or you might be just a Limerick head yourself, anyway; Seamus publishes a comprehensive online guide to the up-coming w'kends events in Limerick city, and he does it every week.- which is fine for all his facebook friends (that he interacts with often enough to pop up in their feeds), but I reckon a wider audience and a pickuppable, perusable hard-copy is good idea.If you agree- then giz a fiver or so, and we can keep doing this. Otherwise, we can't, and that maketh me a sad panda.

story:
I'm Rebecca St Croix the author and illustrator of the Burt the Bunny children's picture books.  During the day, I work as a social media specialist at a college for my school and my spare time is spent writing and illustrating my children's books. 

I have created four children's picture books and three short stories that have sold well as Kindle eBooks.  I tried to offer print-on-demand books via a self publishing platform but honestly, it is too expensive for people to buy so I would like your help in funding the equipment to produce my current and future books in-house! 

Not only would I like to produce my own books but I'd like to help other authors who are trying to find affordable options to self-publishing whether it is a children's book or a novel.  Another way I would like to help is with the students that I meet every day who also want to publish their poetry, screen plays, and graphic art novels. My in-house book binding would give them the chance to create small runs of their books and get their work out in the local community without breaking the bank. 

What I need to get started: 

First and foremost, I need an automatic book binding machine to create the books.  The most expensive part is the automatic binding machine but for approximately $2,500, I can buy a smaller unit which will create one book in about 30 seconds. My dream machine is the larger (heavy duty!) Duplo DB 290, which costs close to $11,450 (includes shipping & taxes) but will create up to 200 books an hour!  Another advantage to the Duplo DB 290 is it is available in the U.S. so shipping would be quicker and cheaper than from China. The rest of the funds will be used to purchase high quality printers, paper, glue, ink, and the Indiegogo fees.  In other words, I'm going for the top goal of $15,800, so I can purchase the heavy duty model and materials but if I don't make that higher goal, then I will use the funds to buy the smaller model and build from there. 

The Perks for your help:

Depending on your pledge, perks include a signed, full-color, personally created Burt the Bunny  children's book for your own kids or other loved ones. As an example, get the whole collection for a pledge of $80, plus the bonus book, Daydream Adventures:  Three Short Stories for Children.  Even a pledge of $10 gives you a signed postcard from me featuring Burt the Bunny on one of his adventures or just hanging out.  The illustration on the postcard you receive in the mail will be a surprise! Snail mail still exists right? :-) 

More about my books:

My first book I wrote is Rocket Baby Goes to Mars. Rocket Baby and his best friend, Boris the Bear travel to Mars in a rocket ship.  Real NASA images and fun science facts add to the adventure!

My second book is Rocket Baby & Burt the Bunny.  Rocket Baby and Boris the Bear have another adventure but this time with Rocket Baby's pet rabbit, Burt. Burt is a mischievous bunny who uses a magic box to create more bunnies. When Rocket Baby and Boris realize what has happened, they rush to find the bunnies a new home, on Ohkunoshima Island in Japan.

The third book is Park Hopping with Burt the Bunny.  Burt the Bunny tours the U.S. National Parks in the western United States. He visits a total of nine parks such as Crater Lake in Oregon, Yosemite in California, and even parks in Alaska and Hawaii. Each park is introduced and Boris the Bear provides his fun "Boris Facts" to tell about each park.

And my fourth book is Undersea Adventure with Rocket Baby & Burt the Bunny.  Rocket Baby and Burt the Bunny travel to the bottom of the sea in their new submarine built by Boris the Bear. During the voyage, Boris the Bear provides his fun "Boris Facts" to tell about marine life and the ocean.

My future books include a pirate adventure with Burt the Bunny (currently working on!) and he will also visit other fun sites so young children can learn about history and culture. There will be introductions of new characters including a new bunny friend, Sonja, who will inspire self-esteem in girls to reach their dreams and goals. The illustrations are done in vivid colors with simple text which is perfect for infants through the toddler years and beginning readers. 

Risks & Challenges: 

Since this publishing project requires me to purchase a book binding machine, there could be a delay in receiving the machine due to possible shipping delays but if there is, I will communicate that to you ASAP.  Honestly, I feel by allowing plenty of time at the end of the campaign, I will be able to purchase the equipment, produce, and mail the perks right on time or early if at all possible. There is nothing that makes me more happy but to create Burt the Bunny's books by hand and share them with you.  

Grateful for any and all help!

And of course, if you are not able to pledge monetarily, I will be so grateful for your help in spreading the word about my campaign.  Post on your social media sites or send your friends and family my campaign link and see if they are interested or if they would mind sending the info out on their sites.  Seriously, I am thankful for all the help you can give me.

Each park is introduced and Boris the Bear provides his fun "Boris Facts" to tell about each park.And my fourth book is Undersea Adventure with Rocket Baby & Burt the Bunny.  Rocket Baby and Burt the Bunny travel to the bottom of the sea in their new submarine built by Boris the Bear. During the voyage, Boris the Bear provides his fun "Boris Facts" to tell about marine life and the ocean.My future books include a pirate adventure with Burt the Bunny (currently working on!) and he will also visit other fun sites so young children can learn about history and culture. There will be introductions of new characters including a new bunny friend, Sonja, who will inspire self-esteem in girls to reach their dreams and goals. The illustrations are done in vivid colors with simple text which is perfect for infants through the toddler years and beginning readers. Risks & Challenges: Since this publishing project requires me to purchase a book binding machine, there could be a delay in receiving the machine due to possible shipping delays but if there is, I will communicate that to you ASAP.  Honestly, I feel by allowing plenty of time at the end of the campaign, I will be able to purchase the equipment, produce, and mail the perks right on time or early if at all possible. There is nothing that makes me more happy but to create Burt the Bunny's books by hand and share them with you.  Grateful for any and all help!And of course, if you are not able to pledge monetarily, I will be so grateful for your help in spreading the word about my campaign.  Post on your social media sites or send your friends and family my campaign link and see if they are interested or if they would mind sending the info out on their sites.  Seriously, I am thankful for all the help you can give me.

story:
Short Summary

 

*There are 4 sample stories under updates*

I'm 44 and live on the north shore of Boston. I drove for Uber part-time, for extra money. I didn't know that the people I would meet would change my life. 

I met amazing people with incredible experiences. Their stories made my cry. Their stories made me laugh hysterically. Their stories made me ask what the holy f*ck?? 

I documented every moment. I posted my experiences on social media. I received a great deal of comments asking me to put these experiences into a book.

So, here they are.  

I decided to go big, or go home. I'm hiring the best editor, the best marketing team, the best everything and everyone to help me with this project. Now I need YOUR help.

If you can't donate, spread the word!!!! That's "Badass" too!

The first story I posted in "updates" is about a guy who was on a plane to Boston on 911. The second is me driving a car full of millennials to Salem, MA in October to the Halloween festivities (hysterical).  There is another story about me driving a guy to rehab. The last is about me sharing dinner with one of my passengers. 

These are some of my favorite stories. I hope you enjoy them.

story:
Short Summary

 

I am an autistic  adult, an autism and disability rights activist and I run the first ever neurodiversity community lending library.   I am also a parent to an amazing autistic kid and I know how hard it is to find books that will help him to find a sense of pride in his autistic identity.   In my work with the library, I come across a lot of books about autism.  Children's books about autism are mostly written for classmates or siblings and are authored by non autistic people.  These books generally talk about autism as a negative thing and are not at all reflective of autism acceptance or the neurodiversity paradigm.    I want to change that, so I wrote a children's book featuring the Neurodivergent Narwhals.   

 

The narwhals started as a way for me to bring short, accessible information about autism acceptance in the form of posters and infographics to people who are mostly unfamiliar with neurodiversity or the social model of disability.  They have become very popular and have been purchased by school districts, children's therapists, parent groups and more to help teach people about autism.  

 

Autistic children hear so many negative and harmful messages about autism.  It is so important for them to know that they are amazing and loved.  It is my hope that this will be a book that is not only for autistic children but also for the people who love them and accept them for exactly who they are. 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

The library needs to raise $2500 for initial printing, getting an ISBN for the book, printing and acquiring a separate ISBN for a companion coloring book,  editing, and paying to convert the print book into an e-book.

If I do not reach my entire goal, I will split the funds between neurodiversity community lending libraries and to help purchase existing books for people to start one in their communities.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that not everyone can contribute to this campaign financially but  it is easy to support us by sharing information with your friends and family and on social media.  Please help to get the word out about the Neurodivergent Narwhals Book!

story:
WELCOME! WE ARE GLAD YOU FOUND US HERE.

Be among the first to read Richard Siken’s long-awaited second poetry collection, War of the Foxes, while lending your support to independent publishing through Copper Canyon Press. Signed copies and limited edition hand-bound books are available exclusively for YOU and other supporters who make a gift to independent publishing through this page. Read on or look at the "perks" section for more details.

In March 2015, Copper Canyon Press and Richard Siken launched a crowdfunding campaign to raise money for independent nonprofit poetry publishing. Over 500 donors in 33 countries helped us to reach over 300% of our goal in just one month. Richard is currently busy signing and sending postcards to campaign supporters around the world. By popular demand, though the crowdfunding campaign has officially ended, we are continuing to offer two exclusive items through our Indiegogo page:

  • SIGNED copies of War of the Foxes 
  • Beautifully HAND-BOUND limited edition copies of War of the Foxes, produced in collaboration with Spork Press. There will only be 226 copies of this limited edition hardcover book in circulation, and currently less than 200 are available.

THE BOOK 

War of the Foxes tells an artist’s story, asking what it means to be called to make—whether it is a self, love, war, or art—and what it means to answer that call. The opening poem asks an essential question: To supply the world with what?

In the ten years since the publication of Crush, Siken has been exploring this question and many others, pushing paint around on a canvas until he found something worth keeping. As a supporter of this campaign, you will be among the first to read the new poems, the first to see the paint strokes and discover what they can mean.

Your contribution to the success of this campaign will enable Copper Canyon Press, a nonprofit independent publisher, to supply the world with more extraordinary books of poetry like War of the Foxes.

        


CAMPAIGN GOALS

Our goal was to raise $10,000 towards our 2015-2016 publishing seasons while reaching hundreds of poets, poetry readers, and Richard Siken fans. With your help we have raised over $30,000 and counting. 

As Siken says, “The role of independent publishing is to be an open channel. There’s not a lot of money in it and there’s not a lot of money for it, and so the people who are dedicated to it are dedicated to the author, and the reader, and the work. That’s significant. Copper Canyon Press is an independent publisher, and independent publishing needs our help.”

Indeed—as a nonprofit poetry publisher, sales revenue covers only half of the annual publishing expenses at Copper Canyon. That means we rely on the generosity of people like Richard Siken and you; those who believe in poetry’s potency and importance. Your donations enable us to supply the world with extraordinary books like War of the Foxes; reaching our goal and beyond will allow us to publish 18-20 books in 2016. 

Please make your donation today, and receive the gift of poetry from Richard Siken and Copper Canyon Press.

THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING COPPER CANYON PRESS. 

All gifts are tax-deductible.

story:
Empréndete es un show de emprendimiento en línea que tiene un solo objetivo: inspirar a las personas dándoles herramientas para emprender. Escuchanos aquí

 

¿Qué hay detrás?  4 amigos muy apasionados que después de haber hablado de mil y un proyectos, un día vieron a Empréndete como un hijo que tenía que nacer. Hace solo tres meses compramos un micrófono, aprendimos a editar audio y salimos a entrevistar emprendedores amigos y hoy, increíblemente, vamos tan bien que la revista Entrepreneur nos mencionó como uno de los mejores podcasts de emprendimiento y negocios en español y nuestra audiencia está creciendo a más del 140% mensual.

 

En esa misma lista de buenas noticias, hace una semana recibimos una invitación de las embajadoras de Harvard para América latina (creadoras de Mujeres liderando América Latina) para hacer parte del IBC, un encuentro de mujeres emprendedoras que ocurrirá en Boston dentro de un mes, una oportunidad que no podemos desaprovechar.

 

Estamos seguros que esa experiencia será un punto de inflexión para nosotros; la oportunidad de cubrir un evento de ese nivel será un paso más en todo lo que viene, ¡contamos contigo!

 

Recuerda que si no puedes apoyarnos con dinero, siempre puedes ayudar compartiendo nuestra campaña!

 

¡Mucha paz y buena onda!


El equipazo Empréndete :)

story_txt: 

story:
The Little Book of the Icelanders in the Old Days

Hello!

Four years ago, I published a wee book called The Little Book of the Icelanders. At the time I tagged "Vol. 1" onto the end of the title, which was a private joke meaning that I had SO MUCH MORE to say. Well, my joke was so private that I was the only one that got it, and ever since, people have been asking me when Vol. 2 was coming. Because they wanted MORE.

Well, the time is upon us. The Little Book of the Icelanders Vol. 2 is now about to hit the shelves (or your mailbox)!

Around the time that I finished Vol. 1 I started doing a bit of studying up at the University of Iceland and became fascinated by all the things my people (the Icelanders) got up to in the days of yore. Because, you thought the Icelanders today had a lot of quirks and foibles? Wait until you read what they were like back then. 

Example, from the chapter "Grunge scene" - on the Icelanders' hygiene (as it were):

Then there were the clothes and bed clothes. People washed their shirts every two weeks or so, but their underclothes far less frequently. There was this one man, for instance, who was known to wash his underclothes once a year, at Christmas. He would then wear them until the summer, at which point he would take them off, turn them inside-out, and wear them that way until it was time for another washing.

Apparently people didn't wear their underwear to bed, so that may have helped slightly, although that meant their bedding was the recipient of the dirt. The bedding was washed maybe once a year, in the spring. It was washed in, um, urine, which was considered to be a very good cleanser on account of the ammonia. The downside was that the smell stayed in for weeks afterwards (which may well be why the washing wasn't done more frequently).  

Or this, from the chapter on haymaking (which was the most important task of the year):

Apparently the pinnacle of humiliation for the menfolk was if the women or children caught up to them. Naturally, then, the men busted their butts to make sure they were well in front. If the women managed to catch up to them it was either called að raka þá upp að rassi, "raking them up to their asses," or að gelda þá, "to castrate them." Whoa. Not hard to imagine how much male pride hinged on this, then. In some instances the men were even known to grab the women's rakes and snap them in two - particularly if the women were making fun of them, which supposedly was part of the game.

Oh, there's more ...

  • sex with hidden people
  • the dastardly debauchery of dancing (see photo)
  • old-style porn
  • corpses standing up in church
  • visitors kissing everyone on the mouth
  • log deliveries from Siberia
  • Icelanders going to town
  • foreigners in the Iceland of yore

... and still more! (But for that you have to buy the book.)

Please note that this is an experiment, and I'm not sure what will happen after this initial print run. Meaning that if you want to guarantee yourself a hard cover, illustrated copy you should order now. The book will go into distribution in Iceland, but will not be available for routine orders in this format after the campaign ends. 

The Little Book of the Icelanders in the Old Days is a small hardcover book around 160 pages long, which makes it around 50 percent longer than the first Little Book (... so much more to say). All the illustrations will be done by the wonderful and talented Megan Herbert, who also did the illustrations in the first Little Book. It is based on my folkloristics and ethnology studies over the past two years, and so yes, it has been researched (meaning I'm not just making all this stuff up). 

If you liked Vol. 1 I guarantee you are going to love Vol. 2. The Little Book of Icelanders in the Old Days is THE perfect gift, for yourself or someone else. 

ALSO! I have now started a Tumblr blog where I share the process of getting this book out to the world, so you can see how your contribution funds are being used.


What I Need & What You Get

So, to make this happen, I need your help. On this book I have decided not to work with a traditional publisher like I did on the last Little Book, which means that I have to bear all the costs of production by myself. This includes the cost of illustrations and the printing of a first print run of 3,000 copies. Those will be mailed to those of you who pre-order a book, and the rest will be distributed to book stores in Iceland. (My plan now is to hit the ring road and distribute the book myself while blogging the experience ... more on that later.) The printing and illustration part alone costs around USD 9,000, and Indiegogo takes a substantial cut of whatever is collected. So all in all I need to raise a minimum of USD 10,000.

I am producing this book on an absolute shoestring: a group of amazing volunteers have helped, or are helping, with the editing, and my wonderful husband is designing the book and (like me) won't get paid until all the other costs have been paid. 

What I am asking you to do is to pre-order a copy of the book and/or to help by pledging. A list of perks may be found off to the right here. In the event that I don't raise the full amount needed, I will still use what comes in to print as many copies as possible (in other words you will definitely get your book). If I exceed my goal (oh happy day), the proceeds will be used to pay a little extra to my illustrator (who is keeping her costs to an absolute minimum), to pay the graphic designer (EPI), and to print more copies. 

I should mention that the printed version of the first Little Book of the Icelanders has not been readily available outside of Iceland. It is possible to order it from the publisher, but the shipping and handling fees are higher than the cost of the book, so it is expensive. A lot of people have voiced their dissatisfaction with this, and unfortunately it has been beyond my control. If you order the new book through this campaign, however, I will be happy to ship it to you – whether you live overseas or in Iceland. I am keeping the shipping fees to an absolute minimum … you pay only what I pay for shipping, and the handling is free.

One more thing: I cannot guarantee that overseas shipping will be possible after this initial print run – or, indeed, if there will be another print run. That all depends on how this venture works out. In other words, if you want to make sure that you get your hands on a copy of the book, you should definitely order now, and not wait until later.  

The estimated delivery time is May-June.

Thanks in advance for your help - you rock!


Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that not everyone is able to contribute financially. If that's you and you still want to help, I would love it if you could help get the word out there and make some noise about this campaign. If you want you can use the sharing tools provided by Indiegogo. All and any help is deeply appreciated!

story:
Read the Original Article

 

In 2006, Kurt Angle changed jobs, from wrestling for World Wrestling Entertainment to Total Nonstop Action Wrestling. The character he played—using his own name, his own credentials as an Olympic Gold Medalist, and his own family—was a daring expose on classic pro wrestling tropes. Part amateur wrestler, part clown, part unstoppable machine, Angle became the centrepiece of TNA Wrestling. He's unlike any other pro wrestler, and possibly unlike any other man. 

Angle's characteristics lean heavily towards superheroism or supervillainy, and has been known to shift between the two in the span of weeks. It's not uncommon for pro wrestlers to change from being heroes to villains, but rarely without altering aspects of their personality or character. Angle is capable of being both without changing anything. 

This essay will chronicle the shifts in Angle's character from 2006 to the autumn of 2011. It will chronicle his professional wrestling matches and stories, but will heavily focus on his shifts in character, how Angle plays the role, and what the author believes are the motivations behind Angle's actions.

Here is the basic breakdown of the essay:

The Unstoppable Machine: 2006-2007: Angle's battles with Samoa Joe and other young TNA wrestlers.

The Corrupt Husband: 2007-2008: Angle's on-screen relationship with his wife, Karen Angle. 

The Main Event Mafia: 2008-2009: Angle's relationship with other wrestling legends, and his sense of place in wrestling history.

A Heroic and respectable turn: 2009-2010: Angle has a role model, a beacon for achievement. 

Come See the Broken Man: 2010-2011: Angle as victim, divorced father, and unhinged noir protagonist. 

The essay will be roughly 10,000 words. It is the first major account of Kurt Angle, arguably one of the best professional wrestlers in history as a character.
story_txt:
Read the Original Article
 
In 2006, Kurt Angle changed jobs, from wrestling for World Wrestling Entertainment to Total Nonstop Action Wrestling. The character he played—using his own name, his own credentials as an Olympic Gold Medalist, and his own family—was a daring expose on classic pro wrestling tropes. Part amateur wrestler, part clown, part unstoppable machine, Angle became the centrepiece of TNA Wrestling. He's unlike any other pro wrestler, and possibly unlike any other man. 
Angle's characteristics lean heavily towards superheroism or supervillainy, and has been known to shift between the two in the span of weeks. It's not uncommon for pro wrestlers to change from being heroes to villains, but rarely without altering aspects of their personality or character. Angle is capable of being both without changing anything. 
This essay will chronicle the shifts in Angle's character from 2006 to the autumn of 2011. It will chronicle his professional wrestling matches and stories, but will heavily focus on his shifts in character, how Angle plays the role, and what the author believes are the motivations behind Angle's actions.
Here is the basic breakdown of the essay:
The Unstoppable Machine: 2006-2007: Angle's battles with Samoa Joe and other young TNA wrestlers.
The Corrupt Husband: 2007-2008: Angle's on-screen relationship with his wife, Karen Angle. 
The Main Event Mafia: 2008-2009: Angle's relationship with other wrestling legends, and his sense of place in wrestling history.
A Heroic and respectable turn: 2009-2010: Angle has a role model, a beacon for achievement. 
Come See the Broken Man: 2010-2011: Angle as victim, divorced father, and unhinged noir protagonist. 
The essay will be roughly 10,000 words. It is the first major account of Kurt Angle, arguably one of the best professional wrestlers in history as a character.

story:
Our Story

I'm Logan Rapp, host and administrator of The Velvet. What originally began as a simple fan community for authors Will Christopher Baer, Craig Clevenger and Stephen Graham Jones has grown into a strong corner of the web for writers who want encouragement without condescension, criticism without insult. 


We are a sister site for Chuck Palahniuk's The Cult, but we are independent. As an incubator for writers in all mediums for dark, noir-influenced fiction, we've also become proofreaders, comic relief, shrinks and friends for our fellow members. 


The Velvet is special. I have met many of our members personally. What people write and post on the Velvet forums isn't behind a veneer of anonymity. They say what they mean. They'll say it online and they'll say it to you at a bar. Many of us have gone on to publish novels of our own since this site began in 2004. Each year, the number of legitimate authors who post regularly increase significantly - including Baer, Clevenger and Jones. 


The Impact

Our site is held together by duct-tape. We're writers, not web developers. Everything we've done with the site has been by flying blind, making a change and crossing our fingers hoping that, if it doesn't work, that it doesn't at least destroy the site. Without this redesign, our site will remain on an unstable foundation. We've had one major back-end collapse that we've never quite recovered from. 


I'm not entirely certain that we'll survive another one. For a corner of the Internet where authors not only interact directly with fans, but actively answer questions and help with writing their own novels, from pre-writing to contract issues, having the Velvet go under would be a mighty shame for the arts. The future big names of literature are coming out of this site. 


What We Need & What You Get

We haven't made a dime off the Velvet. Scratch that, we have made $17.70 since becoming an Amazon Associate, which is on our frontpage that has since collapsed. 


What we need is a full redesign. We want to build upon the forums (which is on phpBB), and create a clean, well-designed community portal. 


  • We want to be able to pull news from literary blogs and sites to our front page. 
  • We want the ability to create writing "groups," whether as a collaboration on a single project, or just a quiet corner for writers who know and trust one another to workshop their earliest of drafts. 
  • We'd like to have Facebook Connect enabled, which would play well with our Facebook page for the Velvet. 
  • Specialized sections for reviews and interviews, editorials and the like. 
  • And then, quite frankly, we'd like to make it look good. No one wants to go to a site that's ugly, and the whole point of the Velvet is for people to want to be here. 

If we don't meet our goal and it's not enough to hire a developer, all proceeds will go to operating costs for the site. 

If we go over our goal, or if we find that our needs don't require the full amount of what we do receive, whatever is left over from the redesign will be split 50/50 between operating costs for the site (hosting fees, etc.) and to Child's Play Charity.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word - send people to The Velvet proper, or to our Facebook community page, or to our pitch here. 
  • If you know a web developer who could provide us with a deal, we'd love that, too. 

We didn't build the infrastructure for this site, but it's our home. And a home that we'd like to share with you. Help us make this into a place where people from all walks of life - all ages and backgrounds - can come together as one and help one another achieve the success we wish for ourselves and everyone around us.
