story:
The campaign has ended. Printing begins soon. Pre-order today at Qbyq.info


Nathan Earl Rose's first book of prose poetry is the culmination of over 10 years of ambient & unfocused work. 'patience is the opposite of waiting' encapsulates the evolution of juvenilia, from adolescent love poems to structural experiments with form, from media theory to the ancient east, then back to untempered love.

-

Words by Nathan Earl Rose

Cover artwork by Anthony Yenafuk

Layout design by Nathan Earl Rose & Rachael Wheeler

Printed by Qbyq

4" x 5.5"

Edition of 117

Single color, multiple layer screen print on gloss cover, laser cut window, laser color print on text bond, perfect binding

-

Nathan and Qbyq teamed up with Anthony Yenafuk and Rachael Wheeler, who designed the cover and contributed to the layout design, respectively

'patience is the opposite of waiting' will be printed by Qbyq, a limited edition press based in Norfolk/Richmond, VA. Qbyq things are handmade by Christine Rucker

-

Nathan Earl Rose is a poet, 
pataphysician, cinemamaker, 
media theorist, songbird, raconteur, 
freelance pediatrician, dj, & zen master. 
He is smiling as you are reading this now.

Anthony! has been a practicing graphic designer since graduating from the Rocky Mountain College of Art & Design in 2007. Since then, Anthony has been applying the potent visual communication of the commercial industry to present radical voices and individuals attempting to hustle their own skills and passions, amplifying alternatives to the standard hooha of contemporary society.

Wheels is a graphic designer and massage therapist. Her small business, Bliss + Mass, serves individuals and other small businesses in the Hampton Roads area. Find her at BlissAndMass.com for design or bodywork. 

Christine is an artist and instructor based in Norfolk, VA, She facilitates Qbyq's operations in bookmaking and printmaking. Working closely with friends, she produces books and prints that are tactile art objects. Find Qbyq things at qbyq.info and her artwork at christineryeah.com

-
Check back for updates
-
Qbyq uses an HP Laserjet hot heat set toner. It requires toner that is approximately $45.00 each and yields 1800 pages. There are 123 pages per book and we're looking to print 117 first-run copies: grand total 28,044 pages to print, front and back. We need cartridges of Cyan, Magenta, and Yellow. The text is black and white so I'd like to have on hand three black toners for this run
-
The supplies we'll need include the following:
CMYK toner ~$270
white text weight bond paper ~$100
blue gloss paper for the cover art ~$100
screen printing supplies and ink ~$64
Studio23 membership fee ~$150
pad compound for binding ~$50
digital guillotine and laser cutting ~$100
design team fund ~ $400
-
Our goal is to raise funds for the production costs by Thanksgiving & do the first-run printing mid-December so that 'patience is the opposite of waiting' can be released before Valentines Day.

story:
What would I like you to do? 

Most simply, I would like you to take a moment and consider making a donation to my fundraiser.  

I have less than three weeks to raise these funds, so if you would, please consider making your donation sooner rather than later.  Thank you!

So, what I am doing this fundraiser for?

I am asking for your donations to cover the costs of traveling, registering, lodging, and feeding myself in Spokane, Washington.  Why I am I going to Spokane, of all places?  Well, I recently was invited to  2013 Individual World Poetry Slam (IWPS)! 

Why is this important?

IWPS is one the world's largest stages for performance poetry.  Poets from across the nation will converge on Spokane, Washington, between October 2 and October 5 to compete for the title of World Champ.  This is no small event: a platform as far reaching and respected as this has catapulted many poets to the next level of their pursuits as artists.  And with the notoriety gained, poets can often help solicit new and extra resources for the community they represent--exactly like the college environment I work in. 

I have never had the opportunity to compete at IWPS.  It has been a dream of mine for over four years now to compete at this level, but I don't have the resources to make this dream a reality all on my own.  

So, I need your support.  

Where will your money be going?

1. All funds will be going directly to me

2. The funds will cover the cost of: 

    A. A plane ticket to Spokane from Lubbock ($500+)

    B. A shared hotel room for four nights ($230 approx.)

    C. Remaining registration fee for the event ($150)

    D. Basic food needs for the four days of travel ($120)

3. My best estimate is that I will need approximately $1,150 in total

How about a little info on me?

Those of you in the poetry community know me as Charles Levett, the rest of you know me as Mr. Terry or simply Charles

  • I have been slamming competitively since 2009 and have qualified for 2 different National Poetry Slam Teams. In 2010 I took a long break from poetry, but have returned in 2012 to represent Team Phoenix in Charlotte, North Carolina

  • I am the former 5, 6, 7, and 8 grade Science Teacher from Capitol Elementary, Heard Elementary, and Pattengill Middle School (Phoenix Elementary School District #1 and the Lansing School District). I have devoted a large part of my professional life as a teacher to helping my students find strength in their voice through accountable talk, but now it is my turn to take the stage

  • As you now know, my background is diverse and multi-faceted. I have experienced multiple degrees of hardship in ways personal and professional. I have interacted with communities both bureaucratic and creative. I have travelled across the United States in the pursuit of prompting the exceeding success of others, understanding that my motley background and the perspective that I have developed throughout my life makes me well-equipped to enrich, refine, and supplement the lives of others. Yesterday, I enlightened  the minds of students, both as a peer and a teacher, and I connected with local populations through writing poetry. Today, I look forward to my employment with a Housing department, knowing that I can continue to foster positive growth in all of the people I interact with… and, yes, I still can’t wait to continue writing the rest of my story here in Texas with your help.

story:
What the book is about:

The Prince and His Knight is a novella (approx. 40k words) about a prince who longs for freedom and the knight that saves his life.

The book is not only a gay romance, it touches on subjects, courage, believing in yourself, the complexities of sexuality, gender stereotypes, parenthood and more.

The story takes place in the fairytale kingdom of Entia.  I picked a fairytale theme for this novella because I feel like fairytales teach us values, some good and some bad. Even though the story is written like a fairytale, it's for adults.

Read Chapters 1-3 *Unedited* on my Website: http://www.kaycimorgan.com/the-prince-and-his-knight.html

 

How the funds will be used:

  • Line Editing
  • Marketing

The first draft is finished and I'm currently in the revision stage working to make this novella the best it can be.

 

About Me:

I've been writing for the past seventeen years, starting with a notebook I passed around my high school classroom filled with tales of a teenage girl that had nothing but one dramatic event after another happen to her.

Over the years, I submitted works to contests, anthologies and magazines and got many of them published. However, I always felt disconnected from my stories after that. I never really knew if anyone read them or liked them.

Then I discovered self-publishing. With self-publishing I'm right there with my audience. I know exactly how people feel about my stories. And the biggest request I've gotten is to produce a longer work. I'm usually a short story writer, but I had to try. So I took my style, my tastes and stretched them beyond my usual limits and I came up with The Prince and His Knight.

I'm quite proud of what I've written, and I can't wait to share it with the world. I started this campaign, because I want the work I share to be as polished as I can possibly get it. After all, there are people that believe in my writing, and I'd hate to let them down.

 

Other ways you can help:

Even if you can't afford to donate. You can help this project by posting it to Twitter, Facebook, Google+ and wherever else you can think of to help get the word out.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Wayne Hicks, and I am a writer. I have been asked to help write a book about the only survivor of the infamous "Freeway Killer", William Bonin, who murdered at least 21 young men and boys between 1979 and 1980 in Southern California. David McVicker, whom you can meet in the video above and who was only 14 at the time Bonin picked him up hitch-hiking, raped him anally and actually began to strangle him to death, said he "called out to God to save him," and Bonin--who had never shown any remorse for any of his killings--suddenly released him, drove him close to his home and let him escape alive. 

Months later, David was hitch-hiking again--but this time it was because he was going to testify at Bonin's trial, the only victim who could ever do so, and had no ride to the courthouse.

However, that was not the end of the story, for David has since suffered terribly from nightmares and PTSD, and you can see signs of these effects in his video, above. During the 16 years that Bonin was on California's Death Row, David was often vilified for his testimony, which helped to send this monster to his death. He has been abused by those who believe that his experience has left him somehow unworthy of compassion. He has been beaten, cursed, and threatened for his continuing work to see that Bonin's accomplices, who are also doing time for the murders they participated in, do not get back to the streets, where they can harm anyone else. 

One of those accomplices, James Michael Munro, is going up for parole January 28th, and David will be present to encourage the Parole Board not to release this man who has said that he will kill again if he is granted his freedom, and has even stated that he is hoping to have David killed to prevent his appearance at this hearing.

Despite beatings, threats and many other kinds of trauma, David has always maintained that--as two of the victims' mothers pleaded with him to do at Bonin's trial--it was up to him to speak up for all of the boys who did not escape, and for every victim of horrific abuse, because he knows first hand how hard it is to bear the stigma of being so treated. David says that he never got the help he needed to let him recover from that barely-missed appointment with death, and prays that his story might help parents and loved ones of other victims to understand that surviving doesn't just mean you live through it... it means you live through it over and over again.

Bonin's story was retold in 2010, in a movie entitled "The Freeway Killer", which can be found at http://www.hulu.com/watch/291064. David's book will be entitled "Raped Again, by David McVicker" and we are desperately trying to make it available before Munro's parole hearing in late January. If you believe David's story should be told, please help us to do so, and tell others about this need, as well.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to get the book finished and published by January 25th, 2014. IN order to accomplish this, both David and I must drop everything else and work long hours every day until then. I have arranged for rush printing of enough copies to pass out to press, since David's story may help to keep Munro confined, where his kind belongs

In return for your help, we'll be sending out eBooks versions, autographed print copies and our deepest personal gratitude for your help. David will write each contributor personally, to offer his thanks for your support in his quest to speak out for those who were murdered, and for other victims of horrific abuse, torture and even murder.

The Impact

By contributing to this campaign, you'll be helping David to tell his incredible story of the Miracle that left him alive, and of his dedication to a cause that has brought him nothing but pain and hardship, but there is far more to it than that. 

You'll also be helping to keep a psychopath behind bars where he belongs, for David's story will show clearly what such men are truly like. Munro has written many public pleas for his freedom, claiming that he was also a victim, but in 2009, while on a  telephone radio interview from prison, he snarled that he had killed others that he was never prosecuted for and would kill again when he got out, because he enjoyed the way it made him feel!

You'll be helping the many thousands of victims of abuse who suffer daily with the nightmares and memories that have almost destroyed David, for by sharing his own story, we believe he will help them to understand that it was not their fault, and help their families and loved ones to accept them despite what happened to them. David was unable to tell even his mother what had been done to him for years, and she finally learned the truth only as he sat on the witness stand at Bonin's sentencing hearing. Had he been able to open himself and tell her, psychologists have told him, he might have been able to heal and recover, but he is now permanently, emotionally scarred. 

And finally, you'll be helping many other victims of abuse, for when the press releases about this book go out, we firmly believe it will reach throughout the world. And David has pledged to donate ten percent of all revenues from the book to The National Center for Missing and Exploited Children.

We can only thank God that David was spared that day, and that despite the pain and fear that haunts him to this day, he has devoted his life to trying to make sure no one is ever treated this way again!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Please, use the sharing tools on this page to tell everyone you can about this campaign and how important it is. Post about it to your Facebook, Tweet about it, tell everyone you possibly can and help David turn his rape and near-murder into a blessing for the rest of the world!
story_txt: Short SummaryMy name is Wayne Hicks, and I am a writer. I have been asked to help write a book about the only survivor of the infamous "Freeway Killer", William Bonin, who murdered at least 21 young men and boys between 1979 and 1980 in Southern California. David McVicker, whom you can meet in the video above and who was only 14 at the time Bonin picked him up hitch-hiking, raped him anally and actually began to strangle him to death, said he "called out to God to save him," and Bonin--who had never shown any remorse for any of his killings--suddenly released him, drove him close to his home and let him escape alive. Months later, David was hitch-hiking again--but this time it was because he was going to testify at Bonin's trial, the only victim who could ever do so, and had no ride to the courthouse.However, that was not the end of the story, for David has since suffered terribly from nightmares and PTSD, and you can see signs of these effects in his video, above. During the 16 years that Bonin was on California's Death Row, David was often vilified for his testimony, which helped to send this monster to his death. He has been abused by those who believe that his experience has left him somehow unworthy of compassion. He has been beaten, cursed, and threatened for his continuing work to see that Bonin's accomplices, who are also doing time for the murders they participated in, do not get back to the streets, where they can harm anyone else. One of those accomplices, James Michael Munro, is going up for parole January 28th, and David will be present to encourage the Parole Board not to release this man who has said that he will kill again if he is granted his freedom, and has even stated that he is hoping to have David killed to prevent his appearance at this hearing.Despite beatings, threats and many other kinds of trauma, David has always maintained that--as two of the victims' mothers pleaded with him to do at Bonin's trial--it was up to him to speak up for all of the boys who did not escape, and for every victim of horrific abuse, because he knows first hand how hard it is to bear the stigma of being so treated. David says that he never got the help he needed to let him recover from that barely-missed appointment with death, and prays that his story might help parents and loved ones of other victims to understand that surviving doesn't just mean you live through it... it means you live through it over and over again.Bonin's story was retold in 2010, in a movie entitled "The Freeway Killer", which can be found at http://www.hulu.com/watch/291064. David's book will be entitled "Raped Again, by David McVicker" and we are desperately trying to make it available before Munro's parole hearing in late January. If you believe David's story should be told, please help us to do so, and tell others about this need, as well.What We Need & What You GetOur goal is to get the book finished and published by January 25th, 2014. IN order to accomplish this, both David and I must drop everything else and work long hours every day until then. I have arranged for rush printing of enough copies to pass out to press, since David's story may help to keep Munro confined, where his kind belongsIn return for your help, we'll be sending out eBooks versions, autographed print copies and our deepest personal gratitude for your help. David will write each contributor personally, to offer his thanks for your support in his quest to speak out for those who were murdered, and for other victims of horrific abuse, torture and even murder.The ImpactBy contributing to this campaign, you'll be helping David to tell his incredible story of the Miracle that left him alive, and of his dedication to a cause that has brought him nothing but pain and hardship, but there is far more to it than that. You'll also be helping to keep a psychopath behind bars where he belongs, for David's story will show clearly what such men are truly like. Munro has written many public pleas for his freedom, claiming that he was also a victim, but in 2009, while on a  telephone radio interview from prison, he snarled that he had killed others that he was never prosecuted for and would kill again when he got out, because he enjoyed the way it made him feel!You'll be helping the many thousands of victims of abuse who suffer daily with the nightmares and memories that have almost destroyed David, for by sharing his own story, we believe he will help them to understand that it was not their fault, and help their families and loved ones to accept them despite what happened to them. David was unable to tell even his mother what had been done to him for years, and she finally learned the truth only as he sat on the witness stand at Bonin's sentencing hearing. Had he been able to open himself and tell her, psychologists have told him, he might have been able to heal and recover, but he is now permanently, emotionally scarred. And finally, you'll be helping many other victims of abuse, for when the press releases about this book go out, we firmly believe it will reach throughout the world. And David has pledged to donate ten percent of all revenues from the book to The National Center for Missing and Exploited Children.We can only thank God that David was spared that day, and that despite the pain and fear that haunts him to this day, he has devoted his life to trying to make sure no one is ever treated this way again!Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Please, use the sharing tools on this page to tell everyone you can about this campaign and how important it is. Post about it to your Facebook, Tweet about it, tell everyone you possibly can and help David turn his rape and near-murder into a blessing for the rest of the world!

story:
The Story

The overwhelming majority of U.S. military members serve our country with honor and integrity. Many risk their lives on a daily basis to protect and defend not only our great nation and people, but also the nations and peoples of the world. I have had the honor and privilege to serve with the men and women of the U.S. Navy for the majority of my life, and I can say without reservation that they are the most amazing, dedicated, and courageous people you will ever meet.

This book is not about them.

This book is instead about the practices of the commercial sex industry near a few overseas U.S. military bases, and how a small number of servicemen have been lured into participating in this evil business.

A Few Bad Men will present a brutally accurate account of sex trade operators near some of our overseas locations, and of U.S. servicemember’s participation in their exploitation of sex-trafficked victims and forced prostitutes. While most people are no doubt familiar with the tales of foreign prostitutes and our servicemen stationed overseas, few are likely aware of the extent to which sex traffickers are operating just outside our base gates, or of the physical and psychological damage inflicted upon the victims of their appalling business.

Weaving together a wide variety of sources – case reports and field research from international organizations, U.S. State Department reports, recent military cases involving human trafficking and prostitution, interviews of servicemembers and victims, and personal anecdotes - A Few Bad Men will expose this outrageous business and its destructive consequences to not only the victims and their families, but also to the reputation of our military forces abroad and to the strategic interests of the United States.

Why Tell This Story?

Unfortunately, there exists a subculture near some of our overseas military that not only condones sexual depravity but revels in it. Near bases and liberty ports in The Philippines, Thailand, Korea, Japan, and many others, sailors and soldiers are lured into engaging in reprehensible behavior with prostitutes and victims of sex trafficking. While senior military leadership and the majority of servicemembers are repulsed by this ugly business and are committed to ending its operations, it still continues to infect the morality and behavior of a few servicemembers.

The primary purpose of writing A Few Bad Men is to expose this abhorrent business and document the destructive consequences to both the victims and to the reputation of the United States abroad. My hope is that this will lead to a discussion about how to bring this repugnant behavior and the subculture that enables it to an end.

However, there is a second and equally worthy purpose for writing this book. There is a disturbing epidemic of sexual misconduct currently sweeping through our military. In the fiscal year ending in September 2013, more than 5,000 sexual assault complaints were filed, a 60% increase over 2012, when 3,374 were filed!

Why is this happening? Some DoD representatives deny the numbers represent an actual increase, instead suggesting the rise is due primarily to increased reporting while the number of incidents has remained relatively steady.

Perhaps this excuse accounts for some of the increased reporting, but it leaves unanswered the far more important question. Why are there so many incidents occurring in the first place? An anonymous survey conducted in early 2013 indicated that as many as 26,000 service members encountered some type of unwanted sexual contact or sexual assault!

The second purpose of this book is to illustrate the link between this subculture of depravity and the behavior of some servicemembers when they are at work. Any person who believes it is ok to victimize young girls who are forced into prostitution by poverty and hopelessness (or even trafficked into it), quite obviously has a lack of respect for all women. Of course he is going to carry that lack of respect and his objectification of women into the workplace, and then treat his female coworkers with the same lack of respect.

By exposing this destructive subculture, I hope to help bring an end to the epidemic of sexual misconduct in our military.

Why Indiegogo?

With your help, I can complete A Few Bad Men by the end of 2014. My ambitious schedule of completing the book and preparing it for publication in early 2015 can only be met if I raise my minimum goal of $25,000. This amount is necessary to pay for the additional research needed to finish the book, as well as the publication, marketing, and distribution expenses necessary to release it.

If I do not reach the minimum goal, I will still complete the book and publish it, but the dates will almost certainly be delayed.

If I am fortunate enough to surpass this goal, I will use the additional funds to enhance the production value of the book and pay costly editing, marketing, and distribution expenses.

Rewards

I have a large selection of rewards and gifts available for anyone who makes a pledge to help get this book written. Here are a few examples of some of the great rewards available:

  • Have your name appear in a special “Thank You” section on the book’s website or in the credits.
  • Get access to a pre-release digital download of the completed book.
  • You can even host an exclusive discussion in your community with me present to discuss the book as well as human trafficking and answer questions.

The timescale I have set for the delivery of rewards is a rough estimate and I will do all I can to get them to you at the indicated time. Delivery of some of the rewards, however, could directly be affected by delays I may encounter while completing the book. Please rest assured that all rewards will be delivered and I will do my upmost to send them to you as soon as possible.

Additional information about rewards:

  • Travel, lodging and local transportation to hosted discussions are not included in any reward bundle.
  • Some rewards may require additional paperwork (to protect me and you).
  • The distribution schedule is not finalized, but Indiegogo backers at $25 and above will receive a digital version approximately one week prior to the official release.

Other Ways to Help

In addition to making your valued donations, there are more ways you can help. I am always on the lookout for new information and would appreciate contributions of personal anecdotes and material related to this book. If you believe you have information that would be valuable, please contact me at: gregg.parker@afewbadmen.org.

Finally

Please “Share” & “Tweet” about this project. The more people who hear about this campaign, the better chance I have of raising the necessary funds to make this book possible.

Editors, Publishers, and other Media Organizations

I am leaning towards self-publishing A Few Bad Men, but I am definitely open to working with a professional publisher. In fact, it is my intention to submit a manuscript to several publishers upon completion before going the self-publishing route.

However, if this is a project you believe your publishing house or media organization may be interested in, please contact me at: gregg.parker@afewbadmen.org.

My ultimate goal is to get this book published and distributed as widely as possible, and I want to be sure I investigate every avenue for doing so. I hope to hear from you!

story:
***  Our campaign has ended, but the journey has just begun, follow us here for updates and photos from our hospital visits:

www.Facebook.com/PurpeeTheDragon ***

Purpee the Purple Dragon is the the main character in our new children’s book series. Purpee will serve to inspire kids around the world and allow children with pediatric cancer to live vicariously through an adventurous purple dragon and his friends.

Here’s our story, our project details and how you can help us make it happen….

It all started one night during our bedtime routine of reading books and telling stories to our 3 young kids. I made up a story about a purple dragon named Purpee, and his friends.  My kids loved the story and started asking for Purpee stories every night.  Each night Purpee seemed to become a little more adventurous.

One night my daughter Brianna had an idea, “Why don’t we turn these stories into a kids book series?”… and building on her inspiration I tried to think of a way we could make these books different from all of the other great children’s books out there, and then it hit me.

We got to work right away. Brianna started writing the manuscript and brainstorming more adventures. Then we started sketching. First Brianna, then me, and then we hired an illustrator to bring our characters to life. The next thing we knew; Purpee the Purple Dragon, Stinky the Skunk, Shelly and Sunny, twin turtles, and Smokey the Dragon were alive……

Our project is to produce the first 2 books in the Purpee the Purple Dragon series and print 2,500 copies to give out to pediatric cancer patients in hospitals across the US – your backing will help us to do this.

This book series will inspire children with cancer allowing them to live through this dragon, making these books different from most other children’s books.

We will read the books to the children and then spend time asking them what adventures they would like to see Purpee and his friends go on next.

What adventures would they go on if they could?

We will encourage their imaginations, collect their ideas, and even have them create some of the scenes, just like my 7-year-old daughter did for the first 2 books.

Then, we will collect the thoughts and pictures and use them to write more books in the series, which will include the names of those children that contributed. These sick children will live through Purpee and his friends….

And if you think this project couldn’t be any more special – here’s another memorable part of it.  Late last year a brave 10-year-old boy from our town, Michael Feeney, sadly passed away after struggling with a rare form of cancer.  Not only did he inspire a community, but he inspired Brianna and I in planning this project and also led us to a great organization, Go 4 the Goal, that has helped us to coordinate with the 12 hospitals that we will be visiting.  Michael exhibited many of the qualities of our adventurous Purpee the Purple Dragon and we will be dedicating the first book in our series to his memory.

Our plan is to visit the following hospitals, but we will expand to the west coast and other parts of the US if funding allows....

Yale New Haven Children's Hospital
Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Massachusetts General Hospital
The Children's Hospital at Albany Medical Center
Joseph M. Sanzari Children's Hospital 
St Peter's University Hospital 
Cohen Children's Medical Center of NY
Children's Hospital of Philadelphia
St. Christopher's Hospital for Children
Nemours/Alfred I. DuPont Hospital for Children
Children's National Medical Center
Lombardi Comprehensive Cancer Center

Did you know that more than 11,000 young people are diagnosed with cancer every year?? And many of them will spend most of their lives in and out of hospitals lonely and depressed.  While Brianna and I can’t cure cancer, we can bring Purpee’s adventures to these children, and then, through the book series, help them to create their own adventures, even if they are in a hospital.

So now we need your help!! The first two manuscripts are written (see descriptions below), the illustrator is ready to go, and hundreds of kids in 12 hospitals are waiting to be inspired…. 

Your financial support will fund the production and printing of the first two books and our trips to the hospitals. Our goal is to print 2,500 books. If we exceed our goal, we will go to more hospitals, give out more books, and inspire more children.

We plan on giving these sick children the chance to experience adventures that they may never get to live out.

Not only will you feel good about supporting this project, but we have created some great rewards (see below).

We have one month to fund this project - we hope you’ll join us today. 

Purpee the Purple Dragon is the main character in this new and exciting children’s books series.

The cast of characters in Purpee’s world are Stinky the Skunk, Shelly and Sunny – sister and brother twin turtle’s, and Smoky the Dragon who invariably can be found accompanying Purpee on his adventures.

Each book contains a moral lesson, which is cleverly hidden within the words of the story. Through my own lessons of hands-on parenting, I have learned that entertaining a child with a story that is engaging and exciting is more effective than simply lecturing them on the ‘right’ thing to do.

For most pledges you will receive in return perks/rewards.  In addition to the two books described above, perks/rewards for pledges also include a cool Purpee hologram bookmark as well cool kids t-shirts.  These are perfect gifts for all children.  What kid wouldn't like a dragon t-shirt?

Details of each perk are listed along the entire right column of this page. You can see images of all perks/rewards below. You should receive your awards in September....

On behalf of all of the pediatric cancer patients that these books will inspire and make laugh, Brianna and I thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

You can stay updated on our journey through our social media outlets on which we will post updates and photos from our visits to the hospitals across the US.


Click here to follow our journey on Facebook.


Click here to follow us on Twitter.

story:
What This is For

Hi, I’m Esther Mathieu.  I’m 18, and I’m a college student living in New York City.  Every summer for the last three years, I’ve attended the Rena’s Promise International Creative Writing Camp.  I’ve taken poetry and fiction classes, gone to shows, talked to writers, engaged with the literary world, and grown an incredible amount in my own writing.  This year, I’m going back as a counselor, but for every one of the times I’ve attended the camp as a student, my time there has been made possible by scholarships from the Rena’s Promise Foundation.  Many of my friends and I would never have been able to go at all if we hadn’t had the financial support.  This year, the foundation really needs help raising money for scholarships for the camp’s students.  I’m trying to raise $600 to support the camp.  Rena’s Promise is the place in which I have most grown, and I have watched the other campers grow—in themselves, in their voices, in their writing—just as much.  I hope you’ll be able to help us help new young writers find their voices, help them grow and learn and have just as much fun as I have.  Thank you.

What We Need

I'm trying to raise $600, which is enough to pay for one student's scholarship to camp.  Anything past that would be fantastic, and will also go to the Rena's Promise Foundation and to the operation of the camp.  If I don't reach my goal of $600, the money will, again, still go to the Rena's Promise Foundation--anything will be a help in paying for housing and food for the camp, as well as for the camp staff.

The Impact

Bit by bit, I've watched the arts slip out of schools.  Places like Rena's Promise are vital to the preservation of new voices, and the development of new writers.  We write to learn, and to teach, to tell the truth and understand it.  And we come to camp every year because it is here that we have found teachers who are enthusiastic about helping us grow, peers who love the written word, and a community that supports us, challenges us, and makes our writing better.  We need places like this if we are to become a new generation of writers, if we are to keep the arts alive.  And we need funding if places like Rena's Promise are to stay afloat, and if young writers are to develop their voices, regardless of where they come from or how much money they have.

to shows, talked to writers, engaged with the literary world, and grown an incredible amount
in my own writing.  This year, I’m going
back as a counselor, but for every one of the times I’ve attended the camp as a
student, my time there has been made possible by scholarships from the
Rena’s Promise Foundation.  Many of my
friends and I would never have been able to go at all if we hadn’t had the
financial support.  This year, the
foundation really needs help raising money for scholarships for the
camp’s students.  I’m trying to raise
$600 to support the camp.  Rena’s Promise
is the place in which I have most grown, and I have watched the other campers
grow—in themselves, in their voices, in their writing—just as much.  I hope you’ll be able to help us help new
young writers find their voices, help them grow and learn and have just as much
fun as I have.  Thank you.   What We Need I'm trying to raise $600, which is enough to pay for one student's scholarship to camp.  Anything past that would be fantastic, and will also go to the Rena's Promise Foundation and to the operation of the camp.  If I don't reach my goal of $600, the money will, again, still go to the Rena's Promise Foundation--anything will be a help in paying for housing and food for the camp, as well as for the camp staff.
The Impact
 Bit by bit, I've watched the arts slip out of schools.  Places like Rena's Promise are vital to the preservation of new voices, and the development of new writers.  We write to learn, and to teach, to tell the truth and understand it.  And we come to camp every year because it is here that we have found teachers who are enthusiastic about helping us grow, peers who love the written word, and a community that supports us, challenges us, and makes our writing better.  We need places like this if we are to become a new generation of writers, if we are to keep the arts alive.  And we need funding if places like Rena's Promise are to stay afloat, and if young writers are to develop their voices, regardless of where they come from or how much money they have.

story:
Dear Community, Friends, Family, and those I have yet to meet,

My Story:

I entered the cocoon of my Soul's journey in August of 2011. I quickly became a cellular soup of dismembered parts not knowing who I was. With the support of my therapist, Somatic Therapy cohort, spiritual practices, and community, I worked with my dismembered parts, shadows, sexuality, anger, power, roles, identities, and insecurities. Transformation began taking place; old parts of me started dying and I began to heal and come into my wholeness. During this time, I connected to my Soul's imagery through dance, expressive arts, body-based awareness, Jungian inquiry, dreamwork, spiritual channeling, and by talking to the creatures that showed up at my doorstep. In June of 2013 while on a vision fast in the wilderness with Animas Valley Institute I emerged from my cocoon and I have not been the same since. 

I transformed from caterpillar to butterfly...from girl to woman...from being hidden to being seen...and from Julia to Ruby. I have come into my wholeness, my Dharma, and my Soul's purpose. I feel ripe and overflowing, ready to offer what I do to the larger World in service of something much larger than me. I am ready to step into the revolutionary that I am in service of manifesting balance on this planet.

My Soul revealed to me, that my purpose is that of a "channel". I channel Ancient feminine mysteries through my writing, art, and performance. I am a voice for the unheard voices! I also connect to people at a Soul level and inspire them into their Soul's purpose like a Dharma Doula, and I connect to those who are dying (or have already passed) and need help transitioning into the spirit world as a Death Doula. Please go to www.rubyreveals.com if you would like to learn more about me, my story, my writings, my offerings and my spoken word.

Because Channeling is my Soul's purpose and my reason for living...it comes natural to me. I have been "training" for lifetimes!

Side note: I realize not everyone experiences the safe spaces, opportunities, and privilege to do the kind of work that allows them to live in their purpose. To me, acknowledging my privilege does not mean sitting back in gluttony, greed, and presumed power. To me, acknowledging my privilege means getting my hands dirty, standing up for those whose voices are repressed, and doing something big that changes the World! 

My Campaign: 

Through my recent dreams, meditations and channeled messages, I have been given my next task. I am to go to the Mediterranean (the vagina of the World) to connect to the history of the land in relation to the Dark Goddess and channel messages for my next book. My book will be a combination of channeled messages from the Dark Goddess, my personal memoir, Heroine's journey, and the marriage/symbiosis of the divine masculine and divine feminine working together.

Who is the Dark Goddess?

To me, the Dark Goddess is the aspect of creation that most people fear, thus, she is highly "taboo", repressed, and projected onto with hate. She is Kali, the Black Madonna, Mary Magdalene, Medusa and the sacred whore. She is the Earth, the soil, the mud, the Soul, the death of lies, the death of what's fake and primmed to look pretty. She is the place from which we form from and the place we dissolve back into when we die. She is ecstatic and orgasmic; she is ultimate desire, the desire that has us longing to live in our purpose and in our aliveness. She is the dance, the unknown, and the vaginal canal to the witchy wise cauldron of feminine mysteries. She is the aspect of creation that is typically called the "witch", "bitch" or "whore" yet, she is desired by everyone and we deeply long for her. She is boundless love...ultimate cosmic compassion!

"The dark goddesses represent the hidden and suppressed archetypal aspects of a woman AND man’s psyche that lives unseen in the shadows of the personality. These dark aspects contain all the characteristics that have been ‘demonized’ by the patriarchal society. It is evident that these aspects are regarded as chaotic and even anarchistic by society, both modern and ancient. In order to know oneself, one needs to intimately know and understand both light and dark aspects. As an authentic being, you are empowered and free to allow both the dark and light aspects of self to alchemize. The alchemical process of transformation needs the initial step of acceptance. Acceptance entails the suspension of the judgement of what is dark and light, or good and bad, or desirable and undesirable. In the alchemical process the polarities or opposites dissolve and a third way of being is born." -Jalaja Bonheim

My GOAL, WHY this is important to me and HOW this relates to the larger World:

My Goal is to write and perform about this "taboo" and to speak from her in order to help the "shadow" areas of existence become more integrated in the World and thus more BALANCE can occur between the masculine and feminine working in symbiosis. When the shadow is "disowned" we act towards it in unconscious ways. In the current world we live in, the masculine energy is oftentimes acting without the balance of, or respect for, the feminine. I personally believe that the magnification of masculine energy and simultaneous disregard of the feminine leads to unconscious grasping, raping, disconnection, corruption, competition, arrogant independence, dominance, over-production and greed.

In present day society this can be seen in the objectification of women, violence towards gay men, inequality in financial support for jobs related to art, shamanism or right brain vs. jobs related to investment banking, oil or left brain, fear-driven methods of political and religious control, unchecked consumerism, cultural appropriation, spiritual bypassing, racial prejudice, and environmental degradation. This magnification of the "masculine" without the balance of the "feminine" feeds linear, hierarchical and dichotomous ways of thinking that lead to oppression. This may be why natives to the land as well as male or female bodied people who feel more fully connected to the feminine aspect of creation in terms of life path and/or way of being are also feeling forgotten, unappreciated, degraded, and stripped of resources.

Why the Mediterranean?

Since my Soul's path is that of a channel, when I am in a location I can allow my system to merge with the area around me, and I deliver the messages that flow through me in the process. The Mediterranean is rich with our ancestor's history, early civilizations, the Etruscians, early paganism, the black virgins, the Gnostic-Christian underground, the Knights Templar, the crusades, and the protection of the Holy Grail. I am on a quest to uncover lost feminine wisdom and reveal what pours through me in service of the larger collective. This book is meant to inspire the feminine revolution that is already taking place. To shed light on the aspects of duality and collective consciousness that we often avoid, dismiss, rape, grasp, hate or fear. The more we interact with and engage with the repressed aspects of creation, the more we embrace them and are less likely to unconsciously act out towards them.

Creative Travel Partner:

I am looking for a creative travel partner to share this experience with and co-create something together in service of the larger cause of the feminine revolution.

If the statements below resonate with you, then you may be my creative travel partner! Contact me at ruby@rubyreveals.com

* I am an Earth Guardian.

* I feel inspired by this Revolution and want to support balance on this planet.

* I have done a great deal of healing work, have come into a place of wholeness, and am living in my Soul's purpose.

* I feel inspired to create for a larger cause (film, photography, writing, performance, poetry etc.)

* I am creative. I understand artistry and the creative mind. I feel inspired to create something on my own in addition to a co-collaboration with Ruby.

* I enjoy the beauty of life and enjoy slower-paced traveling in which I really get to soak in a location and the local way of living.

* I am at ease alone AND in relationship. I practice conscious communication and know how to say yes, no, express my needs, and honor my boundaries.

* I know how to take personal responsibility for my feelings and needs. In other words, I don't play the Blame/Shame game.

* I am attracted to traveling to the Mediterranean. I have been drawn their for my own reasons.

* I am honest, playful and responsible.

* I don't have any addictions to substances and I'm not a big partier...but that doesn't mean I don't like to dance!

Financial Support: 

Please contribute to this cause! It will help me and my creative partner be big voices for the suppressed voices. It will help us change the World through art.

Your contributions will go to both my creative partner and I's plane tickets, food and lodging while we work on our individual and collaborative creative projects.

The goal is 23,339. This goal showed up as reasonable when I sat down to calculate plane tickets, lodging and food.

If I do not reach my goal, them my creative partner and I will create something in the United States. It may have a different flavor, but it will certainly be for the same cause...this Revolution in BALANCE.

Other Support:

While reading this campaign...if anything comes to mind around locations to travel to or people you know that may be willing to host us. This kind of support is also greatly welcomed and appreciated!

Also, please share this campaign, get the word out, and make some noise! 

The Impact:

You supporting this campaign will help get some momentum going in the Feminine Revolution. It will help catalyze change that supports the reciprocal nature of the divine masculine and divine feminine working in symbiosis. It will honor Kali! It will also help those people around the World whose voices are suppressed and repressed to be heard through the art that my creative partner and I create.

When my book is published and I am financially rich...I will certainly pay this forward to continue supporting others in their contributions to this revolution!

story:
Where We Started:

TORTILLAGURL began with Melissa in 2015 as a sticker. Then it began again a couple months later as a comic book series. It also began again as an interview blog in 2016. After that, it was a vlog. Finally, late 2016, Nicole, Dominik and Shae joined in and began the process of crafting a TORTILLAGURL zine. 

We decided that the elements of TG's past forms weren't completely trash, they just lacked unification. We wanted to give a voice to every low key artist in the city, a shoutout to all the underdogs in a different way. Celebrating art with a zine is one thing, but we wanted to make sure we gave back to y'all too! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

What we need from y'all is simple, zine costs money and we need money. We appreciate our following and need your love and support . This zine is made for you and we love sharing our work with you! Good vibes sent is always needed. Our zine is still a baby in this world, we're new! So hype would be great. After you receive our gifts snap a picture and shout us out!

Those gifts you get when you donate is part of our TG pal merchandise. That includes our zine, stickers, keychains, the TG pal friend bracelet and most importantly our love❣️. Large donations receive all of the above, a special edition of our zine and shouts out on our Instagram and Facebook. 

Here of some of the perks:

(THIS ITEM IS SECRET AND CAN ONLY BE OBTAINED VIA URL)

 

The Impact

The donations go to the production of the zine, equipment for our events and of course, payment for our performers at the clothes swap. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that's all good! You can always follow us on IG (@tg.http://www.instagram.com/tgzinezine), submit your art, give us a shoutout or just show love when you see us. We love the love and appreciate any kind gestures!

story:
Story of My Book

Lol i love u is a book about all things online dating—and I don’t just mean dating apps. Today, more than ever, people are finding love online, whether on Tinder, Instagram, Snapchat, etc., and I’m here to tell some hilarious, horrific and hopefully helpful stories that will give you some clarity in your digital search for “the one.” 

My name is Isabella Vaccaro and I am the author of Lol i love u. I wrote this book because I found myself thrust into the world of online dating without a clue as to how it worked or, rather, if it really worked at all. Writing this book has opened my eyes to the pitfalls as well as the wonders of the digital love era and how exactly we should navigate it. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how to date intentionally online. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I now have for online dating, because I know it can be a source of stress and anxiety. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you view dating apps and online dating with a positive attitude, as well as arm you with examples and specific tips to maximize your time on these apps and make some amazing connections. 

In this book, you'll learn about dating apps and how to use them according to dating app CEOs, dating coaches and other experts, and how sometimes too many options can be detrimental to your happiness. You'll hear stories such as...

  • My own dating app experiment, where I go on a month-long Hinge swiping spree and tell you about the outcomes of my dates.
  • How two roommates found themselves in a Snapchat-group-turned-gay-dating app as boys from around the east coast attempted to meet people in the Covid-19 pandemic.
  • The story of two strangers who fell in love on OkCupid and decided to make their own dating app—Curius—to help others date with intention, too.

 

You will love this book if you feel completely overwhelmed logging onto the seven different dating apps on your iPhone, are looking to find a relationship (or even just a hook-up) in the era of Covid-19 and digital love, or simply can’t get enough juicy gossip on hook-ups gone wrong, ghost-town stories, or catfish disasters. 

Lol i love u is a nonfiction book that speaks to college-aged students or really anyone looking for love online and are running out of interesting ways to say “Hey” to their 800 matches on Tinder, Bumble, Hinge...well, you get the point.

 

The Book - Lol, i love u 

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + Chapters 1 and 2. Chapter 1 will take you on a journey through the dating scripts, starting from the calling era of the 1900s all the way through today’s murky waters of hooking up and running away from labels. And that’s exactly why I am writing this book—to further define this confusing time in the history of dating. In Chapter 2, I put it all on the line and swipe furiously for a month straight, go on dates and tell you all the nitty gritty details of my infamous Hinge Experiment.

Part 2 contains Chapters 3-10. In the bulk of the book, you will learn the best practices for using dating apps, how to transition smoothly from messaging online into a date, the do’s and don’ts of meeting romantic partners on apps like Snapchat and Instagram, how to date with intention, the risks of sexual violence from dating apps and even a phenomenon called “choice burnout,” which can set in after you’ve been swiping a little too much. 

Part 3 contains Chapter 11, the conclusion, in which I reflect on my own performance in using the tips in this book and encourage you to get on these apps and make it happen. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021. 
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now: 

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Isabella Vaccaro is a senior at the University of Miami studying journalism. Writing has always been her fiercest passion, and she’s freelanced for various publications including the Miami Herald, Whisky Advocate Magazine, Indulge Magazine and more. 

Isabella is innately curious about life and the way the world works. So, naturally, when faced with a world of dating that felt unfamiliar and daunting, and that is rarely portrayed on TV or talked about at all, she decided to investigate all there was to know about it. Now a diligent student of all things dating apps and digital communication, Isabella hopes to share her knowledge with anyone needing a little guidance in this department or maybe just a laugh from some of the crazy stories in her book. 

When she’s not writing, Isabella might be found singing, dancing or acting, as she’s been a self-proclaimed theatre nerd since the age of 12. She also loves to play tennis, swim in the ocean and try out every gluten and dairy-free dessert recipe under the sun with her little sister. 

For more information, you can connect with Isabella Vaccaro at isabellavaccaro5@gmail.com and at @isabellavaccar0 on Instagram. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Loliloveuand tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Isabella

Lol i love u is a book about all things online dating—and I don’t just mean dating apps. Today, more than ever, people are finding love online, whether on Tinder, Instagram, Snapchat, etc., and I’m here to tell some hilarious, horrific and hopefully helpful stories that will give you some clarity in your digital search for “the one.” My name is Isabella Vaccaro and I am the author of Lol i love u. I wrote this book because I found myself thrust into the world of online dating without a clue as to how it worked or, rather, if it really worked at all. Writing this book has opened my eyes to the pitfalls as well as the wonders of the digital love era and how exactly we should navigate it. My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how to date intentionally online. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I now have for online dating, because I know it can be a source of stress and anxiety. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you view dating apps and online dating with a positive attitude, as well as arm you with examples and specific tips to maximize your time on these apps and make some amazing connections. In this book, you'll learn about dating apps and how to use them according to dating app CEOs, dating coaches and other experts, and how sometimes too many options can be detrimental to your happiness. You'll hear stories such as...

My own dating app experiment, where I go on a month-long Hinge swiping spree and tell you about the outcomes of my dates.
How two roommates found themselves in a Snapchat-group-turned-gay-dating app as boys from around the east coast attempted to meet people in the Covid-19 pandemic.
The story of two strangers who fell in love on OkCupid and decided to make their own dating app—Curius—to help others date with intention, too.

 
You will love this book if you feel completely overwhelmed logging onto the seven different dating apps on your iPhone, are looking to find a relationship (or even just a hook-up) in the era of Covid-19 and digital love, or simply can’t get enough juicy gossip on hook-ups gone wrong, ghost-town stories, or catfish disasters. 
Lol i love u is a nonfiction book that speaks to college-aged students or really anyone looking for love online and are running out of interesting ways to say “Hey” to their 800 matches on Tinder, Bumble, Hinge...well, you get the point.
 
The Book - Lol, i love u 
The book is written in 3 parts.Part 1 contains the introduction + Chapters 1 and 2. Chapter 1 will take you on a journey through the dating scripts, starting from the calling era of the 1900s all the way through today’s murky waters of hooking up and running away from labels. And that’s exactly why I am writing this book—to further define this confusing time in the history of dating. In Chapter 2, I put it all on the line and swipe furiously for a month straight, go on dates and tell you all the nitty gritty details of my infamous Hinge Experiment.Part 2 contains Chapters 3-10. In the bulk of the book, you will learn the best practices for using dating apps, how to transition smoothly from messaging online into a date, the do’s and don’ts of meeting romantic partners on apps like Snapchat and Instagram, how to date with intention, the risks of sexual violence from dating apps and even a phenomenon called “choice burnout,” which can set in after you’ve been swiping a little too much. Part 3 contains Chapter 11, the conclusion, in which I reflect on my own performance in using the tips in this book and encourage you to get on these apps and make it happen. 
 

What We Need & What You Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021. 
The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.

 
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now: 

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
And much more!

 

About the Author
Isabella Vaccaro is a senior at the University of Miami studying journalism. Writing has always been her fiercest passion, and she’s freelanced for various publications including the Miami Herald, Whisky Advocate Magazine, Indulge Magazine and more. Isabella is innately curious about life and the way the world works. So, naturally, when faced with a world of dating that felt unfamiliar and daunting, and that is rarely portrayed on TV or talked about at all, she decided to investigate all there was to know about it. Now a diligent student of all things dating apps and digital communication, Isabella hopes to share her knowledge with anyone needing a little guidance in this department or maybe just a laugh from some of the crazy stories in her book. When she’s not writing, Isabella might be found singing, dancing or acting, as she’s been a self-proclaimed theatre nerd since the age of 12. She also loves to play tennis, swim in the ocean and try out every gluten and dairy-free dessert recipe under the sun with her little sister. For more information, you can connect with Isabella Vaccaro at isabellavaccaro5@gmail.com and at @isabellavaccar0 on Instagram. 
 
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 
Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Loliloveuand tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.
Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Isabella

story:
C’est la fin d’En t’attendant je déjeune au cidre de pomme.

Merci de nous avoir fait une place dans votre quotidien pendant un mois. C’est précieux. C’est encore plus privilégié d’y avoir accès quand ce quotidien-là se retrouve autant collectivement perturbé que dans les derniers temps.

Un immense merci aux co-directrices Vanessa Bell et Juliette Bernatchez. 

Si vous vous sentez lousse et que vous voulez laisser un petit montant, c'est la place pour le faire. Pas de culpabilité à rien laisser, d’accord ? On pensait pas passer le chapeau, mais on a appris qu’on aurait probablement pas nos subventions (c'est pas relié à la pandémie).

On vous embête pas plus longtemps. 

Merci du fond du coeur.

-samuel corbeil

Idéation et textes

-gabrielle ferron

Textes

-six volcans

Illustrations

story:
Story of My Book

The Boroughs is a satirical comedy book about New York City.

My name is Cristian Vargas and I am the author of The Boroughs. I wrote this book because I wanted to write something more down to earth to the experiences of New Yorkers outside of the portrayed dichotomy of the “crime/drug-dealing/trenches” type of New York and “the suburban girl moving to NYC to find herself” type of New York. I wanted to make something reminiscent of my own experiences within the city.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will just...laugh. I wrote this based on a series of skits, some even inspired by true stories. I then turned those skits into a coherent plotline. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with themes of change and how change can be different, bad, good, or indifferent. In all honesty, the deeper you think, the more you’ll get out of this book, but if you just want something surface level funny, then this is the right book for you.

The world is set in a fictional, yet realistic New York where the overarching themes of change, gentrification, politics, class, comedy, and a lil bit of booty, interact with the characters. The Boroughs is a coming of age story imbued with surrealist undertones of- sigh. Man...it’s a comedy exemplifying contemporary NYC culture. It’s wild. It’s bold. It's highly inappropriate at times, but it's New York.

This book follows the rotating perspectives of 4 college students, Abel, Marcus, Jordan, and Alex, as they navigate an everchanging city that seems to be leaving some of them behind. Abel is a comedian from the Bronx that is more than meets the eye. Marcus is a Ivy league college student dealing with the duality of progress and looking back to where he came from. Jordan is a heart on his sleeves kid dealing with an ever changing Brooklyn, unable to find himself within the place which once was so familiar. Alex is a college student activist from Queens who is overzealous in her mission for “justice.” These characters clash to give you a perspective not often seen in the portrayals of New York. Within their rotating perspectives, you’ll catch a glimpse into the crazy world that is The Boroughs.

The Boroughs speaks to the soul of the unheard and those who want to grapple with the existential crises of belonging. You will love this book if you love to live, love, laugh. But seriously, if you grew up watching shows like the Boondocks and love social commentary pieces then you’ll like this.

Ultimately, I hope that The Boroughs, outside of trolling, inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • Damn, do we really care about s*** as much as we say we do?
  • Can we only engage in activism through a lens of aesthetic?
  • Why can’t I find a job in my own city?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing these questions will make us do absolutely nothing, but at least we tried. 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book ($5,000), I will publish a paperback and ebook.
When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book ($6,000), I will also publish a hardcover edition.
When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book ($8,000), I will publish a hardcover(most def) and an audiobook(Ionno bout this tho).

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

About the Author

Cristian Vargas is a 21-year-old Dominican genius from Brooklyn. Upon being disillusioned by the mundaneness of college and the lack of belonging in his own city, he became passionate in comedic escapism, where “If [He] jokes about everything, then nothing can really harm [him].” This, propelled forth by his desire to anger people, inspired him to write The Boroughs. He hopes to show people a side of NYC that they may not be familiar with and to question our contemporary social tone. In his free time, he likes to apply to “entry level” jobs on LinkedIn in hopes he can find a job to afford the rising rent. For fun, he likes to write skits exemplifying the social zeitgeist of our contemporary times.

For more information, you can connect with Cristian Vargas at imcristianvargas@gmail.com and on IG @imcristianvargas

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheBoroughs and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Cristian Vargas

story:
Story of My Book

Love Story: An Encounter with God is about my experiences of not waiting and waiting until marriage to have sex, and the role that my faith played in the journey towards abstinence.

My name is Mellie Napolitano and I am the author of Love Story: An Encounter with God. I wrote this book to give readers hope that abstinence before marriage is an attainable and worthwhile endeavor.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how abstinence enables you to grow as a person. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to explore a challenging but exciting alternative to the hook-up culture.

In this book, you'll encounter multifaceted dimensions of romance, faith, and love through narratives like:

  • How college campus life challenged my beliefs regarding purity;
  • How physical intimacy, even with a committed partner, led me to feel distant from myself and from God; and,
  • How the sacrament of reconciliation forced me to be honest with myself and my partner about boundaries.

Love Story: An Encounter with God speaks to young adults and their mentors who are grappling with the themes of romance, love, and faith. The book inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • Is abstinence from sexual activity really possible in today’s hook-up culture?
  • Why would someone wait until marriage to have sex?
  • What’s the point in waiting if you are someone who’s not a virgin anymore? 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book (as the mockups you see currently are a placeholder). 
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I publish this spring.

I am also offering exclusive rewards for individuals who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

Please see the Perks section which outlines exclusive rewards for campaign supporters! 

About the Author

Mellie Napolitano is a Georgetown graduate and Compliance Specialist at the Technical College System of Georgia where she oversees workforce development programs.

Her desire to live out her Catholic faith led her to author and speak about her two books. In Hola Miss Napolitano advocates for a human perspective on the issue of immigration. In Love Story: An Encounter with God she discusses the possibility and value of waiting to have sex until marriage.

When not working, she is a devoted mother and wife.

For more information, you can connect with Mellie at mellienapolitano@gmail.com.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my book campaign page with friends, family members, mentors, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it.
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on social media using #LoveStory:AnEncounterWithGod.

Thank you so much for of all of your support!

Thanks again,
Mellie Napolitano
