story:
Short Summary

Hello.  My name is Peter Grin.  For those who know me, amongst other nicknames, I am known as the "transit guru".  Ask me how to get anywhere and I can probably tell you.  That is unless you are telling me to "get lost", of course.  I have organized my vast knowledge into an easy to read format that would be for FREE distribution.  Printing would be paid with advertising revenue in the magazine.

I am going forward with this magazine and it will be printed and published even if this indiegogo campaign does not raise one red cent!  This fund is to help with basic start-up costs only and is not to be used towards printing costs.  Printing costs will be raised with advertising revenues and the first issue will be printed as soon as enough ads have been sold to cover the printing costs for the first issue.  I anticipate that the first printed issue will be September, 2015.

This fund will make life considerably easier during the start up month of this venture and will help with cash flow, which is very critical during the start up of any operation.  For even a $5 contribution, you have my eternal gratitude and if you can contribute so much as $25, I have a special bonus for you (read below).

If you are an advertiser or business, this is an opportunity to help contribute to the start up of a new venture (warm fuzzy feelings all over the place for you) and for your business, gain advertising at even below printing costs in the first issue

There is a maximum of $4000 being raised in this campaign and these low advertising rate packages will never be seen again!  Keep reading to learn more:


What We Need

Ok, so I am break it down for folks in more detail:

  • • Setting up books with accountant in Prince George
    • Opening of business bank account
    • Create MONTERIS? account for wireless VISA, M/C, Amex?, debit
    • Opening of membership with Gabriola and Nanaimo Chamber of Commerce
    • Rent + Hydro for transition month
    • Printing of sales materials so that salespeople can actually make sales (ie: issue 0)
    • Hiring of sales and marketing team
    • Registration and licensing of business
    • Creation of website, Facebook & Twitter accounts, basic no frills site
    • Other misc. expenses (ie: Crossword puzzle subscription) 

    THE KICKSTART FUND IS NOT INTENDED FOR THE COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH PRINTING THE FIRST ISSUE OF THE MAGAZINE.  THESE COSTS WILL BE RAISED WITH ADVERTISING REVENUES ONCE COMPANY IS CREATED – SOMETIME DURING MONTH OF JUNE.


The Impact

This product is unique.  There is no other publication in this region that is nearly as comprehensive as this product regarding transportation options for the average person, either online or in print.  These days, printed bus and ferry schedules are getting harder and harder to find.  People traveling and on the move do not necessarily have access to the internet and in this case, a print copy of the schedule can prove to be quite valuable information.  This product will greatly benefit both travelers and locals alike, whether you just need a ferry schedule, or your planning a bus trip across the entire island.


What you get (Give this venture a kick-start)

$5 KICKSTART
• A thank you on the “Thank You” page in issue 0 and issue 1
• Digital copies of issue 1

$25 KICKSTART
• Everything in $5 KICKSTART
• Special “FREE BOOK” coupon book with FREEBIES (not BOGO) from various advertisers.  See FREE BOOK below.
• 4cm x 3cm ad in issue 1

$125 KICKSTART
• Everything in $25 KICKSTART
• 1/8 Page ad in issue 1

$250 KICKSTART
• Everything in $25 KICKSTART
• 1/4 Page ad in issue 1

$1000 KICKSTART
• Everything in $25 KICKSTART
• Full page ad in issue 1

$2000 KICKSTART
• Everything in $25 KICKSTART
• 2 Page inside front cover premium ad in issue 1
• ONLY ONE $2000 KICKSTART AVAILABLE

Issue 0 and Issue 1

Issue zero is a July 2015 issue.  It is not going to be published!  A handful of issues will be printed at staples so that sales reps can sell advertising for issue 1.  It will also be made available online.

Vancouver Island FREE book

1000 copies of a special coupon book will be printed called the "Vancouver Island FREE book"  It will be made available to advertisers, Indiegogo supporters and other insiders.  It will not be made available to the general public.  All copies will be issued.  The book contains several FREE offers from advertisers.  These are not BOGO, they are FREE offers!  Contribute $25 or more, and one of these babies is yours.


Update #1 - Jun 17

I should add a disclaimer:  The magazine will not go to print until there is a minimum of $65,000 in advertising revenues.  The $4000 that this campaign raises does not count towards this $65,000 goal.  While it is a goal to print a Sept issue, if the $65,000 goal is not reached, then the first issue would be October?

I have paid for the name registration and have submitted 3 names for approval:  Choice #1 is "Western Publications" as this is the name of my small magazine press back when I was a teenager (the name has a small amount of sentiment to me).  Choice #2 is "Peter Grin Publications" and choice #3 is "Getting There Publications".

There is a slight delay due to conflict in scheduling for my trip to Prince George.  I anticipate traveling up there mid to late next week.

I would also like to take this opportunity to welcome Trish to the team.  Trish is an AC Taxi dispatcher and also happens to have formerly ran a website hoisting and development company.  She would like to get back into the business and use Getting There Magazine for her current portfolio.  We are trying her out and we hope to be able to keep her on our team assuming things work out.  Welcome Trish and thank you for all your help.  :)

Finally over 50 pages in edits have been done over the past 72 hours and Issue 0 is on track to put online BEFORE Jul 1.  Lets see if we can have a Facebook page by the weekend and a working website with issue 0 online sometime next week.  I am making this a goal!




Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to this cause, but you like the idea, please help spread the word about this campaign.  Use indiegogo share tools to let others know about this project.  Make some noise!  For friends, family and acquaintances, please tell others and encourage them to check out my campaign. 

If you can contribute even just a small amount, please check out my "perks" page in this profile.
story_txt:
Short Summary Hello.  My name is Peter Grin.  For those who know me, amongst other nicknames, I am known as the "transit guru".  Ask me how to get anywhere and I can probably tell you.  That is unless you are telling me to "get lost", of course.  I have organized my vast knowledge into an easy to read format that would be for FREE distribution.  Printing would be paid with advertising revenue in the magazine.
I am going forward with this magazine and it will be printed and published even if this indiegogo campaign does not raise one red cent!  This fund is to help with basic start-up costs only and is not to be used towards printing costs.  Printing costs will be raised with advertising revenues and the first issue will be printed as soon as enough ads have been sold to cover the printing costs for the first issue.  I anticipate that the first printed issue will be September, 2015.
This fund will make life considerably easier during the start up month of this venture and will help with cash flow, which is very critical during the start up of any operation.  For even a $5 contribution, you have my eternal gratitude and if you can contribute so much as $25, I have a special bonus for you (read below).
If you are an advertiser or business, this is an opportunity to help contribute to the start up of a new venture (warm fuzzy feelings all over the place for you) and for your business, gain advertising at even below printing costs in the first issue
There is a maximum of $4000 being raised in this campaign and these low advertising rate packages will never be seen again!  Keep reading to learn more:

  What We Need
 Ok, so I am break it down for folks in more detail:  • Setting up books with accountant in Prince George • Opening of business bank account • Create MONTERIS? account for wireless VISA, M/C, Amex?, debit • Opening of membership with Gabriola and Nanaimo Chamber of Commerce • Rent + Hydro for transition month • Printing of sales materials so that salespeople can actually make sales (ie: issue 0) • Hiring of sales and marketing team • Registration and licensing of business • Creation of website, Facebook & Twitter accounts, basic no frills site • Other misc. expenses (ie: Crossword puzzle subscription)  THE KICKSTART FUND IS NOT INTENDED FOR THE COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH PRINTING THE FIRST ISSUE OF THE MAGAZINE.  THESE COSTS WILL BE RAISED WITH ADVERTISING REVENUES ONCE COMPANY IS CREATED – SOMETIME DURING MONTH OF JUNE. 
 
   
The Impact This product is unique.  There is no other publication in this region that is nearly as comprehensive as this product regarding transportation options for the average person, either online or in print.  These days, printed bus and ferry schedules are getting harder and harder to find.  People traveling and on the move do not necessarily have access to the internet and in this case, a print copy of the schedule can prove to be quite valuable information.  This product will greatly benefit both travelers and locals alike, whether you just need a ferry schedule, or your planning a bus trip across the entire island. 

 
What you get (Give this venture a kick-start)
$5 KICKSTART • A thank you on the “Thank You” page in issue 0 and issue 1 • Digital copies of issue 1 $25 KICKSTART • Everything in $5 KICKSTART • Special “FREE BOOK” coupon book with FREEBIES (not BOGO) from various advertisers.  See FREE BOOK below. • 4cm x 3cm ad in issue 1 $125 KICKSTART • Everything in $25 KICKSTART • 1/8 Page ad in issue 1 $250 KICKSTART • Everything in $25 KICKSTART • 1/4 Page ad in issue 1 $1000 KICKSTART • Everything in $25 KICKSTART • Full page ad in issue 1 $2000 KICKSTART • Everything in $25 KICKSTART • 2 Page inside front cover premium ad in issue 1 • ONLY ONE $2000 KICKSTART AVAILABLE Issue 0 and Issue 1Issue zero is a July 2015 issue.  It is not going to be published!  A handful of issues will be printed at staples so that sales reps can sell advertising for issue 1.  It will also be made available online.Vancouver Island FREE book
1000 copies of a special coupon book will be printed called the "Vancouver Island FREE book"  It will be made available to advertisers, Indiegogo supporters and other insiders.  It will not be made available to the general public.  All copies will be issued.  The book contains several FREE offers from advertisers.  These are not BOGO, they are FREE offers!  Contribute $25 or more, and one of these babies is yours.Update #1 - Jun 17
I should add a disclaimer:  The magazine will not go to print until there is a minimum of $65,000 in advertising revenues.  The $4000 that this campaign raises does not count towards this $65,000 goal.  While it is a goal to print a Sept issue, if the $65,000 goal is not reached, then the first issue would be October?
I have paid for the name registration and have submitted 3 names for approval:  Choice #1 is "Western Publications" as this is the name of my small magazine press back when I was a teenager (the name has a small amount of sentiment to me).  Choice #2 is "Peter Grin Publications" and choice #3 is "Getting There Publications".
There is a slight delay due to conflict in scheduling for my trip to Prince George.  I anticipate traveling up there mid to late next week.
I would also like to take this opportunity to welcome Trish to the team.  Trish is an AC Taxi dispatcher and also happens to have formerly ran a website hoisting and development company.  She would like to get back into the business and use Getting There Magazine for her current portfolio.  We are trying her out and we hope to be able to keep her on our team assuming things work out.  Welcome Trish and thank you for all your help.  :)
Finally over 50 pages in edits have been done over the past 72 hours and Issue 0 is on track to put online BEFORE Jul 1.  Lets see if we can have a Facebook page by the weekend and a working website with issue 0 online sometime next week.  I am making this a goal!



  Other Ways You Can Help If you are unable to contribute to this cause, but you like the idea, please help spread the word about this campaign.  Use indiegogo share tools to let others know about this project.  Make some noise!  For friends, family and acquaintances, please tell others and encourage them to check out my campaign.  
If you can contribute even just a small amount, please check out my "perks" page in this profile.

story:
Support a Writer of Color in this ABSURD CULTURAL MOMENT

 

When it comes to promoting books by writers of color, publicity is both a necessity and an art. If this campaign succeeds, Aisha will be able to hire Jack Jones Literary Arts for a full campaign. By contributing, you won't just be helping to bring Aisha's work to more readers, you'll be supporting a literary initiative that aims to bring more women of color to the forefront of the literary world.

Kima Jones' Jack Jones Literary Arts has successfully helped authors of color (Khadijah Queen, Tyehimba Jess, and Desiree Cooper, among others) play a more powerful role in our cultural conversations. 

ABOUT AISHA

  • Dreaming of Ramadi in Detroit was chosen by Maggie Nelson as the winner of the 1913 Open Prose Contest. Aisha's first book, The Fluency of Light: Coming of Age in a Theater of Black and White was deemed "One of the most original, startling memoirs I have seen in the past ten years" by Dinty W. Moore. Fanny Howe called it "a very valuable contribution to the literature of mixed race identity in America." Aisha is a contributing editor for Guernica: A Magazine of Art and Politics and a staff writer for Autostraddle. Read more of her work here.

ABOUT KIMA 

  • Author and publicist Kima Jones began Jack Jones Literary Arts in 2015. She works with big presses and small presses, but says, "I prefer to publicize books that don’t have a big engine behind them even though they deserve the big engine. I want to see those books win." To see and hear more of Kima's good work and to ENJOY yourself because SHE'S WICKED SHARP AND HILARIOUS, read about her on NPR's Code Switch blog; read this tiny interview on Cosmo Avenue; read this interview or watch this C-SPAN video about Jesmyn Ward's anthology The Fire This Time which includes one of Kima's essays; or read this or this or this. Know that two of the authors up for a PEN award this year work with Kima. 

 

What I Need & What You Get

This indiegogo fundraiser would help raise enough money to pay for a full campaign with Jack Jones Literary Arts. The indiegogo goal is the exact cost of a full campaign. If this fundraiser does not reach its goal, Aisha will hire JJLA for a limited campaign ($5,000) and any extra money raised beyond that will go toward book design for the book's cover and interior by the fabulous Sarah Gzemski. If there are still extra funds she will try to embark on a book tour.

 

PERKS

The perks for this campaign are flat out magic. Friends and family have donated an abundance of arty things that collectively exceed the value of this fundraiser. Here is a glimpse of some of what's on offer:

 

Photography

Matted Photographs of Cultural Icons from the Archives of Former Newsweek Photojournalist Lester Sloan:  

   

 

Books

The LAST Limited Edition Copy of Ander Monson's Letter to a Future Lover:

 

Libros Antena Book Pack:

 

The Kitchen-Dweller's Testimony by Ladan Osman

 

Bloom by Simmons Buntin

 

Fashion

Gemstone Pendants:

 

Music

Searching for Home, an album by Jillian Walker:

 

Broadsides & Book Art

Broadside featuring the poem "Chauvet" by Alison Hawthorne Deming:

 

 

Chapbook of Aisha's essay "Caldera" with cover art by Joe Quarnberg:

 

Broadsides by Hannah Ensor:

 

 

Goodies from Aisha

Yoga Tutorial DVD ft. Aisha Sabatini Sloan, certified yoga instructor:

 

Sticker:

 

Postcard: 

 

Dreaming of Ramadi in Detroit posters featuring artistic renderings of black conceptual artists:

 

Custom Made Literary Tarot Deck:

 

Blooper Reel:

Gratis.

 

Impact

We all know that funding for the arts in this country isn't what it should be, and it's getting worse. But we do have each other. And through campaigns like this we can do some of the work to support one another that our institutions can't or won't-- knowing we'll be supported the next time. Because that's what community does.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends! Share this indiegogo on social media. Take a look at the perks and tell a friend if you think something might float their boat. Like, do you know someone who needs a huge print of Marvin Gaye on their wall? I hope so. 

 

Thank You!

Hannah Ensor, Arianne Zwartjes, Lisa Strid, Riley Beck, Debbie Weingarten, Beth Alvarado, Claire Skinner, Sandra and Ben Dollar, Lisa O'Neill, Sara Jane Stoner, Susan Briante, Farid Matuk, Ander Monson, Simmons Buntin, Ruth Curry, Kristen Nelson, Wendy S. Walters, Jillian Walker, Eunsong Kim, Pamela Ushuk, Guardian of the Heart, TC Tolbert, Alison Hawthorne Deming, Emily Hilliard, Jen Hofer, Julie Lauterbach Colby, Gelare Khoshgozaran, Lisa Bowden, T'ai Freedom Ford, Kore Press, Lauren Eggert-Crowe, Kimi Eisele, Mika Taylor, Bill Wetzel, Lauryn Bianco, Jen Casale, Samuel Ace, Audra Puchalski, Rosie Perera, Ladan Osman, Lester Sloan, Lorraine Sabatini, Aunt Cora May, and Kima Jones.

Walters, Jillian Walker, Eunsong Kim, Pamela Ushuk, Guardian of the Heart, TC Tolbert, Alison Hawthorne Deming, Emily Hilliard, Jen Hofer, Julie Lauterbach Colby, Gelare Khoshgozaran, Lisa Bowden, T'ai Freedom Ford, Kore Press, Lauren Eggert-Crowe, Kimi Eisele, Mika Taylor, Bill Wetzel, Lauryn Bianco, Jen Casale, Samuel Ace, Audra Puchalski, Rosie Perera, Ladan Osman, Lester Sloan, Lorraine Sabatini, Aunt Cora May, and Kima Jones.

story:
About Me:

Hi Friends! I'm Marissa Nofer and writing has been my lifelong passion.  After losing a loved one, I realized that we never know how long we truly have to accomplish our goals in life. I spent a little over a year researching and planning before launching my publishing career in 2019. I have three books coming out this year (June, August, November), and plans for three in 2020 as well.  Royalties from my first three books will not be seen until much later in 2019, and by that time there will be no slots left to commission covers for my 2020 books. 

 

Here's the plan:

  • I need to commission three covers for 2020. (Ideally covers are completed months in advance for design time and marketing materials.)
  • Contributors will receive signed copies of my books!
  • ALL FUNDS will go towards cover commissions regardless of the amount raised. 

What does this money mean for my career?

Raising this money will allow me to focus on writing/publishing by funding much needed covers for my 2020 books. 

What happens if I don't raise this money?

My day job is being a stay-at-home-mom, so I am paid handsomely in boogers and headaches. 

If I don't raise this money, I will need to consider taking out a personal loan to cover the cost of the necessary cover art for 2020.  I cannot "bank" on future royalties being any certain amount this far in advance. Given my current salary ($0 annually) I will consider any royalties a huge blessing when they happen. I am already paying for editorial work, and other publishing expenses and managing all of this from world's crankiest laptop. I will still find a way to make it happen, but I've learned that the best way to get help is to be honest and upfront...oh, and ask!

Other Ways You Can Help!

I understand that not everyone is able to contribute, and I appreciate you sending me positive thoughts and support!

  • Pre-Order my 2019 books and tell your bookworm friends!
  • Share my fundraising campaign with the social media buttons above!

Thank you for your support and consideration!

-Marissa Nofer

story:
Our Story

Please Support Team YOUmedia as they travel to Brave New Voices 2011,   San Francisco Bay Area, CA. International Youth Poetry Slam... 
This years TEAM YOUmedia won, Louder Than A Bomb(LTAB) the largest teen poetry festival in the world. The festival is an Olympic-style poetry competition, featuring 70 teams and 650 students in 2011. Students from Team YOUmedia won both the indy and team finals which was the culmination of months of preparation and three weeks of bouts. Team Finals brings together LTAB’s best teams in a powerhouse performance of teen spoken word genius. By winning LTAB the team now  goes on to compete at Youth Speaks international competition Brave New Voices which will be held in San Francisco in July 20-23, 2011. 

Students Represent: YOUmedia @ Chicago Public Library

YOUmedia is an innovative, 21st century teen learning space housed at the Chicago Public Library's downtown Harold Washington Library Center. YOUmedia was created to connect young adults, books, media, mentors, and institutions throughout the city of Chicago in one dynamic space designed to inspire collaboration and creativity.

Mentors from Digital Youth Network as well as Chicago Public Library librarians lead workshops to help teens build their skills and create digital and traditional artifacts – from songs to videos to photography to spoken word poetry. 

The Impact

Team YOUmedia Teens will need support for travel expenses (meals, bus cards, etc) as they move through out the Bay Area. July 20-24, 2011.

What We Need 

We are asking for $500 dollars to cover expenses for our 5 member team. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word. & Support the Evolution.

story:
(not so) Short Summary

My name is Sarah Corbett & I've been an activist for most of my life. From squatting in houses targeted for demolition as a 5 year old, to being employed by international charities to reduce global poverty, activism has always been what I do. But 3 years ago I had a crisis. I was burnt out. I'd lost my energy, hope and optimism as an activist. I couldn't go on doing the same things in a rut. Plus I'd just got into cross-stitch (as you do!) and thats when I found craftivism (I Googled craft & activism), and it changed my life – cheesy but true. 

Craftivism is "a way of looking at life where voicing opinions through creativity makes your voice stronger, your compassion deeper & your quest for justice more infinite” (Betsy Greer, who coined the term in 2003).    

Under Betsy's blessing, I started a blog – 'A Lonely Craftivist' (yes, very emo!). People got in touch. Many had felt burnt out by traditional activism or didn't feel they belonged in traditional activism groups like me and wanted to do something different. 1year later and we became the Craftivist Collective. Now we have hundreds of active members and thousands of supporters all over the world. 

So what's so great about craftivism?

When you are doing cross-stitch or hand-embroidery it's hard not to take your time over it, to think about the issues one stitch at a time. I suddenly felt less like a Robot-Activist and was discussing global problems with other Craftivists, drinking tea, and using my talents. 

I like encouraging people. I want people to be their best, to use their role in life for good. We need demonstrations and petitions, but we also need positivity. We don't demonise or shout. But we do support. We've made hankies for bankers and MPs, willing them to use their influence for the most vulnerable in society. We embroider quotes, facts, and questions on mini-banners that inspire thought and don't push an answer. 

Craftivism is an alternative for people who don't find the traditional, more extrovert forms of activism comfortable. We do our craft in public, in cafes, on public transport, and in squares and parks. People like to come up and ask us what we're up to, and have a chat. We don't flyer, or hold placards, or use megapones. Because of that we get publicity. We've been in magazines, national newspapers, on French TV, and images of our work are tweeted, uploaded, and blogged to stimulate discussion on global issues. For and introverted activist it's the perfect way to go.

Craftivism is a tool in the box of activism. Sometimes we need to kick and shout. Sometimes we need to sit alongside and whisper something beautiful. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need £6,000 to produce a small book of craftivism. It sounds like a lot but we want a high quality beautiful thing people will keep and share. It will 

  • explain the and benefit of craftivism for maker, viewer and reciever
  • have a gallery of things we've done for people to do or be inspired to do their own stuff
  • and a selection of how-to projects

We've got all the contents of the book pretty much sorted, and, in the spirit of Craftivism, are dreaming of putting something out in the world that is beautiful, cherished, shared, and inspires people to do something similar. If you have any suggestions of content and style, send us an email.  

Cicada Books, the publishing company, are supporting us, by putting up half of the money. That gives us the chance to grow this little book from the roots up. We want your support, and we would be proud to have your name in a list of Craftivists and supporters at the back of the book. Craftivism is a movement, for anyone to be part of. 

Cicada specialise in high-end art, craft, and design books. They create quirky, alternative books that reflect the  unique voices of the artists. They're a perfect fit for our small but ambitious project.  

Cicada focuses on collaborations with new and emerging design talents from all over the world. the books have a quirky, alternative edge that reflects the individual voices of the artists and writers involved.  Cicada captures the essence of movements and scenes in the artworld that are happening right now.

Cicada Books will then put the book together (we've already been dreaming about paper stock!), and distribute into bookshops worldwide with the help of Thames & Hudson Publishers. 

The Impact 

Currently there are no little accessible introductory books to craftivism.

We want to create something that you can leave next to the toilet, give as a cheap gift to a friend, or pick up at the till of an art bookshop. We want people to be able to make their own project, and think about global issues of justice in while putting something beautiful out there in the world. 

In the words of the collective ‘A spoonful of craft helps the activism go down’. 

We’d like you to help us administer this rather delightful medicine! :) 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about our project (obvs;p) and this campaign on your google+, facebooks and twitters and all those other social media sites you might be a part of. There are little "share" and "like" buttons under the title image of this campaign, you can use those, and the short URL.

Thank you for taking time to hear us out.

have a gallery of things we've done for people to do or be inspired to do their own stuff
and a selection of how-to projects

We've got all the contents of the book pretty much sorted, and, in the spirit of Craftivism, are dreaming of putting something out in the world that is beautiful, cherished, shared, and inspires people to do something similar. If you have any suggestions of content and style, send us an email.  
Cicada Books, the publishing company, are supporting us, by putting up half of the money. That gives us the chance to grow this little book from the roots up. We want your support, and we would be proud to have your name in a list of Craftivists and supporters at the back of the book. Craftivism is a movement, for anyone to be part of. 
Cicada specialise in high-end art, craft, and design books. They create quirky, alternative books that reflect the  unique voices of the artists. They're a perfect fit for our small but ambitious project.  
Cicada focuses on collaborations with new and emerging design talents from all over the world. the books have a quirky, alternative edge that reflects the individual voices of the artists and writers involved.  Cicada captures the essence of movements and scenes in the artworld that are happening right now.
Cicada Books will then put the book together (we've already been dreaming about paper stock!), and distribute into bookshops worldwide with the help of Thames & Hudson Publishers. 
The Impact 
Currently there are no little accessible introductory books to craftivism.
We want to create something that you can leave next to the toilet, give as a cheap gift to a friend, or pick up at the till of an art bookshop. We want people to be able to make their own project, and think about global issues of justice in while putting something beautiful out there in the world. 
In the words of the collective ‘A spoonful of craft helps the activism go down’. 
We’d like you to help us administer this rather delightful medicine! :) 
Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word about our project (obvs;p) and this campaign on your google+, facebooks and twitters and all those other social media sites you might be a part of. There are little "share" and "like" buttons under the title image of this campaign, you can use those, and the short URL.
Thank you for taking time to hear us out.

story:
Selling in the South is a fun and informative book that helps explain some of the cultural differences that makes Americas a great place to live. We are very diverse country and we all have things that make us special… the way you shake hands with someone or talk to a lady in public you may think is the same all over the country, but there are certain things you could be doing that may be seen as offensive by someone here in the south.

Southern hospitality is a topic we cover in great detail in this book. You will learn that bless your heart will have a bunch of meanings and I will give you some pointers on how you should respond to this little comment

As a true southern salesman who has worked selling a variety of products that range from personal and business insurance to high tech 3-D engineering software, my experiences will help you see that all sales training does not work the same in all areas of the country.

I am a student in the art of selling and I have spent tens of thousands of dollars personally to learn everything I could about selling. I have attended tons of seminars, read hundreds of books (yes, folks in the south do really read) , I have also listened to thousands of hours of tapes and cd’s of by the so called masters of sales.

One of the things that stood out to me was the idea that people are exactly the same across the country and they should respond the same way to these generic sales tactics. What that sound like to me is ONE SIZE FITS ALL… and in my experience, the one size fits all approach to anything doesn’t fit anybody to well.

Now I will be the first to tell you that there are some basic fundamentals that do work all across the country but what you will learn in this book are the things that make selling in the south different. My focus is not what is right and wrong but just to point at how things appear to people who may not share your same life experiences…

I believe that this book had to be written to clear a few things up and to help us all communicate better.

I have some real good yankee buddies and they have a view of the world and life that I never will understand and I’m sure the feeling is mutual.  This book celebrates the differences and shows ways we can work together.

This book is not just for Yankees who have been transplanted in the south but it is for everybody. If you are not directly in sales, you may ask why you should read this book, well let me tell you… In life you may have the pleasure of dealing with a Southerner while you are in New York, now he or she will probably still have some of the traits and ideas that are discussed here.

You will be playing a big part in helping our country grow and be more successful by supporting this project. It is simple and easy to donate.

Thank you in advance for your support, and if you have an interest in having me speak to your organization about selling in the south, just give me a call.

story:
"BOOKS ARE MAN'S BEST FRIEND"

It was Groucho Marx who said "Outside of a dog, books are man's best 
friend. Inside a dog is too dark to read." An avid reader Groucho donated 
over 9,000 books to the UCLA library on his death. He had one thing right: 
reading will educate, enlighten, entertain and be a best friend to the 
reader, whether man, woman or child.

CHAPTER 1 WHY: Fewer people are reading books every year choosing instead 
media sources to get information and entertainment. The Gold Country 
Writers are asking your help to produce an anthology that will 
encourage curling up with a good dog and reading a book.

CHAPTER 2 WHO: The Gold Country Writers meet in Auburn, a small town in the 
Sierra Nevada foothills of California. We are an eclectic group meeting to 
discuss the creative art of writing and promotion of our work. Members 
include fiction and non-fiction authors, several poets, an oral 
storyteller, a magazine writer and one lady who has written a screenplay. 
You can read about them at www.goldcountrywriters.com.

CHAPTER 3 WHAT : Your help is needed to raise $1849 to create a soft cover 
book that will showcase the work of our local writers. Your contribution 
will help engage our small community with stories and turn the light on 
again for reading.

CHAPTER 4 HOW: We'll use your contribution for:

Collecting,editing and formating the stories and poems

Designing the cover and graphics

Printing and distributing the final book

Advertising and misc. small expenses

CHAPTER 5 WHERE: We live in the place where gold was found in 1848. That 
discovery resulted in thousands of Americans and men from all over the 
world coming here to search for gold the next year. They were called "The 
49er's". Everyone who donates to our project will be mailed a post card 
with a color picture of the Gold Country of California and a note of 
thanks. Use it for a bookmark.

story:
In a Nutshell

I’m passionate about my new book, “HE♥RTGASM – Increasing the Intimacy & the Ecstasy with Your Beloved,”© and now that it’s finally self-published, I have a fabulous opportunity to get it seen Nation-wide:  Steve Harrison’s Publicity Summit in NYC this spring, will train me and put me face-to-face with the top 100 US media producers for five minutes each.  One good interview on a TV show like “Oprah” or “Good Morning America” could shoot my book to the top of the charts and make it an “overnight success.”  This Campaign will be just the beginning of creating media exposure.

Having been a well-known cover girl, actress, producer, and best-selling author, I’ve been in the public eye for years:  Just to name a few, I’ve appeared on CBS’s “Morning Show,” ABC’s “Good Morning America,” and the “Sally Show.”  [Click here for a more detailed bio]

With contributors like you pledging to pre-buy a copy of "Heartgasm!" (either for yourself or a loved one  you know can benefit from the book's content), is just the beginning!

The Impact You Can Make & How You Benefit

I visualize this campaign as the beginning of a movement that will help to transform relationships throughout the world — and you can be part of that movement.  You can be the hero/heroine that forges the way to replace the old dysfunctional paradigm of our parent’s world, into partnerships in which compassion, communication, love, trust, and intimacy are the key words.  Wouldn't you love to participate in making this happen?  We can go for total global transformation!

Unique Perks

Many of our perks are identical to what we offered in our last Indiegogo campaign to self-publish "Heartgasm!"  However, several people have asked for perks related to my career as a supermodel, so we've created two perks that will help a beginner-model to get started — both of them Skype-coached by me personally!

We also have a few unique items that have been contributed by our supporters, including a verified hand-signed framed Dali print, some cool collector's items, and a "surprise" perk that is on its way.

BOOK PLEDGES of $25 or more will earn you a soft-cover AUTOGRAPHED copy of my book to be mailed to you on within a few weeks of the closing of this campaign.  Add $20 to any of the other higher pledges and you’ll also get an autographed copy (please mention that you want this when you pledge).

ANY PLEDGE OF OVER $100 ALSO INCLUDES: Your name as a “patron” in the Acknowledgements section of the newest version of "Heartgasm!," an invitation to the Media-book-launch party; and a framed print of the book cover personalized for you.

What We Need

In order to accomplish our goal of raising $30,032 for me to attend the spring Publicity Summit, we expect to pre-sell somewhere between 1,700 and 2,000 books — So the lion’s share of the budget goes to paying for the printing and shipping of these books.

The other really important items in this budget include paying our team of interns/virtual assistants who are helping us immeasurably to be seen in social media, to update our Indiegogo page, and to shoot and edit video as needed. They are the "engine" that is getting us out to more and more people every day.

Also, we are giving a 5% donation of gross funds collected, to The WIN, the Women's Information Network (http://www.thewinonline.com/), because of the amazing work that they are doing with women all over the world.

If we raise more money than we’d anticipated, and people order more books, than we planned, then any excess funding will go into additional marketing and promotion of "Heartgasm!," including printing and shipping costs of the book. However, if we don't raise our entire goal, we plan to use as much of what we've raised to partially pay for the Publicity Summit, and we’ll start another campaign to complete the balance needed to make sure that this happens.  You can see the entire budget by clicking here.

Heartgasm! Facts

If you’ve seen or have a copy of “Heartgasm!,” I’m sure you’ll agree that not only does it just ‘feel good in your hands,’ but that it’s beautifully produced and most importantly, the content is even better than I’d originally visualized:

Due to the suggestion from a genius in the book-publishing arena, I discovered how to re-frame “Heartgasm!” with the “H.E.A.R.T. System” which I subsequently created.  If this method and its processes are sincerely followed and practiced, it promises to transform relationships into amazingly satisfying, sacred, and successful partnerships.  (To find out more about what’s in the book click here).

We were also very lucky to obtain testimonials from people like long-time CNN talk-show host, Larry King;  Michael Butler, the producer of Broadway Musical, and film “Hair”; and multiple-best-selling author, Robert Allen.

Thanks to those who participated in my 2011 campaign to self-publish “Heartgasm! — Increasing Intimacy & Ecstasy with Your Beloved.”  We successfully raised over our goal, the amount of $4,333, to fund my newly published book!  You can still see that campaign here: http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/heartgasm/x/304725.

Hey folks, please help us to get a shout out and make some noise about this campaign!

For this round of crowd-funding, we’re partnering with several other like-minded groups.  Among them are:  The NPO, Revitalization Ministry; and The WIN (Women’s Information Network mentioned above), both of whom have goals similar to that of the spirit of “Heartgasm!,” which is to promote extraordinarily compassionate, communicative, and truthful bonds in all our relationships, including our own ‘beloveds’ (whether or not it is our own higher-inner-selves, or our chosen partners).  [Click here to see a list of our partners and their Websites].

Partnerships like these will enable us to reach even greater numbers of people — very much like having an extended family who can help us to share the benefits of “Heartgasm!” with their friends, family, business, or their lifestyle-associations.

So whether or not you choose to contribute by making a pledge,

here are some ways you can help to forward this campaign:

*  Connect us with other like-minded groups, organizations, and/or non-profits.

*  Suggest contact with an organization needing a speaker for their events - perhaps we can parlay this into a partnership now (or for future campaigns).

*  Please use the Indiegogo ‘Share Tools,’ to connect on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest and other social media venues.

*  Please sign up here http://RelateLoveSex.com/ or on       the http://www.tonidemarco.com/ Website (up, but still under construction), to become part of our contact list and continue receiving updates on the progress of Heartgasm via my blog,  http://relatelovesex.blogspot.com/ 

How We Can Get “Most Popular” Status/Exposure on Indiegogo

We need to raise 25 to 30% of our goal from “my inner network” in approximately the first couple of weeks, to achieve a “most popular” status, thereby being seen “up-front” when entering Indiegogo’s home page.  Otherwise it might be difficult to find us if we didn’t personally send you to our page.

PLEASE USE PayPal TO MAKE YOUR PLEDGES. 

I strongly encourage you to pre-buy “Heartgasm!” (or our other pledges) through PayPal because that way WE CAN ACCESS THE FUNDS RIGHT AWAY to pay for the Summit.  Otherwise, when the campaign competes on November 11th, it then takes two more weeks to be paid — thus having to wait to receive “non-PayPal” pledge payments until November 25th.

Please understand that you DO NOT need to have a PayPal account to pay — PayPal will bill your debit or credit card.  VERY EASY to do — taking less than five minutes of your time!!!

Thanks so much for making my even greater dream — that of having more people discovering and benefiting from the transformations in their lives provided by “Heartgasm!” — come true.

Many thanks for sharing this with everyone you know who can use “Heartgasm!”  in their lives!

Love & blessings,

Toni

story: The Literary Arts Program at The Neutral Zone, Ann Arbor's teen center, works with over 200 young people a year to help them enhance their skills as thinkers, writers and communicators. Through weekly workshops in poetry, fiction and publishing, as well as poetry slams, readings, guest author visits, field trips and week-long summer camps, the Literary Arts Programs at The Neutral Zone help young people to develop their voices as writers, thinkers and communicators of influence and consequence. We want to build a community where young people lead richer and fuller lives due to a passionate attachment to the written and spoken word. We believe the power of human language is the greatest power on earth and your contribution will help us help young people to harness that power to build their own futures.

story:
(Le traduzioni dei testi in italiano li trovate nella sezione "Updates")

(Las traducciones de este texto al castellano o al italiano estarán luego en las pestañas "Update")

Trascendencia Poética: The Campaign

From the author:

I’m Antonio Martínez. I was born in Tucumán, Argentina. I lived almost all of my life in Buenos Aires where I developed my artistic side, attending literary workshops in the capital and province of Buenos Aires. Since 2010 I’ve been living in Tuscany, Italy, as a musician, dancer, and tango instructor from Buenos Aires.

Poetry is transcendence, the bond that the word wields over human beings: my dream that I try to share, giving it life and direction, crossing the boundaries of languages. I write because I’m compelled by the necessity of feeling in that embrace that can be achieved by spinning the word into verses.

My wish is to succeed in publishing my first book of poems, reaching out to other continents, presenting the song of the things that I relate in verse. My campaign is ready to reach this objective with the help of all the people who may want to share this dream that has always desired to take flight, with the help of those who love poetry and universal literature.

From the translator:

Some say that poetry is untranslatable, while others uphold that translatability is an intrinsic quality of a text itself. If poetry is transcendence, then I believe that it is, in fact, inherently translatable, and its translation both results from and perpetuates the bond between poet, language, and reader.

I’m very excited to be a part of this project, to bring the works of a new poet to light. This collection will be published as a bilingual book, providing greater scope for Antonio’s work to reach as many people as possible. Our first endeavor in self-funded publishing, the success of this campaign will allow us to dedicate our energies to giving this project the care and attention it deserves. Please help us give Antonio’s poetry wings!                                                               Elaine Newton-Bruzza

What’s it all for?

For Us: The Campaign Goal

Our €5096 goal for this campaign will be used to cover the costs of translating Antonio’s poems, designing, printing, publishing, and marketing the book, and our time in carrying this project to fruition. Over the course of the next 6 – 8 months, we will dedicate ourselves to producing a quality book that we hope will transcend the boundaries of language and culture.

 If we are unable to reach our full goal, we will use the partial funding to complete as much of the “nitty-gritty” of the project as possible (i.e. design and publishing—the outside contractors) to get this book to market. We would then be forced to seek other resources, but we’re determined to see it through for the sake of art! Your contributions will make it that much easier for our pursuit of ethereal art to become a tangible reality!

For You: The Perks

Have you ever had a poem written especially for you? If you’ve got the big bucks and want to share, Antonio will compose an original poem just for you! Other perks range from heartfelt thank-you’s, to acknowledgements on the website, or to signed copies of the published book of poems! Plus you get that splendiferous feeling of having done something worthwhile—it has a certain poetry to it, don’t you think?

Who are we?

Our team consists of three key members: Antonio, the poet and author, Elaine, the translator and coordinator, and Francesca, the campaign assistant and publicist. Here's a bit more about us:

Antonio Martínez 

I started writing a long, long time ago just because I liked doing it. I think that since my teenage years I was already writing. In general, I was writing texts for songs to which I would add a melody to sing to friends or during family reunions. For me, writing is something essential and necessary. I write because I like doing it, because it allows me to say things that I am not able to express in other ways, just by speaking. Poetry brings me close to a larger world.

Elaine Newton-Bruzza 

Elaine has lived in Barcelona, Buenos Aires, and Guanajuato, Mexico. She has extensive knowledge of Argentine culture and idioms via family and personal connections, giving her an incredible insight into Spanish language culture. A published translator, she also holds B.A. in Spanish from Southern Oregon University and a Masters in Translation Studies from the Universitat Pompeu Fabra in Barcelona, Spain. Additionally, she is hoping to begin her doctoral work on Argentine tango lyrics in the coming year.

Francesca Bertelli 

Francesca grew up in Tuscany and moved to New York after completing her BA degree in Philosophy at the University of Florence. New York is where she made her home for 25 years, traveling a lot, not only around the US, but to Australia, South Africa, Central America and more. After discovering tango, Buenos Aires became her second home and over the course of two years she spent more than half her time there. Finally, after marrying Antonio, they decided to settle back in Italy where she has a very busy life as tango teacher, organizer of the Montecatini Terme Tango Festivalito, translator and consultant.

Why does this matter?

Successfully publishing this collection of poems will fulfill Antonio’s lifelong dream. Any creative process is a matter of taking risks, and Antonio has taken a great leap of faith in offering his words to the world. Through his art, he makes a fresh and elegant contribution the great oeuvre of humankind’s search for beauty.

“Urban life, nature, solitude, liberty. Antonio Martínez’s first book of poetry is comprised of these and so many other fundamental values. Poetry that reveals itself to the reader in blank verse and with a rich vocabulary, impregnated with musicality that penetrates the senses like a plunge into a river. And so his poetry journeys, always varying in its course, always fresh.” 

Gustavo Benzecry-Sabá, 2014

Other Ways You Can Help

We hope you can contribute financially, but if that’s not possible you can make a huge difference by spreading the word about us via your own networks. Please share the link to our campaign with your family or friends—a personal note from you may go a long way to helping us achieve our goals!

You can also share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc.
story_txt:
(Le traduzioni dei testi in italiano li trovate nella sezione "Updates")(Las traducciones de este texto al castellano o al italiano estarán luego en las pestañas "Update")Trascendencia Poética: The Campaign
From the author:I’m Antonio Martínez. I was born in Tucumán, Argentina. I
lived almost all of my life in Buenos Aires where I developed my artistic side,
attending literary workshops in the capital and province of Buenos Aires. Since
2010 I’ve been living in Tuscany, Italy, as a musician, dancer, and tango
instructor from Buenos Aires.
Poetry is transcendence, the bond that the word wields over
human beings: my dream that I try to share, giving it life and direction,
crossing the boundaries of languages. I write because I’m compelled by the
necessity of feeling in that embrace that can be achieved by spinning the word
into verses.
My wish is to succeed in publishing my first book of poems,
reaching out to other continents, presenting the song of the things that I
relate in verse. My campaign is ready to reach this objective with the help of
all the people who may want to share this dream that has always desired to take
flight, with the help of those who love poetry and universal literature.From the translator:
Some say that poetry is
untranslatable, while others uphold that translatability is an intrinsic
quality of a text itself. If poetry is transcendence, then I believe that it is,
in fact, inherently translatable, and its translation both results from and
perpetuates the bond between poet, language, and reader.
I’m very excited to be a part of this
project, to bring the works of a new poet to light. This collection will be
published as a bilingual book, providing greater scope for Antonio’s work to
reach as many people as possible. Our first endeavor in self-funded publishing,
the success of this campaign will allow us to dedicate our energies to giving
this project the care and attention it deserves. Please help us give Antonio’s
poetry wings!                                                               Elaine Newton-Bruzza
What’s it all for?
For Us: The Campaign Goal
Our €5096 goal for
this campaign will be used to cover the costs of translating Antonio’s poems,
designing, printing, publishing, and marketing the book, and our time in
carrying this project to fruition. Over the course of the next 6 – 8 months, we
will dedicate ourselves to producing a quality book that we hope will transcend the
boundaries of language and culture.
 If we are unable to reach
our full goal, we will use the partial funding to complete as much of the “nitty-gritty”
of the project as possible (i.e. design and publishing—the outside contractors)
to get this book to market. We would then be forced to seek other resources,
but we’re determined to see it through for the sake of art! Your contributions
will make it that much easier for our pursuit of ethereal art to become a
tangible reality!

Have you ever had a poem written especially for you? If you’ve
got the big bucks and want to share, Antonio will compose an original poem just
for you! Other perks range from heartfelt thank-you’s, to acknowledgements on

begin her doctoral work on Argentine tango lyrics in the coming year.

New York is where she made her home for 25 years, traveling a lot, not only around the US, but to Australia, South Africa, Central America and more. Finally, after marrying Antonio, they decided to settle back in Italy where she has a very busy life as tango teacher, organizer of the Montecatini Terme Tango Festivalito, translator and consultant.

Poetry that reveals itself to the reader in blank verse and with a rich

story:
Photo : Roxanne Ducharme

Tous les soirs, dans tous les restaurants de la planète, des amitiés renaissent, des amours meurent, des comptes se règlent, des destins basculent. Le Rendez-vous ne fait pas exception. Ce bistrot de troisième couronne est le théâtre quotidien d’une comédie humaine dont les personnages venus se remplir la panse n’ont rien d’autre en commun que ces quelques heures écoulées dans le même lieu, à quelques mètres les uns des autres.

Regardez-les, ces convives de la table d’à côté. Les joyeux le sont-ils à ce point? Les taciturnes ont-ils vraiment épuisé tout ce qu’ils avaient à se dire pour garder ainsi le nez dans leur assiette? Au Rendez-vous, certains mangent leur prochain entre deux lampées de rouge alors que d’autres trouvent enfin le courage d’exprimer ce qui leur brûle les lèvres ou l’estomac.

En dix histoires courtes ou longues, Un mercredi comme les autres, histoires et excès de table pose autant de regards tendres, cruels ou acides sur la trajectoire de ses personnages. Puisqu’il suffit parfois d’une parole pour altérer une relation, sceller un accord ou faire dévier un parcours amoureux, le repas au restaurant ne devient-il pas un véritable champ de mines pour celui ou celle dont le cœur ou l’esprit vacille?

Ce mercredi soir au Rendez-vous n’offrira rien de moins que la moisson quotidienne des aveux, des offrandes et des coups de Jarnac dont l’espèce humaine a le secret. Et peut-être un peu plus.

                                                                                                Photo : Roxanne Ducharme

LA SÉRIE LITTÉRAIRE

La formule a de quoi surprendre : un peu comme vous le feriez pour une série télévisée, en vous abonnant, vous recevrez par courriel un épisode chaque mercredi de l’été. Vous pourrez donc lire tranquillement votre nouvelle, et attendre la prochaine qui arrivera le mercredi suivant!

Cette série littéraire estivale sera offerte pour une durée limitée, soit du mercredi 27 mai au mercredi 17 juin 2015. La diffusion débutera le mercredi 1er juillet pour se terminer le mercredi 2 septembre 2015.

Alors, prêt(e) à commander?

                                                                                                               Photo : Roxanne Ducharme

À PROPOS DE L'AUTEURE

JOHANNE TREMBLAY a écrit des histoires toute sa vie sous les formes les plus diverses : journalistique, commerciale, scénaristique et musicale. Détentrice d’un baccalauréat en études françaises, elle a fait sa marque comme journaliste et chroniqueuse dans le milieu des magazines grand public puis, comme traductrice, particulièrement auprès d’éditeurs scolaires. Elle s’est égarée pendant dix ans dans le milieu de la création télévisuelle. Un mercredi comme les autres, histoires et excès de table, constitue sa première incursion en littérature. Elle vit à Montréal depuis presque toujours. 


REMERCIEMENTS

À Sophyy Levasseur pour l'aide précieuse

À Roxanne Ducharme pour son oeil d'artiste

Au Lawrence et à son équipe pour nous avoir permis d'aller y prendre des photos  http://lawrencerestaurant.com/

À Chris Zabriskie via http://freemusicarchive.org/ et http://audionautix.com/ pour la musique gratuite sous licence CREATIVE COMMONS

Aux amis, partenaires, futurs lecteurs et amoureux des mots qui prendront le temps qu'il faut pour diffuser dans leurs réseaux ce projet audacieux, et disons-le, un peu fou. Nous sommes impatients de vous faire découvrir le Rendez-vous!

story:
What is Flashpoint?

Flashpoint is an anthology of original speculative fiction, the fourth volume in the popular Speculative Elements series. Publication is scheduled for late 2014.

Who is Third Person Press?

We are a small, independent publisher based on Cape Breton Island, Nova Scotia. We have a proven track record of producing quality publications while nurturing and promoting the writers we work with. It's important to us to be able to pay our writers decent rates for their work, and to promote great speculative fiction from our region. Your support will help us keep doing that, and you'll get some great perks into the bargain!


What We Need & What You Get

First and foremost, the funds we receive will go to pay our contributors for their stories in Flashpoint. Beyond that, we'll be paying to print and ship the actual physical copies, including some to be used for reviews, giveaways, and promotional purposes. We'll pay for the perks for our kind supporters, and other costs involved in the production, launch, and promotion of the book. If we have anything left over (a pretty big if!), we'll put it toward other Third Person Press projects and goals, like future anthologies and collections.

We think you'll like our cool perks for this campaign. In addition to the usual thank-yous and recognition, we have copies of the book and/or ebook, bookmarks, and Flashpoint-themed jewelry, as well as some special perks for our writer friends. All this is in addition to other books from our catalogue, printable artwork, a detailed critique of your own writing--even dinner out with the editors!

The Impact

UK author Philip Pullman said, “After nourishment, shelter and companionship, stories are the thing we need most in the world.” At Third Person Press, we believe this, and we want to keep bringing great stories and authors to readers. We may be small, but that means we can work one-on-one with our authors to bring you tales we think you'll love, and it allows us to nurture fresh new voices. Our track record of successful previous anthologies makes us confident that Flashpoint will be another book we're proud to publish. And our Grey Area Indiegogo campaign experience makes us excited for this one! Your support helps us, our authors, and our future projects.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is the same one that faces every small press these days--visibility. Our past experience with Indiegogo proved that doesn't have to be an obstacle. The success of our Grey Area campaign and the experience it provided us gives us confidence both in the anthology and in our ability to fulfill our commitments to our supporters.

A Note About Dates

We intend to begin shipping print copies and other physical perks starting on December 1st, 2014; other perks such as custom designs, critiques, etc. will be available by the dates noted.

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to support the project, but are unable to contribute right now? You can still help us out by spreading the word about our Flashpoint campaign with your friends, family, and colleagues, and in your social media circles. Indiegogo's sharing tools make it easy!

story:
Who are you, and what is this book about?

Basic details are as follows:

My name is Lloyd Evans. I am a former Jehovah's Witness elder - originally from the UK - and author of The Reluctant Apostate: Leaving Jehovah's Witnesses Comes At a Price (available on Amazon). I am 38 years old and currently living in Croatia with my family. I am Senior Editor of JWsurvey.org, which is aimed at providing a resource for Jehovah's Witnesses who are beginning to awaken from their indoctrination. I also create videos for the "John Cedars" YouTube channel, which currently has over 16,000 subscribers.

My campaign is not so much about raising money - it is more about easing an important book across the line and making it available quickly. The purpose of the book is to guide those who seek to extricate themselves from the Jehovah's Witness movement because they no longer believe, walking them through the process as painlessly as possible given that the penalty for apostasy is shunning by everyone they know and love.

My previous book, The Reluctant Apostate, is quite expensive to order on Amazon (list price: $29.50) due to its size of 800 pages. How to Escape From Jehovah's Witnesses will be be a much smaller book (approximately 170 pages) meaning that I will be able to price it far more cheaply -because it will be cheaper to print. My aim is to price it as close to $10 as possible once it hits Amazon - in other words, a third of the price of my first book. (Please bear in mind: I am largely at Amazon's mercy when it comes to deciding on the final list price.)

What I Need & What You Get

Again, this isn't so much about raising a large sum - it's more about making the book available for pre-order on completion. I am therefore only asking the minimum amount for launching an Indiegogo campaign - $500 - which will be paid to my book designer for his amazing services (I am using the same individual who did an amazing job on designing The Reluctant Apostate).

PLEASE NOTE: Last time I ran an Indiegogo campaign, some backers assumed that by donating the amount of the perk they would automatically receive the perk. PLEASE make sure that you click on the relevant perk when ordering to avoid any delays or confusion. Thanks!

In exchange for their support of the project, my backers can receive:

For $9: an advance copy of How To Escape From Jehovah's Witnesses (mailed 3 weeks / 21 days before it is released on Amazon).

For $14: a signed advance copy of How To Escape From Jehovah's Witnesses (mailed 3 weeks / 21 days before it is released on Amazon).

For $25: a copy of The Reluctant Apostate, signed by the author.

For $32: signed copies of both How to Escape From Jehovah's Witnesses AND The Reluctant Apostate.

For $40: a signed advance copy of How to Escape From Jehovah's Witnesses (mailed 3 weeks / 21 days before it is released on Amazon) with the backer's name in the Acknowledgments.

For $60: a signed advance copy of How to Escape From Jehovah's Witnesses (mailed 3 weeks / 21 days before it is released on Amazon) with the backer's name in the Acknowledgments AND a signed copy of The Reluctant Apostate.

For $150: collaboration with the backer so that their story of successfully escaping an abusive belief system (300 words max) features along with others in the final pages of How to Escape From Jehovah's Witnesses. The text will be written by the author but will include a minimum of one quote worded by the backer. The backer will also be allowed to include a black and white photo with their story (with the author's approval of the image) if desired. This perk comes with a complimentary signed, advance copy of How to Escape From Jehovah's Witnesses (mailed 3 weeks / 21 days before it is released on Amazon) with the backer's name in the Acknowledgments. (The author reserves the right to issue a refund for this perk if the story is not a good fit for the book.)

Any excess funds pledged will go toward printing and mailing extra books for reviewers, promoting the book, and otherwise assisting with my activism work.

Since the goal is for the minimum amount of $500, I do not envision not meeting it!

Timescale

By January 10, the Indiegogo campaign will end. (Extra copies may be made available beyond this date at my discretion.)

By the end of January the manuscript will be complete, with editing underway.

By the end of February the book will be edited and print-ready.

By the end of March the book will be printed and mailed out to backers. (Mid-March, if possible.)

Bear in mind: the above timescale is an estimate. I will do my very best to meet the stated deadlines and, wherever possible, improve on them.

Three weeks (21 days) after the last books have been mailed to backers (which I will announce as a campaign update) the book will be available on Amazon. This will allow reasonable time for the books to be mailed from the UK (where they will be printed) to international addresses before the book becomes available for order on Amazon.

The text will be written by the author but will include a minimum of one quote worded by the backer. The backer will also be allowed to include a black and white photo with their story (with the author's approval of the image) if desired. This perk comes with a complimentary signed, advance copy of How to Escape From Jehovah's Witnesses (mailed 3 weeks / 21 days before it is released on Amazon) with the backer's name in the Acknowledgments. (The author reserves the right to issue a refund for this perk if the story is not a good fit for the book.)Any excess funds pledged will go toward printing and mailing extra books for reviewers, promoting the book, and otherwise assisting with my activism work.Since the goal is for the minimum amount of $500, I do not envision not meeting it!TimescaleBy January 10, the Indiegogo campaign will end. (Extra copies may be made available beyond this date at my discretion.)By the end of January the manuscript will be complete, with editing underway.By the end of February the book will be edited and print-ready.By the end of March the book will be printed and mailed out to backers. (Mid-March, if possible.)Bear in mind: the above timescale is an estimate. I will do my very best to meet the stated deadlines and, wherever possible, improve on them.Three weeks (21 days) after the last books have been mailed to backers (which I will announce as a campaign update) the book will be available on Amazon. This will allow reasonable time for the books to be mailed from the UK (where they will be printed) to international addresses before the book becomes available for order on Amazon.

story:
After I found my best friend and high school sweetheart dead, I didn’t know what to do or where to go. Instead of going to a therapist, as I probably should have done, I decided to take a series of road trips following the last band we saw together. I have decided to write a book on this experience — on the people I met and the perspectives I gained during that year. I hope this will add to the growing conversation on issues surrounding mental health, as well as provide the resources I wish I had while coping. 

All proceeds made from this book will go towards Survivors of Suicide programs in the cities I visited last year (Milwaukee WI, Madison WI, New Orleans LA, St Louis MO, Cleveland OH, Pittsburgh PA, NYC, Iowa City IA, Boston MA, and Indianapolis IN). These programs are run by each local National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI) chapter.

I’ve found my budget has delayed getting this book out. I’d like to change that. I am asking for help on the following services: 

$400 — editing costs
$200 — site maintenance/marketing costs
$600 — self publishing costs (barcode, ISBNs, copyrights, etc.)

If I raise more than what I need to publish, any additional funds will go directly towards helping these programs that so desperately need it. 

More information: beckysquestforreason.com
Facebook: @beckysquestforreason
IG: #thisroadmustgosomewhere
Video Credit: Jason Hillman

story:
Short Summary

My name is Andrea and I am the daughter of Pastor Marvin Dozier.  Pastor Dozier has been the pastor of the Unity Baptist Church of Mattituck for 25 years.  He is committed to bringing people to God, guiding others in enhancing their relationship with Christ, developing leadership in the congregation, and maintaining ongoing outreach to the community.  

For 83 years, the church building has provided a space for people to worship God in spirit and in truth.  It is long overdue for renovations to occur.   The bathrooms and the rooftop are in desperate need of renovation.  In addition, because of the great work that the Church does, an expansion is also needed.  We want to be able to house more worshippers and allow more people in to experience God's word.  

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need at least 10K to get this project started.  While full project may cost more, the 10K will at least allow the bathroom renovations to happen.  
  • We are providing church T shirts, which are black, to those who donate at least $200.  
  • If we do not reach this goal, however we are praying that we do, then we will continue to raise funds until we have enough for the bathroom renovations.  

The Impact

Remember that if this 83 year old building is renovated now, it will allow for a more fruitful worship experience for all of God's people.  We really need your help and want you to know that we are continuing to give back to the community and to function and operate in a way that pleases the Lord.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Please pass on the link or the word to support us.  We accept ALL contributions, there is no contribution too small.  

God Bless.
