story:
Will The Phoenix Condition

Be The Death of Us?

This is the last week. Please help. Thanks TIM

The Population Bomb will explode early in the 22nd Century as incredible advances in medicine and biotechnology – ranging from cloning, cell revitalization and nanotechnology – significantly increase human longevity. These advances will result in many of our future great-great-grandchildren living to be 150-years old and beyond. Thus, by 2150, as many as seven generations of one family may be living at once - from a 150-year-old matriarch to a new-born baby. 

This phenomenon will replicate the life of the Phoenix, the mythical bird that rose from the ashes to live a much longer life. Thus: The Phoenix Condition. Sadly, it is this condition that will swell population densities in an already overpopulated world and lead to billions in the 22nd Century and beyond living in abject poverty. 

Key4hope is a social media think tank that offers a blueprint for a positive future. My name is Tim Donohue and I’m the executive director of Key4hope. My team and I firmly believe that for the first time in human history, we possess the technology and the ingenuity to control our future. Key4hope, located at www.key4hope.com, offers over 100 predictions for a better tomorrow including possible solutions to ending world hunger, defusing the Population Bomb and rebuilding much of the Amazon Rainforest. 

And your support can help promote this thank tank and get these ideas published in book form so together we can save lives and make a better future for our future generations. 

As for the Phoenix Condition, it is important to add right away that 150-year olds in the mid-22nd Century won’t look and feel like 150-years old. Fortunately, face transplants and age disguising (coupled with safe energy modules inserted into the body that will systematically release “energy”) will keep even senior, senior citizens looking and feeling young.  

How will the Phoenix Condition come about and what are the repercussions of this impending and enormous population growth? Michael Crichten, the author of the best-selling novel “Jurassic Park” wrote in the book’s forward: “Biotechnology promises the greatest revolution in human history...it will outdistance atomic power and computers in its effect on our everyday lives." 

Advancements in this field alone over the next 100 years will be astounding. Specifically, scientists are on the verge of routinely cloning internal body parts from a person's own cells. This will be among the greatest medical advancements this century. It cannot be over-emphasized that once we can clone our OWN organs - such as our kidneys or heart - we have overcome the tremendous problems of organ rejection and organ availability. With younger versions of our own organs in our bodies, well, think of the obvious health benefits – and, of course, how long we will eventually live. 

It’s important to note that all diseases ranging from cancer to AIDS to diabetes will be cured within the next 50 years – thanks to advances in biotechnology aided by computers much more powerful than today’s models. Again, these advances will add significantly to future generations’ life spans.

However, bionics will eventually overtake cloning. Sophisticated bionic kidneys, livers, eyes and hearts will compete with cloned organs in the 2040s and beyond but bionics will win out because bionics with intricate backup systems using nanotechnology will eventually prove superior to nature’s models. Someday there will be awe-inspiring mechanical hearts that will always keep a person's blood flowing - even after death. Someday there will be artificial kidneys that never fail, bionic eyes that will always see, and artificial lungs that will always keep us breathing. 

By 2060, bionics will allow the average recipient to run faster than Jerry Rice, lift heavier items than Arnold, and be able to leap over -- well, maybe not tall buildings in a single bound -- but certainly over tall objects, and, most importantly, death rates will plummet.  These advancements will lead to people in the industrialized world in the 22nd Century living to be 150-years and beyond.

Looking At History

To Preview The Future

Most people don’t seem to realize how quickly technology advances. But a short history lesson should help. Between the Wright Brothers' first flight at Kitty Hawk, North Carolina in 1903 and the inaugural launch of the Space Shuttle in 1981 stood 78 years. During that time, in the field of aviation technology, miraculous advancements were achieved. Three-quarters of a century saw a box-kite-like machine that floundered like a fish out of water transform into a sleek, efficient vessel capable of making multiple journeys into space -- all this in 78 years!

In 1982, Dr. Barney Clark, who suffered from a severe case of heart disease, was the recipient of the world's first artificial heart. His life was prolonged an additional 112 days. A mere 78 years later, the "Space Shuttle" of artificial hearts was perfected. The machine was hailed by the citizens of 2060 as "more reliable than the real thing." Shortly thereafter, the whispers of immortality grew.

Death As A Rare Event

Let’s think about this. When death becomes an endangered species, what will happen to our planet? 

According to a United Nations’ report: “World Population Prospects: the 2012 Revision”,  this world’s population is expected to peak at 9.6 billion by 2050, and then begin a slow decline. But this report is wrong because it does not take into account extreme increases in longevity. 

While The Phoenix Condition will never fully take root in developing countries because bionics and replacement parts are expensive, the trickle down effects will significantly increase longevity in vast areas of this planet currently in population trouble.  But certainly, as each generation of biotechnology improves, the cost of these life-extending devices will decline. Eventually, a market of cheaper or used biotech hearts and kidneys will thrive in many developing countries.

Today, Mexico’s population density is approximately 62 people per square kilometer compared to the United States’ population density of 34 (World Bank, 2013). But what will Mexico’s population density be by 2150 as The Phoenix Condition trickles down over the Rio Grande? True estimates of population densities nearly 150 years from now currently don’t exist. So allow me: Mexico’s population density will be a lot higher than 62 people per square kilometer – keeping in mind that Mexico is currently overpopulated. Will Mexico’s population density be over 100 per square kilometer? Will it be over 150? And if so, what will the quality of life be like in Mexico?

The Phoenix Condition will also lead to much misery in the Industrialized World. Overpopulation has always been a Third World ailment but imagine the quality of life in the United States if huge numbers of people stopped dying and our population eventually doubled or tripled. Could it be that some cities in our country will be so tightly packed that privacy is no longer a right, that most city streets become gigantic parking lots (filled with people, not cars), and rates of madness climb exponentially? Where will we put all these people?

The 500 Year Old Human

Allow me to go one step farther in my forecasts. There is the possibility that humans in the 23rd Century and beyond could live up to 500 years as some residents of that time opt to have their brains transplanted into robot bodies. Okay, a moment to recover from the shock. 200 years from now, citizens can choose to have their brains placed into robot bodies impossible to distinguish from real human bodies. They can also choose the physical characteristics they desire – such as height, race, sex, freckles, dimples or a sly smile. To help people live even longer and more lucidly, “Brain pumps” – that habitually send vitamins and nutrients to the brain – will keep that organ healthy for many centuries. 

Some residents will periodically change their robot bodies – just having a technician (a robot) remove their encased brain and place it into another robot body. Just a short note: the connections between the encased brain and the robot’s nervous system are too complicated to explain here but suffice it to say – the connections are astonishing.  

Please remember I’m only the messenger – not the advocate. Transferring brains from one robot body to another robot body is Frankensteinism. Inhuman! I’m not saying we should do this, I’m saying that many citizens in the 23rd Century and beyond will choose this option. Of course, this will lead to even higher population densities.

The Phoenix Condition Is Coming!

The Phoenix Condition Is Coming!

If Paul Revere were alive today, it would be obvious what he would be shouting. 

Our society is not very foresighted. For those who were adults in the year 2000, many can recall the Y2K problem, also known as the millennium bug, which involved computer programs that could not accurately change the date when 1999 changed into the year 2000. No one foresaw this challenge and thus panic arose in the late 1990s. Today, few realize that The Phoenix Condition is coming and thus have not considered the possible implications of a world where death rates drop significantly. Most certainly this world is unprepared for the extremely high population densities that will swell nations such as Nigeria, Brazil and the Philippines within the next 200 years. 

Will the quality of life in these developing nations where obese overpopulation limits jobs, school opportunities, stable governments, and dreams resemble the seventh layer of Dante’s Hell? And what will occur if our world experiences a global financial meltdown or a major environmental catastrophe that strikes an entire continent? Will we enter a new Dark Age?

Much Of The Developing World

Is Headed In The Wrong Direction

Now that we’ve identified the problem, what is the solution? First we must call for global education about The Phoenix Condition. We have to get people talking about this. Then world governments and international organizations such as the United Nations must stress population policies that advocate limiting growth. Countries such as India, Egypt and the Congo currently do not have population control strategies. Certainly, we can begin by improving birth control and making it safe, plentiful and free. Curbing population growth as The Phoenix Condition overshadows us will be a Herculean task but to do nothing would be a serious crime.

Do We Love Our Unseen Children?

Imagine what our world will be like for future generations in the 22nd, 23rd and 24th Centuries and beyond if The Phoenix Condition takes hold?  Certainly, we owe our grandchildren and great-grandchildren a future.

Succinctly, The Phoenix Condition will be the most significant, negative event of the Third Millennium as populations densities throughout the world swell beyond our current imaginations – and concentration camp conditions follow. Sadly, virtually every scientist, academic, political leader and average citizen is completely unaware of this impending mega-crisis so nothing is being done to mitigate the suffering future generations will endure. It’s tragic that we have betrayed our great-great-grandchildren to such a terrible degree.

   * * *

Tim Donohue is the Executive Director of Key4hope – a social-media, think tank that believes that if we plan our future and work hard to achieve that future, many lives will be saved. Please visit www.key4hope.com for more details.

What I Will Do With This Funding?

My team and I want to promote this social media think tank. Getting these ideas out will save lives. I have also researched how to have a book published and have written a business plan to accomplish this goal. I’ll need funds to have many of these illustrations redrawn, funds to contact the media to get pre-publicity for these ideas and more funds to get this manuscript published. Please help me save lives. 

Risks and challenges

I have a business plan for sending this book to press and publicizing it. But to get this book published will not be an easy thing to do. On the plus side, I have many years of newspaper experience and this will help to get this book published. My team and I truly believe this project will save lives and I’m completely committed to getting this book published. Thanks for donating. TIM

story:
In February of 2014, a few friends got together to launch Potluck Mag. a site that exists as "a journal of diverse and resonant media, narrowing gaps between forms of art, ideas and people." 

Since that day, we've promised to give you original content, not hashtag fodder—and we have, publishing over two hundred works of writers, artists, videographers, musicians, and overall awesome people from all over the world, ranging different genres and art forms. 

Now, just over six months later, we've seen such an incredible array of work, we've, decided it's finally time to make the big jump from online to offline. Yes, that is correct: we're making a magazine.

Potluck Mag will showcase some of our most popular pieces from the site, editors' favorites, and previously unseen work from contributors, all in glossy, lovely print. 

That said, to help make this magazine a reality, we're looking for contributions. In the past six months, we've provided a platform where artists can publicly exhibit their craft and engage with a unique, creative, supportive, and intelligent audience, even if they're just starting out. 

To help further this effort, please consider helping us publish in a new (and, yes, very old) medium, to show some love to the artists who've put themselves out there, and to join some friends for a nice little POTLUCK. 

THANK YOU!

Now, just over six months later, we've seen such an incredible array of work, we've, decided it's finally time to make the big jump from online to offline. Yes, that is correct: we're making a magazine.
Potluck Mag will showcase some of our most popular pieces from the site, editors' favorites, and previously unseen work from contributors, all in glossy, lovely print. 
That said, to help make this magazine a reality, we're looking for contributions. In the past six months, we've provided a platform where artists can publicly exhibit their craft and engage with a unique, creative, supportive, and intelligent audience, even if they're just starting out. 
To help further this effort, please consider helping us publish in a new (and, yes, very old) medium, to show some love to the artists who've put themselves out there, and to join some friends for a nice little POTLUCK. 
THANK YOU!

story:
Who We Are

Shade Mountain Press is a new feminist publishing house with a mission to publish literary fiction by women authors. With the help of generous donors in the fall of 2013, we published two books in 2014 and are gearing up for our two 2015 releases.

SMP books have earned praise from Kirkus (starred review), Booklist, Foreword Reviews, and many other venues. Our 2014 novel, Her Own Vietnam, is a finalist for the Indiefab Book of the Year Award for Military Fiction.

Your continued support will allow SMP to afford larger initial print runs and help with the expenses of our 2016 title and the costs of applying for nonprofit status. 

What's in It for You

For a $20 perk you can get acquainted with our 2014 titles: 

  • Egg Heaven: Stories, by Robin Parks. Lyrical tales of diner waitresses and their customers. Reviewers describe Parks as "stunningly gifted" and "a master of the short story."
  • Her Own Vietnam, a novel by Lynn Kanter. Praised by reviewers ("compassionate and perceptively told") and veterans' organizations ("one of the best books about nurses in Vietnam"). Won the Silver in the Indiefab Book of the Year Award, military fiction category.
At higher donation levels you can be the first kid on your block to read our 2015 titles:
  • Vanessa Garcia’s novel White Light, which has earned a starred review in Kirkus and was praised by Nobel laureate Wole Soyinka for its “lyrical pace and texture.”
  • The Female Complaint: Tales of Unruly Women, an anthology of short stories by women, featuring nonconformists, troublemakers, and other indomitable females. "The stories sing off the page," says René Denfeld.
These will ship out to you weeks before they're available in bookstores. Who can resist that?

Why Only Women Writers?

In the category of literary fiction, books by women are less likely to be published; those books that are published are less likely to be reviewed; and books with women protagonists are less likely to receive the high-prestige awards. 

Another complication is that when authors approach literary agents or larger publishers, they’re often asked about the marketability rather than the quality of their work. As a publisher, I don't care how photogenic an author is, whether she has a blog or Twitter followers. I just look for beautifully written, memorable fiction. I'll put a book in print and keep it in print rather than abandon it if initial sales aren't high enough.

Why Donations Are Important

Although we got our start based on generous donations in the fall of 2013, we’re not yet seeing enough sales revenue to be self-sustaining. There are several reasons:

  • Literary fiction from a small press often has a slow and steady sales history rather than immediately selling in large quantities.
  • When a book of ours is sold at a bookstore or an online retailer (instead of being sold directly through our own website), we can expect to see about a third of the list price, with the remainder being kept by the retailer, the wholesaler, and the distributor.
  • Even that small amount of money takes six to nine months to reach us. 

Our aim is simple: to make enough money to keep a given title in print and to afford the production and marketing costs for the following year's titles.

We've been very lucky in our ability to minimize costs. My own editing and marketing work is unpaid; generous graphic artists have been donating their own time to do design and layout work; artists have given us permission to reproduce their paintings on our covers for free; our first year's ebook conversion was handled for free--all by people who believe in Shade Mountain's mission.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Let others know about this campaign. Share the links!
  • If you decide to buy a Shade Mountain title online later, buy directly from our website. Our prices are competitive, and it makes a huge difference to us financially.
  • Keep an eye out for next spring's title, a comedic novel by Yi Shun Lai.
Un millón de gracias! A million thanks!

story:
I'm Fine: Suicide Prevention on College Campuses

I’m Fine is a book about suicide prevention and mental health on college campuses, written from my perspective as a recent college graduate who is entering the field of suicide prevention. 

All additional proceeds raised from this campaign beyond the publishing costs will go towards the American Foundation for Suicide Prevention. AFSP’s mission is to “save lives and bring hope to those affected by suicide”, focusing on funding research, education, advocacy, and supporting survivors.  https://afsp.org/

 

Story of My Book:

I wrote this book because I see a need for change. Everyday, young people are losing classmates, peers, friends, partners, and siblings to suicide and mental illness. Suicide is the second leading cause of death for my age group. For young people ages 10-34, the second leading cause of mortality is death by suicide. As a country, we need to do more to look at suicide through a public health lens and to address the fragmentation that is our current mental health care system.

News articles about college students have hit the media hard, referring to a “college student mental health crisis.” Suicidal ideation, depression, anxiety, excessive alcohol use, and mental illness are often joked about on a college campus. Universities, large and small, across the nation are struggling with how best to keep up with an increasing demand for services.

Articles are quick to focus on problems, rather than focusing on potential solutions. As a college student, with lived experience of mental illness, a clinical fellow, and a young researcher passionate about studying suicide risk in adolescents and young adults, it is evident that there is a crisis. However, I aim to bring a unique perspective by speaking to what it is that we can be doing. 

In this book, you'll learn about:

  • Research on the current state of mental illness and suicide on college campuses. 
  • Themes and insights in suicide prevention from leaders who I interviewed including: 
    • Alison Malmon from Active Minds
    • Patrick Kennedy from The Kennedy Forum
    • John MacPhee from The JED Foundation
    • Dr. Rosie Phillips Davis from American Psychological Association
    • Dr. Tom Insel from MindStrong
    • Robert Gebbia from American Foundation for Suicide Prevention
    • Kelly Davis from Mental Health America
    • Jennifer Rothman from National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI)
    • Dr. Daniel Reidenberg from Suicide Awareness Voices of Education
    • Amy Kulp from American Association of Suicidology
    • Dr. Beth Ann Griffin from RAND Corporation
    • Dr. Benjamin Locke from Collegiate Center for Mental Health and Penn State University
    • Dr. Daniel Eisenberg from Healthy Minds Network and University of Michigan
  • Case study of student experiences at the University of Rochester.
  • My lived experience of mental illness, treatment, and recovery.
  • Things that every university can be doing right now.

 

“I’m Fine” is a book for anyone touched by student mental health or suicide. This includes leaders in mental health, advocates, researchers, clinicians, students, parents, professors, and higher education professionals.Whatever hat(s) you wear, whether a top administrator at a university, a parent about to send a child off to college, a young person looking to make a difference, or a professional in the world of mental health and suicide prevention more broadly, I aim to offer a unique perspective to addressing mental health and suicide on college campuses. You will love this book if you are interested in learning more about suicide prevention on college campuses. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will learn more about suicide prevention and mental health promotion on college campuses, as well as the tangible things that can be done to enact change. 

 

About me:

Currently, I work full-time as a Post Baccalaureate clinical fellow in the division of child and adolescent psychiatry at McLean hospital. Before working at McLean, I spent four years doing mental health advocacy and suicide research at the University of Rochester. My passion for this work stems from both my personal and professional experiences. Outside of this book, I love to find peace in running, hiking, nature, concerts, yoga, and meaningful relationships. 

 

Publishing Info: 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. The pre-order tiers are set up to help cover the costs for publishing. This includes editors, graphic designers, copyediting, and marketing.  Shipping costs are included in the pre-sale. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship. https://www.newdegreepress.com/about

 

Other info: 

  • If you have any questions or want to learn more, definitely do not hesitate to contact me! My email is: ekumpf@u.rochester.edu and I am happy to answer any/all questions. 
  • Feel free to share this link with friends, family members, or co-workers who are interested in this topic. 

 

Thank you so much for your support, 

Emily

story:
Farm (and Other F Words) is a book that explores why we farm the way we do, and how we might grow farms differently to grow more good food, create good jobs, and achieve good environmental outcomes.

My name is Sarah Mock and I am the author of Farm (and Other F Words). I’m a freelance agriculture and rural issues reporter, who grew up on a small family farm in Wyoming. I’ve spent the last decade traveling across the country and around the world to better understand why we farm the way we do in America. I’ve learned how the most ambitious and progressive farm and food entrepreneurs are offering healthier, more affordable food while using less exploitative farm work, and working to be land and resource protectors.

In reading this book, you’ll discover that you know a lot more about food and farming than you might think. Together, we’ll interrogate the origin of the small family farm in America, understand why we call some people who work on farms “farmers” and others “farm workers” (and why it matters), and build a playbook to help current and aspiring farmers, investors and entrepreneurs, policymakers and non-profits, and regular people support a more beneficial and just food system every day.

You’ll learn from dozens of farmers, entrepreneurs, founders, and funders what a radically different food system might look like, and how we get there, together. Such as:

  • How a California company revolutionized canned tomatoes by eliminating all managers and embracing self-management.
  • How a pair of young, first generation cattle grazers are turning a hundreds of years old ranching model on its head to professionalize regenerative beef.
  • How BIPOC farming communities have kept alive agricultural traditions that offer a true alternative to our modern farming system.


You will love this book if you have questions about where your food comes from, and felt like you haven’t gotten the full story. You’ll love this book if you’re a skeptic who enjoys the farmers market, but wonders how accessible high-priced, healthy food is to all. And you’ll love this book if you dream of hanging up your office job one day, finding a few acres somewhere, and learning how to grow food.

Farm (and Other F Words) speaks to current and aspiring farmers (and those who support them) who want to grapple with questions of growing food and supporting communities in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Farm (and Other F Words) inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into questions like:

  • What can I really do to support a more just food system?
  • What should we expect from the people and organizations that feed and clothe us?
  • Are small family farms really the best way to grow food?
  • I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers.
 

The Book - Farm (and Other F Words)

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1, The Rise and Fall of the Small Family Farm, contains the author’s note + chapters 1-7. In this section, we’ll dive into the mystery of the missing farms, we’ll meet current farmers from all around the country and understand how they’re succeeding or failing to provide good food, good jobs, and good environmental outcomes. We’ll trace the small family farm all the way back to its earliest origins in the US, and learn about the alternative models we didn’t choose then, but could now.

Part 2, Big Team Farms, contains chapters 8-12. This section will explore farming models that focus specifically on creating good food, good jobs, and good environmental outcomes. Current farm and food business do this, not by prioritizing small scale and family ownership, but by pursuing landscape-level management, finding profitable market opportunities, and valuing their employees, rather than exploiting them. Chapter 12 discusses how technology fits into a future of farming that emphasizes human outcomes, rather than economic ones.

Part 3, The Big Team Farm Playbook contains chapters 13-17. In these highly tactical chapters, we’ll discover quick insights from the book’s characters to help guide anyone looking to participate in supporting Big Team Farms, from policymakers and non-profits to current farmers and everybody else. This section is the brief chaser for those looking to take action (and is riddled with fun Easter eggs!), and will be information you’ll want to return to again and again.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this coming Spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish (and I mean personal).

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Sarah Mock splits her time between freelance farm and rural issues reporting (find her work at The Guardian, Civil Eats, AgFunderNews, and others) and advising progressive farm businesses on marketing, strategy, and business development.

Sarah has been plumbing the agricultural world for nearly three decades, looking for answers to fundamental questions about how to make farms pay, what drives decision-making at the farm level, how to farm without damaging environmental resources, and how to grow food exploiting humans. Farm (and Other F Words) is the culmination of much of that work, and will also act as a playbook for her career going forward, as she strives to nurture and support the Big Team Farms of tomorrow.

Since volunteering as tribute from Wyoming, Sarah now lives in Washington, DC with her partner Bryan and her dog Sagan. She enjoys not only trying to piece together the existential puzzles of farming, but also real jigsaw puzzles as well. She’s a connoisseur of obscure ice cream/custard flavors and is an amateur self-taught vacuum clean repair enthusiast.

For more information, you can connect with Sarah at sarahkmock1@gmail.com and at @sarah_k_mock on Twitter.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #BigTeamFarms and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Sarah Mock

Please use #BigTeamFarms and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Sarah Mock

story:
Hello!

I’m Ryan, a designer, illustrator & writer in Chicago with a background in communications and theatre. I have done various work in theatre, from acting and writing to directing and designing, and have been drawing since I first took a permanent marker to my parent’s bedroom wall. This combo of storytelling and drawing- as well as my love for books- has led up to this unique project, one I’ve been working on for a few years: 

Oh, The Places You Won’t Go is a “coming of age, losing of sanity” tale focusing on facing responsibilities, personal crises, and the trials of existence and societal norms - with lots of comedic charm. This book takes a look at the humors and horrors of how we think, how society works, and the effects on our mental health, personal endeavors, and efforts to “fit in.”  This absurd story doesn’t ask for the purpose of life, it just asks how we manage to stay driven day after day. 

By donating to this project, you can help me share this tale with everyone going through modern day struggles, fans of dark comedy, or those who are just craving for a bit of nostalgia. This book retells a classic tale in a modern voice and is meant for adults only! 

OH, THE THINGS THAT WE NEED AND THE THINGS THAT YOU'LL GET!

Let’s get down to the dirty details: we need funds to get books printed! The more we raise, the more we print, the more people can access this story. Factor in shipping, marketing, websites, all the super fun stuff, and you get a hankering for some money. It’s pretty straight forward, right?

Now, here’s the cool part: if you donate, you can get great perks! Starting at Level 2, this includes a signed edition of Oh, The Places You Won't Go!  There are a number of options for donating, from $15 to $1zillion! You can get signed prints, a sad/cool sticker, dinner with me, and added to an email list that shares details of this journey (and maybe future journeys)! We have outlined a specific goal for a specific number of books. However, as stated earlier, the more we raise, the more we print. This also goes for the opposite, in that if we don’t hit our goal, we print fewer. But, we'll focus on the positive for now, and aim sky high!  

OH, THE REASONS TO CREATE!

Morals never change, but the stories always do. Since humans first learned how to communicate, we’ve been telling stories to entertain, frighten, comfort, warn, and evoke emotion. Now we live in an age of never-ending remakes, adaptations, and regurgitated art. So instead of trying to convince an audience I’ve made something never-before-seen, why not embrace it and make something originally derivative. I’m not here to tell a new story... I’m here to reinvent an old, familiar tale into something topical, relatable, and cringey that takes nostalgia and adds a thick coat of modernism to it. I want people to feel like they can look at topical issues and not be afraid to talk about them, while also giving a good laugh along the way. Truth is easier to swallow when it rhymes and tickles your funny bone.

OH, THE WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

Any little bit helps, but if you find yourself strapped at the moment, the best thing you can do is spread the word. Email this to a friend, share it on your Facebook/Twitter/Instagram, talk about it with your next Tinder date. If every person shares with at least two others... well, you can imagine the places it will take us.  

I’ve poured my heart & soul into this project, and now, I’m excited to not only to take the next step, but to invite others on this journey.

For updates on the campaign and snippets of the book, follow this page, or my Instagram @wiechipedia

story:
Pilgrim, O Henro, Parende, Natalia Mihai Mevlana. Its all the same.

I immerse myself in culture and nature while on a spiritual sport journey, alone on foot; staying as true to myself and the trail and the people I come across, as possible.  I journey over land and time to discover myself and everything else that captures my attention as I walk freely through history and the land before our time. Being in Turkey, immersed in daily life, was liberating and beautiful. I experienced hospitality, like never before and was captivated by the villages and townspeople. The natural beauty, I described in this book, Bella Coma, was like partaking in an 18 course meal, that landscape was so rich and vibrant.

This book was written because it gave me such joy and sorrow to make this journey; and IF it helps ONE person relieve their depression, anxiety, their unhappiness, their loneliness; as it's all manners of suffering that I have lived with; IF this book, makes ONE person laugh out loud, then my job here is complete. We no longer have to drag our fears and unhappiness around with us. Let them go. Walk to the light, whatever that may be for you. 

YOU. Reading this: sloth like creature on the couch. Have all the opportunity to make the above statement a reality for me; for someone else. This campaign is not one to enrich myself; in fact all the funds raised are going to help get the book printed - and that helps me, too, personally; as it has been a dream since grade four to become an author. YOU, dear reader, help make a dream into a realization. Unleash my potential, and allow for more people to get out and walk towards their light. IF there is such an abundance of funds generated; I've asked the Sufi Trail to use some of those funds to help mark the trail. LOL. Please read in the book why I find this humorous.

The biggest motivator, is in my personal opinion, VALIDATION. It will not seem like such a foolish venture to start walking in a strange land without map or care. Slight, wry smile plays upon my lips. Stupid or brave; it all amounts to the same thing. IT WAS AN ADVENTURE!!

To publish the Bella Coma hiking adventure book we need your help

There is a monetary value attached to this campaign. I want to tell you it's one million dollars, but it is not. The budget is set in Euros. It will be simple to purchase items.  

IF it calls to you, and you would like to buy the book, please do. Or some merchandise, please do. IT IS NOT going into my pocketbook. This was never about money for me. As my dad, bless his immigrant heart, said to me, "Do what you love. And the money will follow." Funny statement to me since all he ever thought I was going to be was a factory worker on a press somewhere. 

The funds created here are to help get the book printed; in full color. 

The serial reader speaks (me:) I have SASS; and I'm not afraid to use it. 

This book should be subtitled: The Sass of Natt.

Go ahead universe. I'm listening. Ears. Wide.Open.

Some pray. Some meditate. 

I walk. 

 

 

If we don't reach our entire goal we can still produce and create all items with quantities needed. In case we have more than our goal then we will be able to pay a fair price for the design delivered and the artwork that was created for the Bella Coma book and print more books.

 

The Impact

I would love to continue walking and writing. The Wandering Waitress. The Hungry Lone Waitress Series. You get the idea. I want to do this until I can't anymore. I have another book in the wings, and it's also about other walking adventures. Buy this one first, and you can give me more love and more VALIDATION.

The world needs more solo female walkers. EVERY time I have started out on a new adventure, someone is always afraid for me. I want the world to know, fundamentally we are all the same. One love. One world.

First book, but certainly not the last. Make it happen, people. Make it happen. I would love to be the female version of Anthony B. (may he rest in peace ) on the solo long distance track.

Risks & Challenges

I told my 14 year old daughter yesterday, when struggling with depression several years ago, I had to force myself off the couch. It took LITERALLY one. step. at. a. time. that first day. That is the key to any successful story. Make a first step. Do not let your fear or another persons fear stop you from starting your own adventure.

Just like when we learned how to walk, in the very beginning in the early stages of our lives: it all starts with a single step. YOU GOT THIS, SELF!

It takes effort, but YOU are WORTH it:)

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Stay engaged by joining my team - help spread the word by sharing this to your social media channels - Indiegogo makes it easy to do - and chat it up at the water cooler, park, taco bar, neighborhood potluck, dog park, mosque, church, hula-hoop parties, and you get the message. Please help me raise a ruckus and make some noise about my book and Sufi trail! 

Is there a perk or package that you wish I was offering? Let me know!


I look forward to seeing what 40 days of noise and ruckus making can do to start a movement! Let's imagine a better world together. Thanks for joining my team! Share your message with me here or on Facebook. 

My website: www.sufitrail.com 
 Facebook Photo Collection on Sufi Trail

Flickr Picture Collection


FROM MY HEART, TO YOURS

THANK YOU.

Natalia Mihai Mevlana

story:
Short Summary

We believe Lit Camp should be a conference for talented writers...not rich writers. So we work very hard to keep the cost of attending Lit Camp as low as possible...without compromising our commitment to staffing our conference with the best authors, literary agents, and editors in the country. We are equally committed to never turning away a writer we accept because of money.

To make all this possible, we're turning to this campaign.

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising funds to pay the travel expenses for the stellar faculty we've assembled for 2019...Jonathan Lethem, Dana Spiotta, Alexander Chee, and NY literary agent, Brettne Bloom. 

We are also hoping to have enough money left to offer scholarships to Lit Camp for at least 2 (and possibly more) deserving writers.

Every cent we raise will go toward the conference.

Lit Camp is a nonprofit. No one on the Lit Camp Board draws a salary. In fact, each board member contributes $500/year to remain on the board.

To make contributing painless, we're offering some pretty amazing literary perks. Manuscript reviews, help with query letters, literary coaching...and our awesome new Lit Camp baseball jerseys.

The Impact

Getting a book (in any genre) out into the world isn't easy...even for the most talented writers. Lit Camp helps facilitate the journey from aspiring writer to published author. Our workshop faculty has years of experience as teachers of creative writing, and the agents and editors we invite are experts on the world of publishing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, you can help by spreading the word about the Lit Camp Writers Conference and our campaign. Please share this link with everyone you know! These really are some amazing Perks...and who doesn't love writers and books?

story:
What is this book about? 

Hi! My name is Rachel Wei and I am the author of Primed: The Everyday Art of Rhetoric. I wrote this book because I realized that there are a myriad of opportunities for us to harness language in our everyday lives, but we often don’t know how. I wanted to learn how successful professionals in a variety of fields use rhetoric to help them achieve their goals, and also dig into research on how we can all learn to be more effective communicators. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover practical tips and tricks for how you can better utilize language in your everyday interactions, and also learn to better understand how rhetoric impacts your life. This book will serve as a guidebook for how you can get a better hold on your life by getting a better hold on rhetoric. 

In this book, you'll learn about how to use rhetoric to achieve success. You'll hear stories such as:

  1. How Ancient Greek and Roman academics viewed rhetoric, and taught it
  2. How rhetoric can have a life or death impact on patients in the medical field 
  3. How you can use rhetoric to become a better leader and negotiator 

You will love this book if you are striving for ways to up your communication skills and learn how to better achieve your personal and professional goals. 

Primed: The Everyday Art of Rhetoric is a nonfiction book that speaks to working professionals and anyone who wants to learn how to appreciate and use language in a new way. 

About the Author

Rachel Wei is a Cornelius Vanderbilt Scholar at Vanderbilt University. She is an interdisciplinary triple major studying Biology, English Literature, and Human and Organizational Development. Rachel is an active member of the Vanderbilt Community, holding membership and leadership positions in several organizations, including being a columnist and editor for her school newspaper “The Vanderbilt Hustler,” and Director of Communications for Vanderbilt Student Government (VSG). 

Rachel has always been drawn to language and its ability to help us achieve, or hinder, our goals. Convinced that despite what some say, words do matter, Rachel set out on a research journey to learn more about rhetoric and how it impacts our everyday lives. 

Rachel is an avid musical theater fan, and is disheartened that Broadway is still shut down. While she’ll be one of the first audience members streaming into theaters when they open back up, she’s been keeping herself busy by reading almost one book a week and learning how to knit during the pandemic. Rachel has also enjoyed re-watching her favorite Disney and Pixar animated films, which, she likes to point out, are not only for children. 

For more information, you can connect with Rachel Wei at rachel.wei@vanderbilt.edu, check out her author page on Instagram at @rachelwei_writes, and/or find her on LinkedIn. 

Why am I having a pre-order campaign? 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021
  • The cover design of my book. (Don't worry, the mockups you see are just placeholders!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this April. 

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will be able to publish a hardcover and an audiobook in addition to paperbacks.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title (both are still subject to change!).
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

I think the content of my book couldn't be more timely in a world where language is constantly used by those in power to impact the general public, for better or worse. I would really appreciate you helping this important  content reach more people by sharing my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. When you post on Instagram or LinkedIn, please tag me so I can help amplify your efforts!

You can find a sharable link at the top of the page.  

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!
Rachel Wei

I would really appreciate you helping this important  content reach more people by sharing my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. When you post on Instagram or LinkedIn, please tag me so I can help amplify your efforts!You can find a sharable link at the top of the page.  Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Rachel Wei

story:
Who We Are

Derailleur Press publishes work that doesn't just get your gears turning—but shifts them entirely. Our poetry, fiction, and nonfiction chapbooks are handmade, because we believe inspirational work deserves a personal touch.

Your contributions will help us print, bind, and distribute our debut poetry chapbook.

What We Need & What You Get

Each contribution will go directly to the printing, binding, and shipping of Violet Mints in addition to building our brand and planning for upcoming works and events. We need $600 to make that happen. If we don't reach the goal, don't worry—we'll still have books but each founder will have to pay out of pocket to cover the difference, taking funds away from future projects. If we exceed our goal, all your contributions will go toward our forthcoming nonfiction chapbook, the micro-essay anthology Conversations With Men.

We are asking for a contribution of $7, but that is neither a floor nor a ceiling. In fact, we're offering gifts for all tiers of donors!

  • $7-$16 gets you a copy of Violet Mints and a Derailleur Press tote bag! 
  • $17-$26 guarantees you a whole season of Derailleur Press books—Violet Mints, plus our upcoming nonfiction and fiction chapbooks as well as a tote.
  • $27-$36 guarantees you a whole season of Derailleur Press books, a tote, plus a personalized project from your chosen founder—Jo will write you a poem, Kate will send you a personalized list of book recommendations, or Cassandra will create a personalized playlist for you. Just let us know which you prefer.
  • $37+guarantees you a whole season of Derailleur Press books, a tote, plus a hand-picked favorite book from one of our three founders (of the genre of your choosing!).

Why we're crowdfunding:

Jo, Cassandra, and Kate are passionate about the power of independent presses and providing a platform for gear-shifting emerging voices. We're also realistic about the financial stakes and requirements in this endeavor and are unwilling to abandon a dream for lack of funds. That's where you come in. We want to jump start our press with this fundraiser so that one day we'll be able to pay our authors, work out of an office space, and even be able to hire staff and make a space for ourselves and our authors in the world of small, independent publishers.  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell your friends! We're on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram as @derailleurpress. More followers means more visibility! 
  • Click the little "share" button at the top of the page to share our campaign across all social media platforms. 
  • Send us a message on any of our social media platforms to let us know you see us and support us. We're so happy you're here looking at our projects, and if contributing in other ways isn't possible, we totally understand– reach out anyway! We still want you to be a part of our little family.

story:
Story of My Book

Winning in Sports Business is about how sports industry legends went about getting their jobs and what they did to take it to the top. Many of these occupations come from different areas and angles, but we dive deep into how it can be done for anyone!

My name is Michael Rasile and I am the author of Winning in Sports Business. I wrote this book because I wanted to help people understand the sports industry more from multiple different career paths, so you can go work towards your dream job.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how industry vets were able to start their sports career journey to give you a better understanding of what you need to do. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for sports business in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you understand what is expected of you during any point of your career and any career path you'd like to take in the sports industry.

In this book, you'll learn about how to get your foot into the door into the sports industry and the mindset you need to take it to the top:

Brandon Steiner tells us how he was able to start his New York sports marketing empire.

David Meltzer tells us how to make sure you can get in with any company.

Mark Simon tells us how he got his job at ESPN.

You will love this book if you want to learn about the behind the scenes stories of the sports industry.

Winning in Sports Business is a non-fiction book that speaks to students, career changers, and general sports fans who are looking at getting into the sports business industry and want to hear amazing stories from people all over the sports business landscape for the first time.

The Book - Winning in Sports Business


The book is written in 3 Parts....

In part 1 of the book you'll learn about competition in the sports business industry and the science of generosity.

Part 2 contains Chapters 4-11. In this section of the book you'll hear stories from high level sports business people from many different areas. Doctors, lawyers, and business executives will tell us how they got into the sports industry and what they did to take it to the top.

Part 3 contains Chapter 12. This section will help you understand how high school students, college students, and career changers can take advantage of this book.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in Dec 2020.

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this [season of year]

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author


Michael Rasile is the owner of Our Athletes, where I help athletes with sponsorship and endorsement opportunities.
 

I love the sports industry and because I can't play in it, I thought I'd try and work in it. After realizing that the space is way more different than most industries, I wanted to help other people understand that there are so many different jobs and opportunities in the space. I was curious how some of the best people in the industry got into the high places they've been!

I love sports so much, and that's about it. I watch them, play them, and find ways to integrate them into my life as much as possible.

For more information you can connect with Michael at michael.rasile1@gmail.com and @MichaelRasile1 on Twitter.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #WinningInSportsBusiness and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Unconditionally,

Michael Rasile

story:
What is Glitter Husk?

 

GLITTER HUSK is a chapbook of poems exploring the links between pleasure, grief, & memory. A chapbook if a short collection of poems centered on uniting themes (25-30 pages). While this is not a full-length book, the chapbook will serve as a sampling of what poems I've been writing for the past two years. 

GLITTER HUSK is also a POETRY & PERFORMANCE TOUR. With GLITTER HUSK, I want to tour the southeast to perform collaborative shows at coffee shops, bookstores, poetry slams, music halls, dive bars, back porches, museums, & elsewhere. 

GLITTER HUSK is also an audio book. In the interest of making the poetry project accessible to as many people as possible, purchases of the GLITTER HUSK chapbook will include an audio book of the poems (read by me!)

GLITTER HUSK is what happens when you bejewel the shucked shedding of a cicada.

GLITTER HUSK is more than just a book, but rather also an artistic project inviting collaboration, community building, & serious conversation about mental health, addiction, & surviving grief.

 

Who is Derek Berry?

 

Derek Berry is an award-winning poet & novelist living in South Carolina.

They are the author of the novel "Heathens & Liars of Lickskillet County" (PRA, 2016) & poetry chapbook "Skinny Dipping with Strangers" (Good Juju Press, 2018). Their work has been featured in over forty literary journals including Beloit Poetry Journal, Gigantic Sequins, BOAAT, Yemassee, Raleigh Review, Taco Bell Quarterly, & elsewhere.

They have been the recipient of the Emrys Poetry Prize, KAKALAK Poetry Award, The Patricia & Emmett Robinson Prize, Poetry Matters Prize, & Broad River Prize for Prose. Their work has recently been nominated for the Pushcart Prize & Best of the Net. 

 They are the co-founder the literary non-profit The Unspoken Word, which provides an independent space for literary arts in Charleston County. They have volunteered in classrooms, both for adults and youth, to provide literary education across the Southeast.

They are passionate about poetry, writing, & community. They strive to bring together disparate hubs of writers across the South to network, build, & thrive. They have performed in over three hundred venues, including Charleston Music Hall, Gaillard Performing Arts Center, Gibbes Museum, Greenville Peace Center, as well as bars, cafes, museums, & classrooms across the country.

Why is Glitter Husk important to me?

 

GLITTER HUSK is a community-publishing project.

I want this project to rely on the people I love. You, the friends I've made along this crazy journey. You, the folks who have uplifted & taught me, who have buoyed me into greater heights of joy & understanding.

I want this book to be one created, produced, & funded by my community. 

This is my "Big Ask."

Let's put a new chapbook of poetry into the world. Let's help these poems travel across the country & perhaps the world. The poems included in this slim collection are some of the most important poems I've written in my life. Some of them have appeared in journals, which you can read on my website, and some of them will be brand new.

Let's make this gorgeous anomaly into a book.

 

Funding & Rewards

 

I am asking for your help in funding the publication of GLITTER HUSK & a brief poetry tour, but you're going to get some cool stuff in return!

The fundraising goal is $3,500!

This is to fund the book editing, book layout, book printing, cover artwork, online & physical marketing, photography, graphic design, gas money, tour food, tour accommodations, release party, audio book recording, audio book production, & more!

It is an ambitious goal & we're going to make it, because my friends are awesome!

Below, find the level of funding that's right for you.

'Just Give Me the Book' Level

$15

  • GLITTER HUSK physical book, signed by Derek Berry
  • GLITTER HUSK audio book
  • Invitation to GLITTER HUSK release party! (details forthcoming)
  • Shout out in Fundraiser Videos posted to Facebook, Youtube, & Instagram

Poetic Patron Level

$30

  • Access to exclusive Daily Poetry Prompts via email or Facebook during National Poetry Month (April 2020)
  • Special "Thank You" in the Acknowledgements Page
  • GLITTER HUSK physical book, signed by Derek Berry
  • GLITTER HUSK audio book
  • Invitation to GLITTER HUSK release party! (details forthcoming)
  • Shout out in Fundraiser Videos posted to Facebook, Youtube, & Instagram

Wordsmith Level

$50

  • Personalized Poem
    • Topic of your choice
    • Up to twenty lines
    • Written on a cool typewriter & sent directly to you!
    • Great to commemorate a birthday, wedding, Mother's Day, Bar Mitzvah, or any other special occasion
  • Access to exclusive Daily Poetry Prompts via email or Facebook during National Poetry Month (April 2020)
  • Special "Thank You" in the Acknowledgements Page
  • GLITTER HUSK physical book, signed by Derek Berry
  • GLITTER HUSK audio book
  • Invitation to GLITTER HUSK release party! (details forthcoming)
  • Shout out in Fundraiser Videos posted to Facebook, Youtube, & Instagram

Viva La Volta Level

$60

  • Revision Services
    • Will read & critique up to three (3) poems, offering critical feedback, further prompts, suggested reading, & any other advice!
  • Access to exclusive Daily Poetry Prompts via email or Facebook during National Poetry Month (April 2020)
  • Special "Thank You" in the Acknowledgements Page
  • GLITTER HUSK physical book, signed by Derek Berry
  • GLITTER HUSK audio book
  • Invitation to GLITTER HUSK release party! (details forthcoming)
  • Shout out in Fundraiser Videos posted to Facebook, Youtube, & Instagram

Writing Workshop Level

$100

  • Skype Poetry Seminar
    • One hour Seminar including poetry critiques, prompts, readings, & discussions
    • I have taught writing workshops around the state for several years, & this is your chance to have a one-on-one workshop with Derek Berry. 
    • 1 Hour Skype Conversation about Topic of YOUR choice!
    • Let's talk sonnets, voltas, blank verse, terza rima, poetry slams, persona, & more!
  • Revision Services
    • Will read & critique up to three (3) poems, offering critical feedback, further prompts, suggested reading, & any other advice!
  • Access to exclusive Daily Poetry Prompts via email or Facebook during National Poetry Month (April 2020)
  • Special "Thank You" in the Acknowledgements Page
  • GLITTER HUSK physical book, signed by Derek Berry
  • GLITTER HUSK audio book
  • Invitation to GLITTER HUSK release party! (details forthcoming)
  • Shout out in Fundraiser Videos posted to Facebook, Youtube, & Instagram

Bring Me to Your City To Read Poems! Level

$200

  • Poetry Performance
    • Thirty minute poetry reading/performance with yours truly Derek Berry
    • I will come to the poetry venue of your choice (within 200 miles of Aiken, SC) & read my book to you. Please hook me up with your local poetry show & we'll talk.
  • Access to exclusive Daily Poetry Prompts via email or Facebook during National Poetry Month (April 2020)
  • Special "Thank You" in the Acknowledgements Page
  • GLITTER HUSK physical book, signed by Derek Berry
  • GLITTER HUSK audio book
  • Invitation to GLITTER HUSK release party! (details forthcoming)
  • Shout out in Fundraiser Videos posted to Facebook, Youtube, & Instagram

Poetry Show + Workshop In Your City Level

$300

  • Poetry Performance
    • Thirty minute poetry reading/performance with yours truly Derek Berry
    • I will come to the poetry venue of your choice (within 200 miles of Aiken, SC) & read my book to you. Please hook me up with your local poetry show & we'll talk.
  • In-Person Master Class provided to you, an organization, & friends in YOUR city
    • One-hour workshop with prompts, readings, & instructions on the poetic topic of your choosing

GLITTER QUEEN LEVEL (Three Slots Available)

$300

  • Manuscript Revision
    • Derek will work one-on-one to provide in-depth craft feedback to your poetry manuscript
    • Up to 60 pages
    • Two sessions during which you will discuss structural, editorial, & thematic revisions to your manuscript-in-progress
  • Skype Poetry Seminar
    • I have taught writing workshops around the state for several years, & this is your chance to have a one-on-one workshop with Derek Berry. 
    • 1 Hour Skype Conversation about Topic of YOUR choice!
    • Let's talk sonnets, voltas, blank verse, terza rima, poetry slams, persona, & more!
  • Access to exclusive Daily Poetry Prompts via email or Facebook during National Poetry Month (April 2020)
  • Special "Thank You" in the Acknowledgements Page
  • GLITTER HUSK physical book, signed by Derek Berry
  • GLITTER HUSK audio book
  • Invitation to GLITTER HUSK release party! (details forthcoming)
  • Shout out in Fundraiser Videos posted to Facebook, Youtube, & Instagram

Glitz & Glamour Level

$500

  • Bring Derek to perform anywhere on the East Coast (or Midwest)
  • In-Person Master Class provided to you, an organization, & friends in YOUR city
    • One-hour workshop with prompts, readings, & instructions on the poetic topic of your choosing
  • 10 copies of GLITTER HUSK
  • Revision Services
  • Personalized Poem
  • Access to Daily Poetry Prompts (April 2020) for you & 9 friends!

 

(Interested in a mix of these awards? Contact me & we'll hook you up with the donation level that's right for you!)

 

Risks, Challenges, & Stretch Goals

 

$3,500 is a tall order, so what happens if you don't meet your goal, Derek?

Glad you asked. We're going to print & publish GLITTER HUSK.

Your contributions, however, will contribute to creating BEAUTIFUL ARTWORK for the book, INNOVATIVE marketing, Travel Funds for the Book Tour to get this beauty into as many hands as possible, the production of the AUDIO BOOK, & further projects.

 

STRETCH GOAL: $4,000

We'll expand the tour from the Southeast to the Northeast as well, so I can see good friends in New York, Boston, Chicago, & elsewhere!

STRETCH GOAL: $4,500

We'll produce & release an audio project-- a collaboration with sound engineers, electronic music artists, & more to bring the poems to life.

STRETCH GOAL: $5,500

We'll create an art installation featuring artwork connected to the central themes of the book!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Listen, I've been broke before. I understand. But still want to help? Here's how!

  • Post about this campaign on social media! Share your favorite poem of mine on Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram, then point them in the direction of this page!
  • You can share the campaign directly from the campaign info page. Go ahead, try, it's easy!

 

Thank you for your support! Let's make this project sparkle!

$3,500 is a tall order, so what happens if you don't meet your goal, Derek?
Glad you asked. We're going to print & publish GLITTER HUSK.
Your contributions, however, will contribute to creating BEAUTIFUL ARTWORK for the book, INNOVATIVE marketing, Travel Funds for the Book Tour to get this beauty into as many hands as possible, the production of the AUDIO BOOK, & further projects.
 
STRETCH GOAL: $4,000
We'll expand the tour from the Southeast to the Northeast as well, so I can see good friends in New York, Boston, Chicago, & elsewhere!

We'll produce & release an audio project-- a collaboration with sound engineers, electronic music artists, & more to bring the poems to life.
STRETCH GOAL: $5,500
We'll create an art installation featuring artwork connected to the central themes of the book!
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Listen, I've been broke before. I understand. But still want to help? Here's how!

Post about this campaign on social media! Share your favorite poem of mine on Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram, then point them in the direction of this page!
You can share the campaign directly from the campaign info page. Go ahead, try, it's easy!

 
Thank you for your support! Let's make this project sparkle!

story:
Story of My Book

My name is Tino Chibebe, and I am the author of The Black Opportunity. I was inspired to write this book because, from the outside looking in, there was a lack of people that looked like me in the venture capital space. Venture capital is a type of financing that startup companies with high long-term growth potential receive from investors. I believe that this space will continue to shape the world for generations to come. I want black voices to be included in that vision of the world. I want to see a world that includes products by them and for them and to see businesses by black people getting the investment and attention they deserve.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the challenges that black people in Belgium are facing, challenges that exclude them from the venture capital (VC) space in Belgium. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with the intersection of VC, entrepreneurship and Afro-Europeans and learn what the current landscape is like in Belgium and what needs to be done to get black people a seat at the table.

You will love this book if you’re interested in VC, entrepreneurship, and inclusion.

The Black Opportunity speaks to venture capitalists and entrepreneurs in Belgium who want to grapple with inclusion and innovation in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that The Black Opportunity inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue pressing into engaging questions like:

How do we tap into the underrepresented black community in Belgium?

What are the challenges that black entrepreneurs face?

How do we create inclusive environments within VC?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing venture capital, entrepreneurship, and minority participation will change us all for the better.

 

The Book - The Black Opportunity

The book is written in 3 Parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-3. In this section, the reader will learn about the situation in Belgium, regarding black entrepreneurs and VCs. The reader will be introduced to VC, how it came to be, and what it looks like right now in Belgium. Belgium is one of the most innovative hubs for entrepreneurship in Europe but is still behind in terms of black inclusion.

Part 2 contains chapters 4-6. Within these chapters, the reader will learn about how to create inclusive spaces within VCs and gain insight into how to approach some of the socio-economic situations black people face in Belgium and beyond. In one case, a black female founder’s fortune only changed when she got a white male founder on board. The unexpected consequences, however, were that VCs thought he was the brains behind the operation and ignored her in meetings. We find out what causes some of these prejudices and how to recognize them.

Black Belgians are one of the most qualified communities when it comes to tertiary education but fail to find jobs that align with their qualifications. We find out why this is, how this affects the way VC teams look and what the way forward is from industry experts.

Part 3 contains chapters 7-9. In this section, there will be case studies on the effect of diversity in VC teams. We will also get insights into what diverse VC teams investing in diverse founders can do for the startup community and the marginalized communities themselves. We also look into the unicorn effect and how that can create start up mafias like the PayPal and FlipKart mafias. Diversity is valuable. It results in better decisions and yields better returns.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go toward the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020

The Cover Design of my book - the mockups you see currently are placeholders!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for my book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now. When I publish, you will receive the following:

A personally signed copy of my book

A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book

And more...

 

How to order the book

If you have a credit card, you can simply head over to the "Select a perk" section and make your purchase!

If you don't have a credit card, email me at tfchibebe@gmail.com and state with your perk of choice and I'll send you details on how to pay. 

 

About the Author

I am a talented communicator, all-around "good guy" and digital native who makes any work environment more enjoyable and efficient. I am deeply involved in life at the KU Leuven, formerly holding responsibilities on behalf of the university as President of Capitant Brussels, "the student's gateway to financial markets in Belgium," and also a former member of the Business Student Society of Brussels, an organization that empowers future business leaders.

In addition to university life, and always having wanted to make a difference, I have involved myself in non-profit organizations. Previously, I held the position of Lead Mentor at MCW Global, a social entrepreneurship incubator. In the past at The Best of Both Charity, I was Head of Marketing, and at Sight - Impact Brand, I held the position of Digital Brand Manager and Media Specialist and later Marketing Director. Both projects were geared to developing underdeveloped regions, especially where education and entrepreneurship in Africa is concerned.

Being a creative and innovative thinker, I have applied these qualities to both developing effective marketing collateral for organizations and successfully communicating them across multiple digital media platforms. In addition to socially driven projects, I also enjoy writing, and so here we are :) I have written for Complex's Greenlabel, was previously LinkedIn Campus Editor, part of the Brussels Writer's Circle, and have a Medium following of 200+ fans.

In addition to writing, I love rap music especially Drake. Maybe I like Drake a little too much.

For more information, you can connect with me at tfchibebe@gmail.com and through LinkedIn at
https://www.linkedin.com/in/tinochibebe/.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #TheBlackOpportunity and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

Tino Chibebe
