story:
About Tolkien’s Overture

In Tolkien’s Overture, writer and podcaster John Carswell continues his exploration of Tolkien’s lesser known works by turning his attention to “Ainulindalë”, also known as “The Music of the Ainur.”

Originally published as part of The Silmarillion in 1977, “Ainulindalë” is the creation story of Middle-earth. Like the biblical creation account, it begins mysteriously with one great Divinity, but from there goes down a far different path. Whereas the biblical story involves speaking creation into being, Tolkien’s vision involves the creation of lesser gods who then create a great music that brings Middle-earth into reality.

In Tolkien’s Overture, John conducts a close reading of the text of “Ainulindalë”, and then goes on to explore the role of music in Middle-earth’s history, from the creation of Elves, Dwarves, and Men in the First Age to the great events of the late Third Age as recounted in The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings. Furthermore, it delves into the mystery of evil, as embodied in the mighty Melkor, the great villain of the First Age and the mentor of Sauron, the Dark Lord of Mordor.

From the mystical song of the seas to the voice of Lúthien to the strangely musical ways of Tom Bombadil, the reader will come away with a far deeper understanding of Tolkien’s imaginary world, and see clearly how music is truly the preternatural fabric from which Middle-earth is made.

Act Now to Be a Part of Tolkien’s Overture Forever...

Thank you so much for considering supporting Tolkien’s Overture. “Ainulindalë” is an incredible legend, and I can’t wait to share my insights on it with the world! Like Tolkien’s Requiem, this book will be self-published. That means I need to cover the up-front costs, including the cover art creation, pre-printing production, and the finalization of the manuscript.

For anyone who supports the project financially, you will get some freebies along the way (see Other Reasons You Should Contribute below). For those able and willing to contribute at a higher level, there are some great perks available.

In addition to the paperback, e-book, MP3 audiobook, and PDF versions that will be available at publication, the following perks are available for those who financially support this fundraising campaign for Tolkien’s Overture:

  • BOOK PATRON: Have your name listed in all copies of the book as a “Patron”.
  • LIMITED EDITION SIGNED COPY: Limited to 150 numbered and specially-sealed copies. They will be autographed (and personalized if you would like). Furthermore, you will be given a special designation in the list of Patrons. Finally, you’ll get an extra paperback copy so that you don’t have to risk damaging this copy when you read the book.
  • EXECUTIVE EDITOR: Limited to 14. All the above perks PLUS you will be listed as 1 of 14 Executive Editors on one of the first pages of the book. Additionally, you’ll receive 5 paperback copies to sell, give as gifts, or whatever else you’d prefer.
  • EXECUTIVE EDITOR + PROOF: Only 1! Get the one-of-a-kind PROOF copy. You receive all the perks of the previous tiers AND be listed above the 14 Executive Editors on one of the first pages of the book.

Additionally, there will be several special “BOOK PATRON AND ABOVE” giveaways through the course of this fundraising campaign.

About John Carswell

John Carswell is the co-host and producer of The Tolkien Road podcast (TolkienRoad.com), which is dedicated to the in-depth exploration of JRR Tolkien’s works from The Silmarillion to The Lord of the Rings. His first book, Tolkien’s Requiem: Concerning Beren and Lúthien, was published in 2015, and has received widespread acclaim. He writes about Tolkien and other matters at TrueMyths.org.

Praise for Tolkien’s Requiem

"I wish I’d been able to read [Tolkien's Requiem] years ago. I find a lot of Tolkien criticism dull, boring, borderline unreadable, but [the] passion and love of Professor Tolkien come through in every sentence..."

-- Lance Acanfrio

"I enjoyed reading this and look forward to jumping into The Silmarillion again, with greater attention to Beren and Lúthien."

-- Nicole Stallworth

"This is too wonderful...What a gift to the world!"

-- Anna Yager

Other Reasons You Should Contribute

Even if you can’t contribute at the Patron-level or above, any amount of money given will automatically gain you the following perks:

  • Entry in the weekly giveaway for supporters only during the course of the campaign. Prizes range from Tolkien books to signed copies of Tolkien’s Requiem.
  • Additional surprise perks as the pre-order period continues!

story:
'The witchiest witch in the forest' is the story of Caroline Munroe. She decides one summer's night that she will be a witch. This decision comes with a cat named Whisper and a broom named Barnaby. Also, there is a witch's hat. But she doesn't give it a name, as it is just a hat.

Her mother is scared.

Her father is scared.

Even her dog Freckles is scared.

(So scared in fact that he hid behind a tree, I think he might even still be there, afraid to come out).

So she heads out to the deep dark forest, to find the village of the witches, but when she gets there...

Well, you will just have to wait and see. Does she meet a yeti? Solve world hunger? Compete in olympic level synchronized swimming? I am not telling. Not yet anyway.

All I will say it that it involves shoelaces, the cutest witch's cat of all time, and the eating of vegetables.

Probably suited for kids roughly five to eight years old, but we won't judge you if you get one for yourself.

 

The higher donation amounts come with gloss printed posters, or T-shirts printed with hand drawn original art from the book. There will be four to choose from.

(They could be one day adorning your wall, or body, or the wall or body of your choice).

 Click over to the gallery section to see samples of the illustration style.

(As we are still working on the book, some images are 'work in progress' and are not representative of the final quality)

Printed books will be high quality, softcovers will be perfect bound, not saddle stapled, and hardcovers come complete with casewrap.

The largest percentage of all funds raised will go to my four year old nephew and his mother, to help them as he undergoes chemotherapy in order to beat lymphoblastic leukemia.

The rest will go to finishing and distributing this book and accompanying merchandise to YOU. Because you deserve it, you wonderful human being. 

I sometimes write novels, or at least work on them. (If it helps, you can picture me in a snowy mountain cabin, tapping away on an old typewriter whilst the storm rages at the window, or on a beach with a cigar, scrawling furiously in a battered notebook) This is my first children's book, but two more are coming soon, and all will be illustrated by the talented Valerie Auersperg. (If it helps, you can picture her painting in the forest, using the juices of berries for paint and the tail of a passing squirrel for a brush).

You can read clips of my other writing here:

www.nightingate.net 

and see more of Val's work here: 

valerism.tumblr.com or www.facebook.com/iamvalerism 

 

Thank you for taking the time to look at our project, we look forward to sending you things!

 

Ben & Val.

 

PS: You can contribute to our campaign via PayPal, even if you do not have a PayPal account.  Use your credit or debit card to "Pay as a Guest" without signing in:

  1.  When you get to the PayPal screen, you'll see up top "Choose a Way to Pay"
  2.  Select the second option: "Pay with a debit or credit card"
  3.  Complete the form - PayPal accepts Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and American Express
  4.  Deselect the checkbox that says: "Save this information with a PayPal account"
  5.  Click "Review and Continue" to continue with a payment using a credit card
  6.  Click on the "Continue Without Logging In" link
story_txt:
'The witchiest witch in the forest' is the story of Caroline Munroe. She decides one summer's night that she will be a witch. This decision comes with a cat named Whisper and a broom named Barnaby. Also, there is a witch's hat. But she doesn't give it a name, as it is just a hat.
Her mother is scared.
Her father is scared.
Even her dog Freckles is scared.
(So scared in fact that he hid behind a tree, I think he might even still be there, afraid to come out).
So she heads out to the deep dark forest, to find the village of the witches, but when she gets there...
Well, you will just have to wait and see. Does she meet a yeti? Solve world hunger? Compete in olympic level synchronized swimming? I am not telling. Not yet anyway.
All I will say it that it involves shoelaces, the cutest witch's cat of all time, and the eating of vegetables.
Probably suited for kids roughly five to eight years old, but we won't judge you if you get one for yourself.

story:
What is Paradigm?

Paradigm is a literary magazine for Millennials who are sick of politically-infused journalism and literature that sounds pretty but has no purpose. Based on George Orwellâ€™s essay â€œWhy I Write,â€ Paradigm accomplishes what Orwell hoped to: to make political writing (i.e. writing that motivates people to change their world) into an art form. Paradigm does this by publishing fiction, creative nonfiction, and poetry that are written well and enact change. All of its art tells a meaningful story on its own or responds to writing that does.


All of Paradigm's sales profits go to a featured organization/project. Issue 2 will support the Twelve Cities Project. Read more about it at 12cities12months.com.


And be sure to check out ParadigmLit.com for more information about the magazine - and to read content from issue 1!

Why We Need Your Money!

Paradigm Literary Magazine has been a dream of mine since sophomore year of college. Last semester I had the opportunity to produce its first issue! I want to keep the magazine going, but as a college student, I don't have the funds to do this on my own. This is where you come in! I estimated that to make issue 2 even better than issue 1, which had a budget of just under $500 (all from my pocket), we need to raise $1,200.

So where will that money go?

~$900 will go to printing costs. We spent $300 for printing 50 copies of issue 1, which had 32 pages. Issue 2 will have about 56 pages. If we stick with the same printer, the added page count will put us at about $500 for 100 copies.
These 100 copies will be both sold and distributed. Some will accompany Nick Arnett on his Twelve Cities Project. All money for those copies will go to the project.

$100 will go to the cover designer. Issue 2's cover designer has already been hired. You can check out his work over at jeffbeaverart.com.

$100 will go to the "editor's choice" for writing. Writers for issue 1 didn't have a chance to make any cash, unlike the cover artist. So, once all writing has been submitted, I will pick my favorite piece and pay the writer for his or her work. 


Any extra money will be reinvested into Paradigm's next issues!

Other Ways You Can Help

Just telling people about Paradigm can do a world of good! If you know any writers or artists, send them to paradigmlit.com! And if you have any rich friends, send them here! ;)

story:
Short Summary

Jersey Shore, Brooklyn 11223, and Mama’s Boys of the Bronx are currently the only representations of Italian Americans in our culture. So, if you’re Italian American you have very few positive images to identify with, and if you’re a woman, these positive images are even less. According to current media, all 20-something Italian American women are loud, brash, idiotic, overtly sexual, and materialistic.

It’s time to take back our voice. 

I am of Italian descent, and I lived in Rome for 6 months. While in Rome, I completed a research project on Italian women's responses to visual culture. It was a truly informative project.  

After this experience, I attended grad school for Women's & Gender Studies at DePaul University. While at DePaul, I had my first vision about this project. I had to put it on the backburner, however, while I finished my thesis. 

Now that I have the time, (and the contributors!), I am really, really wanting to complete this project. To my knowledge, there isn't anything out there regarding Italian American women and feminism, thus, I feel like there is a definite need for this.

What We Need & What You Get

I was laid off in January, so I am unable to use any of my own funds (it wouldn't be enough, anyways) to complete this book. The funds I receive through this project will go towards making this book a reality.

Basic self-publishing costs include purchasing ISBN numbers, editing, various website registration costs and legal fees. Those items total roughly $1,000. Other costs include cover art, campaign fees and on-demand printing fees (including shipping), $2,500.

If I don’t reach my goal, I will use the funds that are contributed to every aspect I possibly can on furthering the publication of this book.

The Impact
There aren’t enough books out there sharing the Italian American feminist perspective. I believe we have something to say, and I believe the interest is there. The book will impact feminist studies as well as cultural studies. Academic and non-academic individuals will find value in this book. We can always find value in someone else’s perspective. 

Other Ways You Can Help
I understand that many of you are probably in the same (unemployment) boat as myself. Even if you can’t contribute financially, just getting the word out about my project would be amazing.

story:
היי! אנחנו זרוב ותומסו. פרשנו מהעבודות שלנו ונסענו לירח דבש מיתולוגי שאמור להימשך שנה, מהודו ועד ארה"ב. את טיול אנחנו מתעדים בכתיבה ובצילום באתר החינני 

www.zroob.com


אם אתם נהנים מהתכנים שלנו ורוצים לפרגן - אתם מוזמנים לתרום לנו!

ועכשיו, בלעדי לתורמים 15$ עד סוף ינואר: מקבלים למייל את ספר-האוסף השני של "אוסף ההגיגים של זרובבלה". הספר מורכב מקטעי הבלוג הישן והטוב שלא זכיתם לקרוא, או לחלופין - קראתם והתגעגעתם. 

אפשרויות תרומה נוספות - מפורטות ברשימה מימין!


Our Story

Hi! We're Tomaso and Zroob, newly wed couple from Israel.

after years of hard work under big corpoates, we decided to quit - and for a year, do what we really like: travel around the world, meet interesting people, get into all sorts of absurd situatins, and document it by writing and photography in our blog, ZROOB.COM


Our trip starts in India, August 2011, and ends on Burning Man festival, August 2012. If we don't run out of money during the year, that is. 


more information for hebrew readers on zroob.com


The Impact

Our contents is free and always have been free. The donation option is for people who enjoyed our content over the years, and want us to keep on creating.

The more we fund - the braver we get about what we reveal in our blog. 



What We Need & What You Get

The resources we have are limited and we really need your help in fulfiling this one-year trip without selling ourselves to corporations. Your donations will help us see all the places we want to see and experice everything we want to experiance - and then write about it. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Surf zroob.com and enjoy. If you don't read hebrew, you can browse our image-blog on tumblr, or watch our photos on Facebook. Sharing, liking and commenting will be appriciated almost as much as dollars!

story:
Writing, Filming, Farming

Briefly

Remember those five-year plans from the old Soviet Union? Well, this is nothing like them, except that it's a five-year plan. I'm Dan Smith, a field archaeologist at Jamestown, Virginia, and I have a number of projects I'm trying to complete over the next five years. I'm writing two books, one fact and one fiction, developing a many-year dream of making an animated film about the first permanent English colony in the New World, and trying to buy my late brother's farm.

In short, the Indiegogo funding will be used for four main goals:

-  Finishing my second nonfiction book: The biography of Dr. William M. Kelso (2014)

-  Finishing my first fiction novel (first half of 2016)

-  Creating an animated film about the founding of  Jamestown, Virginia (by 2019)

-  Purchasing my late brother’s farm (which the first three depend on) (2014)

Any funds raised by this campaign will be used for purchasing my late brother's farm. I'm really hoping to keep his farm in the family. If the full amount isn't met, I will use whatever is available as part of a down payment and will again try traditional lenders. Hopefully, that will convince them of my sincerity and determination to purchase the farm. If they still are not interested, my sister-in-law, Lynn, has suggested she might consider owner financing. That will still require a down payment, though, so please be assured that the funds from this campaign will be used for the farm purchase. That is my primary goal and it is taking all of my free time. I really want to get back to my writing and get my next two books finished! If you'd like more details, please read on. . . .

Details, details, details

Note: The video above is being used because Indiegogo said folks really want to see who is running the campaign. It's the best one I have so far, but I'll add one with details about the farm soon. In the meantime, please enjoy some information about what we archaeologists find and do!

Writing

The nonfiction book is a biography of the preeminent practicing historical archaeologist today, Dr. William M. Kelso. The working title is “Phoenix Summoned: Resurrecting Lost Worlds from the Ashes,” and it covers his life and over 50 year career of excavating and interpreting the origins of the United States, most notably Jamestown and the original 1607 James Fort site. I've discussed the project with a literary agent who has handled similar works before, some with excellent sales records, and she is very interested in this title. I expect to have this written by the end of the year. (The graphic below is for illustration only--not the real cover. The image is from Microsoft's free clipart collection, and is supposed to be a phoenix.)

Speculative fiction best describes my other current book project. I've already written about 20,000 words for it, most of them in a couple creative writing classes. Its working title is “The Wanderer,” and it's about a man with an unusual ability who travels the world anonymously, for various reasons, but his power makes him noticed and sought after by those who wish to exploit it. I like it because I get to use my graduate degree in international relations and security issues, but it also explores the psychology and motivations of individuals as they choose to do good or bad, at both personal and agency levels. It's much more complex, and interesting, I think, than I'm making it seem here, and I'll be glad to provide excerpts before it's published to those who help fund these plans. I'm expecting to have this finished in the first half of 2016. (Once again, the image below is not the real cover, just another Microsoft clipart.)

Filming

Philip L. Barbour edited a three-volume set titled The Complete Works of Captain John Smith. Included are the known writings of John Smith, one of the founding colonists for the first permanent English colony in the New World, which grew into the present-day United States. There have been many books and movies about Jamestown and John Smith, but too many myths have grown from the previous works--most notoriously the completely unfounded story that John Smith and Pocahontas were romantically involved. For many years I've wanted to make a film, or films, based on the best sources we have for the early years of the founding of Jamestown--the written record left behind by the people who were actually there. Barbour's work is the best place to start because Smith's writings tell such an exciting story that no myth or rumor is necessary to make it thrilling--from his time as a slave in Hungary, to defeating and beheading three Turkish soldiers in single, hand-to-hand combat, to being one of the founders of what became the most powerful nation the world has ever known. I'd like to use Smith's own words to tell this story, and CGI animation is the best vehicle for the project in mind. I have a couple decades of IT experience, but very little with computer animation. Part of my five-year plan is to try to interest an established studio in the project or, if not, then learn that art and assemble a team to help bring Smith's words to life. This is where the five years come in--it will probably take that long to bring this to fruition.

Farming

The fourth immediate goal of this plan is to buy my late brother's farm. The writing listed above was proceeding well, but a few months ago my sister-in-law decided she wanted to sell the farm, which is where I live. Since then, all of my free time has been dedicated to trying to find funding to make the purchase, so my writing has ground to a halt.

My brother and I worked his small farm for over 20 years (we were raised on our parents' farms), and we had many projects we wanted to do, once we had the time. One major goal was to build greenhouses and try to grow warm weather crops all year. This we hoped to accomplish by incorporating solar energy to keep the houses heated at night and in the cold months. Related was experimenting with solar “double cropping,” which allows solar energy collectors and field crops to share the same space (see the map below for the locations of this and other farm plans). We wanted to try to make the farm and residence run entirely on sustainable, renewable energy, and in this location in Virginia, solar energy is the best option so far.

Some of the ideas for winter crop production are based on a system being developed by Eliot Coleman and detailed in The Winter Harvest Handbook. He describes raising cool weather crops in Vermont throughout the year, even without a heating system. We believed that if he could do that in Vermont, we could do even more in the relatively temperate climate of Virginia. We also wanted to establish orchards and vineyards which, with the greenhouses, would allow us to supply local markets with fresh produce all year. And because the local honeybee populations have been severely diminished, we planned to set up hives on the south side of the farm to help increase their numbers. My brother, Donny, passed away before we could realize those plans, and now I'm trying to reach those goals by buying his farm from his widow, but it's not easy to find the funds needed.

As can be seen in the graphic above, there are many plans for the 11 acre farm. On the right can be seen the animal paddock. Here I hope to have open range for dogs, and maybe a few other animals, I’ll get from shelters. We always had many animals on my parents’ farms, but I never liked the idea of raising animals just as food sources. I hope to provide space for animals to live their lives as they want, with no threat of being sold for slaughter. The rest of the graphic is fairly self-explanatory.

Why Indiegogo?

As an archaeologist, I earn very little money. All of us on the crew realize that the real reward for excavating at Jamestown is rediscovering, understanding, and sharing what endures of one of the most important and exciting historical sites in North America. We've already found thousands of features, or places where humans dug in the ground and left "signs" we can read, and between 1.5 and 3 million artifacts, depending on how they're quantified. In addition to the evidence from the early colony years, we've also found many other occupation remnants, including from the Revolutionary War and Civil War, and  thousands of Native American artifacts, some dating as far back as at least 8,000 years. All of this is helping us to understand the beginnings of what grew into the United States.

This leads to my Indiegogo campaign. Traditional funders aren't as interested in archaeology, no matter what it's revealing, as they are in salaries, so I haven't been able to find funding to help purchase my brother's farm. I've been living on the farm as a kind of caretaker, but now my sister-in-law wants to sell it. She's offered it to me for $100,000 but, as noted, traditional lenders aren't interested because of my salary. I've been scraping by on what I earn, but it isn't enough to fund the farm purchase. Because my other three main projects depend on being able to purchase the farm, I'm trying to raise $75,000 with this campaign, hoping that traditional lenders will be willing to finance the rest.

The other projects depend on the farm purchase for a few reasons:

- One is that I need to stay near Jamestown to continue to help save and understand what we can there while we still have the chance--the iron, pewter, and bone artifacts are constantly deteriorating, and we need to get them into the lab's controlled environment.

- I also need to stay at Jamestown while working on Dr. Kelso's biography. He is the Director of Archaeology for the site, and direct and frequent access to him is crucial for writing his biography.

- Another reason is that if I can't find funding, I'll either have to try to find a much higher paying job, translated as moving away from the area, or get a second job. Two jobs would make it very difficult, if not nearly impossible, to finish my next two books (my first was as coauthor of Jamestown Colony: A Political, Social, and Cultural History), and it wouldn't allow time to develop the Jamestown film(s), or even continue the farm plans. So, the first step is getting the farm purchased.

As mentioned above, my writing has been pretty much put on hold for the past few months while I’ve been trying to find funding. With such a tight deadline, any free time has been devoted to the farm purchase. The increasing stress of the looming deadline and lack of interest from funders is, as can be imagined, leading to extreme distraction—whenever I try to write, the thought of having the farm being sold to someone other than me always intrudes on my thoughts. Not only is there so much potential for the farm and solar/greenhouse research projects I’m planning, but it also has tremendous sentimental value for me—my brother and I worked on it together for 20 years, and it’s my last connection to my only brother, who was also my best friend. I really hope to keep his farm in the family.

So, if you can see the importance of telling the story of the many contributions Dr. Kelso has made to the archaeological and historical record of the earliest years of what became the United States, or the additions the nonfiction book and film will make to the historical record, or the potential of the solar and crop research, or even the fun the fiction book might be to read, please consider helping support these efforts.

The PERKS!

Now a little about the perks! Since it will be at least a couple years before I’ll have both books finished and start having produce from the farm projects, and a few more years for the film, I’ll offer some perks that are available now, with promises for the rest when they’re ready.

$1 - My everlasting gratitude. Contribute at this level and I will be forever grateful for your help in achieving these goals. Heck, I'll even throw this one in at all of the rest of the levels, too!

$5 – Email or tweet thank you. You’ll have my everlasting gratitude, and I’ll send you a personal email or tweet saying so—no automated responses here! This will accompany the rest of the perks, too.

$25 – A personal piece of history. I’ll send you a personalized, handwritten thank you on a postcard postmarked at Jamestown, Virginia. This will accompany the rest of the perks, too. (Please include your mailing address with the other perks, too, if you'd like the postcard.)

$50 - You're appreciated! At this funding level, I'll add your name to the list of contributors on my website. Everyone will know of your generosity!

$75 - YOUR arrowhead! Contribute at this level and I'll flintknap a quartzite arrowhead just for you! I learned the art of "knapping" on my first archaeology site, and I'll be happy to make one for you to show my appreciation! It won't be like any found at archaeology sites (because I'm not that good at it), but it'll be your own arrowhead.

$100 – You’re famous! – I’ll put your brief biography on my website—a paragraph or two about why people find you so fascinating!

$100 - More pieces of history. I'll send you a signed Marshalltown trowel like the ones we archaeologists use. It'll be signed thanking you personally!

$100 – Your haiku. Give me a few details about you, or a subject that interests you, and I’ll compose a haiku for you. I never thought about writing poetry, but we had to in one of my creative writing classes, and I actually won second prize in one of the categories and an honorable mention in another! I’ll send it by email or postcard (or both), your choice.

$150 - Phone call. If you'd like, and you're in the U.S., I'll call you at a mutually agreed upon time for a conversation about anything you'd like (almost!). We can discuss my books, the writing process, archaeology, the films I'm planning to make, the farm, solar technology experiments I'm working on, etc.

$150 – My first fiction book signed. After it’s published, I’ll send you a personalized, signed copy of “The Wanderer.” I plan to finish writing this book by the end of 2015.

$250 – My first book signed. You’ll get a personalized, signed copy of my first book, Jamestown Colony, a Political, Social, and Cultural History.

$500 – My second nonfiction book signed. After it’s published, I’ll send you a signed copy of “Phoenix Summoned, Resurrecting Lost Worlds from the Ashes,” the biography of Dr. William M. Kelso. Dr. Kelso has agreed to sign your copy! (I'll sign it, too, if you'd like.) I plan to finish writing this book by the end of 2014.

$500 – Thank you in “Phoenix Summoned.” I’ll thank you in the acknowledgements of “Phoenix Summoned.”

$500 – Thank you in “The Wanderer.” I’ll thank you in the acknowledgements of “The Wanderer.”

$2500 – Your short story. Provide some details about you for a short biography, or tell me something you’d like to have a short story written about, and I’ll write that for you.

$5000 – Lecture at your place. I’ll come to your location and give an informal lecture about my books, the farm and the solar and greenhouse research ongoing there, archaeology (I worked at prehistoric sites before my current work), or anything else I understand well enough to talk about. I’ll provide my transportation up to 150 miles from Jamestown, and we can discuss details about anything beyond that.

$5000 – Dinner and discussion. I’ll come to your location, or you can come to the Historic Triangle area here in Virginia, and we’ll have breakfast, lunch, or dinner and discuss archaeology, writing, and solar/greenhouse farming (or almost anything you’d like!). I’ll provide my transportation up to 150 miles from Jamestown, and we can discuss details about anything beyond that.

$150,000 – I'll help you write YOUR book! Ever wanted to write a book but didn't have the time or patience? Fund all of the projects I'm working on and I'll help you write it! It can be about almost anything you'd like, if I can understand the subject (no advanced particle physics, please). Maybe even your biography! Purchasing the farm is only the beginning of these projects—they’ll all require quite a bit of equipment and materials. I love to research and write, and making it all possible means you deserve to have the world know your story! I have many years of writing, proofreading, and editing experience, and I'll be happy to work with you to get your book heading to the publisher. We can discuss the details of time and timeframe if you choose this option--just email me at dboydsmith@hotmail.com if you're interested in this contribution level. (Well, I can dream, can't I?)
story_txt:
Writing, Filming, Farming


Briefly

Remember those five-year plans from the old Soviet Union? Well, this is nothing like them, except that it's a
five-year plan. I'm Dan Smith, a field archaeologist at Jamestown, Virginia, and I have a number of projects I'm trying to
complete over the next five years. I'm writing two books, one fact and one
fiction, developing a many-year dream of making an animated film about the
first permanent English colony in the New World, and trying to buy my
late brother's farm.

In short, the Indiegogo funding will be used for
four main goals:
-  Finishing my second nonfiction book: The biography
of Dr. William M. Kelso (2014)
- 
Finishing my first fiction novel (first half of 2016)
- 
Creating an animated film about the founding of  Jamestown, Virginia (by 2019)
- 
Purchasing my late brother’s farm (which the first three depend on) (2014)
Any funds raised by this campaign will be used for
purchasing my late brother's farm. I'm really hoping to keep his farm in the family. If the full amount isn't met, I will use
whatever is available as part of a down payment and will again try traditional
lenders. Hopefully, that will convince them of my sincerity and determination
to purchase the farm. If they still are not interested, my sister-in-law, Lynn,
has suggested she might consider owner financing. That will still require a down
payment, though, so please be assured that the funds from this campaign will be
used for the farm purchase. That is my primary goal and it is taking all of my
free time. I really want to get back to my writing and get my next two books
finished! If you'd like more details, please read on. . . .

Details, details, detailsNote: The video above is being used because Indiegogo said folks really want to see who is running the campaign. It's the best one I have so far, but I'll add one with details about the farm soon. In the meantime, please enjoy some information about what we archaeologists find and do!

Writing
The nonfiction book is a biography of the preeminent
practicing historical archaeologist today, Dr. William M. Kelso. The working title
is “Phoenix Summoned: Resurrecting
Lost Worlds from the Ashes,” and it covers his life and over 50 year
career of excavating and interpreting the origins of the United States, most
notably Jamestown and the original 1607 James Fort site. I've discussed the
project with a literary agent who has handled similar works before, some with
excellent sales records, and she is very interested in this title. I expect to
have this written by the end of the year. (The graphic below is for
illustration only--not the real cover. The image is from Microsoft's free
clipart collection, and is supposed to be a phoenix.)



Speculative fiction best describes my other current book
project. I've already written about 20,000 words for it, most of them in a
couple creative writing classes. Its working title is “The Wanderer,” and it's
about a man with an unusual ability who travels the world anonymously, for
various reasons, but his power makes him noticed and sought after by those who
wish to exploit it. I like it because I get to use my graduate degree in
international relations and security issues, but it also explores the
psychology and motivations of individuals as they choose to do good or bad, at
both personal and agency levels. It's much more complex, and interesting, I
think, than I'm making it seem here, and I'll be glad to provide excerpts
before it's published to those who help fund these plans. I'm expecting to have
this finished in the first half of 2016. (Once again, the image below is not the real
cover, just another Microsoft clipart.)




Filming
Philip L. Barbour edited a three-volume set titled The
Complete Works of Captain John Smith. Included are the known writings of
John Smith, one of the founding colonists for the first permanent English
colony in the New World, which grew into the present-day United States. There
have been many books and movies about Jamestown
and John Smith, but too many myths have grown from the previous works--most
notoriously the completely unfounded story that John Smith and Pocahontas were
romantically involved. For many years I've wanted to make a film, or films,
based on the best sources we have for the early years of the founding of Jamestown--the
written record left behind by the people who were actually there. Barbour's
work is the best place to start because Smith's writings tell such an exciting
story that no myth or rumor is necessary to make it thrilling--from his time as
a slave in Hungary, to defeating and beheading three Turkish soldiers in
single, hand-to-hand combat, to being one of the founders of what became the
most powerful nation the world has ever known. I'd like to use Smith's own
words to tell this story, and CGI animation is the best vehicle for the
project in mind. I have a couple decades of IT experience, but very little with computer animation. Part of my five-year plan is to try to interest an established studio in the project or, if not, then learn that art and assemble
a team to help bring Smith's words to life. This is where the five years come
in--it will probably take that long to bring this to fruition.




Farming
The fourth immediate goal of this plan is to buy my late
brother's farm. The writing listed above was proceeding well, but a few months
ago my sister-in-law decided she wanted to sell the farm, which is where I
live. Since then, all of my free time has been dedicated to trying to find funding
to make the purchase, so my writing has ground to a halt.
My brother and I worked his small farm for over 20 years
(we were raised on our parents' farms), and we had many projects we wanted to
do, once we had the time. One major goal was to build greenhouses and try to
grow warm weather crops all year. This we hoped to accomplish by incorporating
solar energy to keep the houses heated at night and in the cold months. Related
was experimenting with solar “double cropping,” which allows solar energy
collectors and field crops to share the same space (see the map below for the
locations of this and other farm plans). We wanted to try to make the farm and residence run
entirely on sustainable, renewable energy, and in this location in Virginia,
solar energy is the best option so far.


Some of the ideas for winter crop production are based on
a system being developed by Eliot Coleman and detailed in The Winter Harvest
Handbook. He describes raising cool weather crops in Vermont
throughout the year, even without a heating system. We believed that if he
could do that in Vermont, we
could do even more in the relatively temperate climate of Virginia.
We also wanted to establish orchards and vineyards which, with the greenhouses,
would allow us to supply local markets with fresh produce all year. And because the local honeybee populations have been severely diminished, we planned to set up hives on the south side of the farm to help increase their numbers. My brother,
Donny, passed away before we could realize those plans, and now I'm trying to
reach those goals by buying his farm from his widow, but it's not easy to find
the funds needed.


As can be seen in the graphic above, there are many plans
for the 11 acre farm. On the right can be seen the animal paddock. Here I hope
to have open range for dogs, and maybe a few other animals, I’ll get from
shelters. We always had many animals on my parents’ farms, but I never liked
the idea of raising animals just as food sources. I hope to provide space for
animals to live their lives as they want, with no threat of being sold for
slaughter. The rest of the graphic is fairly self-explanatory.




Why Indiegogo?

As an archaeologist, I earn very little money. All of us on
the crew realize that the real reward for excavating at Jamestown is
rediscovering, understanding, and sharing what endures of one of the most
important and exciting historical sites in North America. We've already found
thousands of features, or places where humans dug in the ground and left
"signs" we can read, and between 1.5 and 3 million artifacts,
depending on how they're quantified. In addition to the evidence from the early colony years, we've also found many other occupation remnants, including from the Revolutionary War and Civil War, and  thousands of Native American
artifacts, some dating as far back as at least 8,000 years. All of this is
helping us to understand the beginnings of what grew into the United States.
This leads to my Indiegogo campaign. Traditional funders
aren't as interested in archaeology, no matter what it's revealing, as they are
in salaries, so I haven't been able to find funding to help purchase my brother's farm. I've been living on the farm as a kind of caretaker, but now my
sister-in-law wants to sell it. She's offered it to me for $100,000 but, as noted,
traditional lenders aren't interested because of my salary. I've been scraping
by on what I earn, but it isn't enough to fund the farm purchase. Because my
other three main projects depend on being able to purchase the farm, I'm trying
to raise $75,000 with this campaign, hoping that traditional lenders will be
willing to finance the rest.


The other projects depend on the farm purchase for a few
reasons:
- One is that I need to stay near Jamestown
to continue to help save and understand what we can there while we still have
the chance--the iron, pewter, and bone artifacts are constantly deteriorating,
and we need to get them into the lab's controlled environment.
- I also need to stay at Jamestown
while working on Dr. Kelso's biography. He is the Director of Archaeology for
the site, and direct and frequent access to him is crucial for writing his biography.
- Another reason is that if I can't find funding, I'll
either have to try to find a much higher paying job, translated as moving away
from the area, or get a second job. Two jobs would make it very difficult, if
not nearly impossible, to finish my next two books (my first was as coauthor of
Jamestown Colony: A
Political, Social, and Cultural History), and it wouldn't allow time to
develop the Jamestown film(s), or
even continue the farm plans. So, the first step is getting the farm purchased.




As mentioned above, my writing has been pretty much put on
hold for the past few months while I’ve been trying to find funding. With such
a tight deadline, any free time has been devoted to the farm purchase. The
increasing stress of the looming deadline and lack of interest from funders is,
as can be imagined, leading to extreme distraction—whenever I try to write, the
thought of having the farm being sold to someone other than me always intrudes
on my thoughts. Not only is there so much potential for the farm and solar/greenhouse
research projects I’m planning, but it also has tremendous sentimental value
for me—my brother and I worked on it together for 20 years, and it’s my last
connection to my only brother, who was also my best friend. I really hope to
keep his farm in the family.So, if you can see the importance of telling the
story of the many contributions Dr. Kelso has made to the archaeological and
historical record of the earliest years of what became the United States, or
the additions the nonfiction book and film will make to the historical record, or
the potential of the solar and crop research, or even the fun the fiction book
might be to read, please consider helping support these efforts.



The PERKS!

Now a little about the perks! Since it will be
at least a couple years before I’ll have both books finished and start having
produce from the farm projects, and a few more years for the film, I’ll offer
some perks that are available now, with promises for the rest when they’re
ready.$1 - My everlasting gratitude. Contribute at this level and I will be forever grateful for your help in achieving these goals. Heck, I'll even throw this one in at all of the rest of the levels, too!



$5 – Email or tweet thank you. You’ll have my everlasting
gratitude, and I’ll send you a personal email or tweet saying so—no automated
responses here! This will accompany the rest of the perks, too.


$25 – A personal piece of history. I’ll send you a personalized,
handwritten thank you on a postcard postmarked at Jamestown,
 Virginia. This will accompany the rest of the perks, too. (Please include your mailing address with the other perks, too, if you'd like the postcard.)$50 - You're appreciated! At this funding level, I'll add your name to the list of contributors on my website. Everyone will know of your generosity!
$75 - YOUR arrowhead! Contribute at this level and I'll flintknap a quartzite arrowhead just for you! I learned the art of "knapping" on my first archaeology site, and I'll be happy to make one for you to show my appreciation! It won't be like any found at archaeology sites (because I'm not that good at it), but it'll be your own arrowhead.
$100 – You’re famous! – I’ll put your brief biography on my
website—a paragraph or two about why people find you so fascinating!
$100 - More pieces of history. I'll send you a signed Marshalltown
trowel like the ones we archaeologists use. It'll be signed thanking you personally!

$100 – Your haiku. Give me a few details about you, or a

$150 - Phone call. If you'd like, and you're in the U.S.,

$500 – My second nonfiction book signed. After it’s published, I’ll

from
the Ashes,” the biography of Dr. William M. Kelso. Dr. Kelso has agreed 
to sign
your copy! (I'll sign it, too, if you'd like.) I plan to finish writing 
this
book by the end of 2014.
$500 – Thank you in “Phoenix Summoned.” I’ll thank you in

story:
Baba's Kitchen: Ukrainian Soul Food with Stories From the Village

Thank you for visit my Old Country kitchen. My name is Baba (Grandma), and I am narrate this book. I spend many year under Stalin regime, as do my children. My co-author granddaughter write down our story. Her father is also put in Nazi labour camp. He is only one of brother and sister to escape to North America.

Baba's Kitchen is full of crazy and true survival story from immigrant, plus lip smack great food. When she not teaching you to poison Nazi with mushroom, Baba teach you how to shop and cook like real Ukrainian soul food expert.

For example, when you shopping for onion, don't pick kind have green thing growing out from head. She busy making baby, not have time for you!

Baba teach you to measure food by your good eye and with hand. Not always fooling round with stupid spoon and cup. And for sure not use "dry" ingredient like dill. Pah! I spit on it.

My granddaughter first convince Baba to make this thing as modern-schmodern e-book. This what happen: many people line up to hear story. They ask for harder copy. People like to touch paper, spill butter and whisky on page. Lots old people don't know Kindle from Kommunista.

Baba want to travel round, telling oral history to many senior centre and library.

When Baba give standup room only read at library, very old man with Alzheimer sing folk song, and talk about how he survive Stalin purge. Make everybody cry. He need copy of Baba's Kitchen. He go home with nothing!

In Ukrainiansky culture, cooking is spiritual thing that feed not just body, but soul. Is ancient ritual. Book talk about humane farming, because how we treat animal and vegetable is how we treat ourself. Food is living, sacred thing.

Since Baba is healer, book have chapter with natural medicine. You wouldn't believe how many feeling good thing you can do with honey, raspberry and bald man.

We need lots money to make paperback book, promote and sometime donate. Small town library and senior centre don't always have money to give for gas, but we like to visit anyway. Because we is nice people under cranky attitude.

Baba also going to teach workshop in storytelling, along with some wild Ukrainian music. Have support hose ready, and get down with Baba!

Here is website for Baba's Kitchen ebook:

http://www.ukrainiansoulfood.ca

 

What Baba Need & What You Get


-Lots money to edit and reformat. Baba's Kitchen cover needs resize into professional looking book. Cover photo is awesome because Baba make this borshch, but need to have professional re-size.

-Business card, postcard and postage. We going to scatter like wheat at reading, and mail to famous newspaper people. Some lucky newsperson will get actual book.

-Gas and hotel money to visit senior centre, small town library and writer festival.

-Baba attend poetry reading/slam to promote book to young slack hipster. This is largely how book is edit. Baba leave stage to find line of people asking for copy. Her story always come second to some gangstah rapping about his private part, but very close second.

We going to lead storytelling circle, where old people will learn outrageous technique to record own history. Their story going to knock you out from your rocker. Is many people today showing how to think like New Age. Baba show them Old Age. Ha!

-Money for small ad in several community newspaper.

-Possibly lawyer when she tell story about how her friend murder abusing husband with soup and vodka. Baba keep this secret till after friend die.

 

 As supporter, you going to get Perkolated:

-Signed book copies (in ink!)

-Your name in Acknowledgements (you going to be famous person)

-Your own relatives' names in Acknowledgements (they will appreciate, sure thing)

-A sponsor listing on website (you be so proud)

-Old Country proverb directed at you in book (you not going to regret)

-Joke written just for you, inserted into book (just you wait!)

 Here is article about book:

http://tinyurl.com/bfa5xg2

 

If Baba don't reach goal of $5000:

First, she ask, "Why not?"

Baba is frugal person who live on almost nothing. Ukrainian proverb say,"If there are potato and cabbage, then house is not empty." Baba herself never seen house with only these thing. Usually is at least chair and television. But you never know.

Pay-on-demand model is to print book. Too many writer have stack of unsold book in trailer park. Baba will "work smart" by print only as many as she sure she can sell at public appearance.

If she run out, reader will order individual. Business card will have book order information. There will be little to no waste. Like we say, "I am not so dumb as you are smart."

Is Baba really that creative with resource? Yes! For cover photo, food was displayed with item from thrift store. Because Baba lose her best stuff to Soviet.

Photo was taken with ten year old Kodak Instamatic. If good enough for Kodak, why not you?

Re: website and video, "Baba's Kitchen." Photo is from public domain image. Sound clip is produce with home computer that have cheapsnake $80 microphone and $40 sound editor. Special effect was add by wearing (clean) metal mix bowl on head. This make good echo.

Website cost nothing to build---we is teach ourself---and only $100 annual for maintenance. We make this money selling perogy and babushka from back of truck. Was worth it.

 

The Impact

"Baba's Kitchen: Ukrainian Soul Food with Stories From the Village" is lifelong labor of love. We preserve oral history of Stalinist and Nazi survivor, some in our own family. So many untold story and unsung hero!

Book educate about Ukrainian invention: we domesticate horse. Because we is matriarchal, Goddess-base society, we invent pant so woman can ride. We make cheese when we galloping around with mare milk in our purse. And you thought your life was messy.

Recipes is testament to our history: Ukrainian source good food in both abundant time, and when Soviet and Nazi is stealing. Book show transition from pre-Ice Age hunting society to farming. Is something like "Clan of Cave Bear" and "Earth Children" series, told by first person.

190 tasty, low cost dish (many vegetarian) we invent when we have hard time. Onion Honey Sauce that taste great on mammoth jerky, still useful on veggie burger. We have thousands of year practice making excellent flavor.

About Baba's granddaughter, who help write book:

Raisichka help write Baba's Kitchen for 50 years. She also help Baba cut perogy dough circle with little toddler hand. She listen real good to me and my friend story about surviving Stalin and Hitler terror. She somehow make us all laugh about terrible thing.

Like Baba, granddaughter have great passion for social justice, and good food. She is continue faithful to tell our story and rescue animal, even though she have chronic pain from spinal crush injury.

We appreciate very much your support to make book available to many more people.

 

Final Word From Baba

Baba really appreciate if you'd share "Baba's Kitchen" through your crazy Facebook, Twitter, blog and other form of social media. Make good gossip, which is also tradition.

Baba be thrill do interview for your local paper or radio station.

Indiegogo has great Sharing tool, too!

-A sponsor listing on website (you be so proud)
-Old Country proverb directed at you in book (you not going to regret)
-Joke written just for you, inserted into book (just you wait!)

 Here is article about book:
http://tinyurl.com/bfa5xg2
 
If Baba don't reach goal of $5000: 
First, she ask, "Why not?"
Baba is frugal person who live on almost nothing. Ukrainian proverb say,"If there are potato and cabbage, then house is not empty." Baba herself never seen house with only these thing. Usually is at least chair and television. But you never know.
Pay-on-demand model is to print book. Too many writer have stack of unsold book in trailer park. Baba will "work smart" by print only as many as she sure she can sell at public appearance.
If she run out, reader will order individual. Business card will have book order information. There will be little to no waste. Like we say, "I am not so dumb as you are smart."
Is Baba really that creative with resource? Yes! For cover photo, food was displayed with item from thrift store. Because Baba lose her best stuff to Soviet.
Photo was taken with ten year old Kodak Instamatic. If good enough for Kodak, why not you?
Re: website and video, "Baba's Kitchen." Photo is from public domain image. Sound clip is produce with home computer that have cheapsnake $80 microphone and $40 sound editor. Special effect was add by wearing (clean) metal mix bowl on head. This make good echo. 
Website cost nothing to build---we is teach ourself---and only $100 annual for maintenance. We make this money selling perogy and babushka from back of truck. Was worth it.
 
The Impact

"Baba's Kitchen: Ukrainian Soul Food with Stories From the Village" is lifelong labor of love. We preserve oral history of Stalinist and Nazi survivor, some in our own family. So many untold story and unsung hero!
Book educate about Ukrainian invention: we domesticate horse. Because we is matriarchal, Goddess-base society, we invent pant so woman can ride. We make cheese when we galloping around with mare milk in our purse. And you thought your life was messy.
Recipes is testament to our history: Ukrainian source good food in both abundant time, and when Soviet and Nazi is stealing. Book show transition from pre-Ice Age hunting society to farming. Is something like "Clan of Cave Bear" and "Earth Children" series, told by first person.
190 tasty, low cost dish (many vegetarian) we invent when we have hard time. Onion Honey Sauce that taste great on mammoth jerky, still useful on veggie burger. We have thousands of year practice making excellent flavor.
About Baba's granddaughter, who help write book:
Raisichka help write Baba's Kitchen for 50 years. She also help Baba cut perogy dough circle with little toddler hand. She listen real good to me and my friend story about surviving Stalin and Hitler terror. She somehow make us all laugh about terrible thing.
Like Baba, granddaughter have great passion for social justice, and good food. She is continue faithful to tell our story and rescue animal, even though she have chronic pain from spinal crush injury. We appreciate very much your support to make book available to many more people.
 
Final Word From Baba


Baba really appreciate if you'd share "Baba's Kitchen" through your crazy Facebook, Twitter, blog and other form of social media. Make good gossip, which is also tradition.
Baba be thrill do interview for your local paper or radio station.
Indiegogo has great Sharing tool, too!

story:
** Update importante: si è raggiunto un accordo per la pubblicazione di un libro con un editore di ebook, preferito a uno tradizionale. Ci è stata fatta la proposta di allargare la prospettiva di questo viaggio ai luoghi e alle storie newyorkesi dei personaggi del cinema e delle serie tv. Chi ha finanziato il nostro progetto ha espresso parere positivo riguardo a quest'aggiunta. A me sembra un'ottima idea, che ha il pregio di integrare l'idea originale, ampliandone le potenzialità. Seguite il profilo Twitter di questa iniziativa, dove continuerò a dare aggiornamenti fino alla pubblicazione finale. E grazie a tutti. **
 

 

L'obiettivo - New York

È tutto nel titolo, in pratica: un viaggio letterario. L'idea la dobbiamo a un pezzo pubblicato dove lavoro. L'autore descriveva una lunga passeggiata nei luoghi di Milano in cui sono ambientati alcuni classici della letteratura del XX secolo, accostando ai brani delle opere la realtà della metropoli odierna. Perché non farlo a New York?, ci siamo chiesti io e la mia compagna di viaggio. 

Si può dire che sia cresciuto con l'onnipresente compagnia di romanzi, racconti, film e fiction americane, le cui ambientazioni sono diventate luoghi sia "familiari" che d'ispirazione per il mio lavoro. L'obiettivo di questo progetto è seguire le orme di Holden Caulfield, Vito Corleone e molti altri personaggi "newyorkesi" entrati nel nostro immaginario, raccontando i loro luoghi. A portarlo avanti siamo in due: io, che firmerò il libro,  e una persona che ama e apprezza queste ambientazioni quanto me: Serena, che "da grande" vuole fare la traduttrice letteraria e mi aiuterà in ogni passo della sua realizzazione.

Verrà pubblicato con una casa editrice di ebook e parlerà di com'è cambiata la città, confrontando - in uno stile a metà tra il reportage e il discorso letterario - la metropoli dei libri e dei film con quella odierna. Vogliamo esaltare i contrasti, le continuità e l'essenza dei luoghi che visiteremo, senza prediligere una delle due dimensioni.

Di quanto abbiamo bisogno, Come verrà speso, Cosa avete in cambio

Di seguito, alcune informazioni sull'aspirante viaggio:

  • Abbiamo in mente di trascorrere dieci giorni nella "Capital of the World" ad aprile 2015, per completare al meglio il progetto. Ma, a mali estremi, ripiegheremo su una settimana;
  • Sarete anche voi a scegliere le migliori opere letterarie e cinematografiche da considerare nel redigere il testo (alcuni libri potete trovarli qui);
  • Facendo due calcoli, necessitiamo di circa 1,800$ (l'equivalente di 1400€) per comprare due biglietti di andata e ritorno sulla rotta Milano - NY (qui considero i voli EK205-206 di Emirates per il miglior rapporto qualità-prezzo e, in generale, una maggiore disponibilità, ma si vedrà: in ogni caso i biglietti a/r per il prossimo aprile - ora, a 7 mesi di distanza da quella data - oscillano tra i 1200 e i 1400€. Sceglieremo il vettore più economico, ovviamente). Tutto il resto verrà speso per la sistemazione; 
  • Chi dona decide quali libri, film e personaggi aggiungere alla lista! E ottiene anche, a seconda del contributo, cartoline, video, GIF di ringraziamento, souvenir da New York e altro ancora. Cose simboliche, ovviamente, ma speriamo gradite.

Sì, ok, ma perché?

Siamo entusiasti di questo progetto perché, nelle intenzioni, si tratta di un'esperienza peculiare. È un qualcosa di molto personale ma anche in grado di esaltare persone di gusti e sensibilità diverse: chi non si è innamorato di una storia ambientata a New York?

Preciso: ogni contributo è essenziale. Non dovendo trovare fondi per un film o un'opera esosa, è tutta questione di singole donazioni. Alla fine se potremo scrivere dalle strade di New York City, arrivando a una percentuale di completamento soddisfacente, sarà grazie a persone innamorate della fiction ambientata nella Grande Mela.

Possiamo farcela?

Noi pensiamo di sì, altrimenti non ci avremmo provato. Ma se non riuscissimo a partire ad aprile, proveremmo comunque a trovare una soluzione, magari con altri aiuti. E state tranquilli, faremo in modo di mantenere la promessa di consegnare tutti i perk. (Logicamente non potremo mandare subito cartoline o souvenir da NY se non ci andiamo ad aprile perché i fondi non lo consentono, ma avete capito: faremo contenti tutti, ad aprile o dopo).

Ovviamente se non raccoglieremo abbastanza fondi per poter fissare una data di partenza, il progetto sarà dichiarato fallito e risarciremo tutti coloro che hanno contribuito.

"Non posso fare contributi in denaro ma vorrei aiutarvi. Come?"

Se non puoi contribuire un singolo centesimo alla nostra causa, andremo d'accordo comunque. Ecco qualche altra cosa che puoi fare per me e Serena. 

  • Fornire una sistemazione a NY (beh, non c'è da precisare che saremmo eternamente grati, ovviamente, ma ammetto che siamo in zona "speriamo in una botta di fortuna");
  • Passare a salutare a NY, se hai la fortuna di viverci;
  • Dirci dove mangiare i migliori hot dog del posto (ma non soltanto gli hot dog);
  • Diffondere questo progetto like no tomorrow. Aiuta molto.


     

    *

    *

    *

E state tranquilli, faremo in modo di mantenere la promessa di consegnare tutti i perk. (Logicamente non potremo mandare subito cartoline o souvenir da NY se non ci andiamo ad aprile perché i fondi non lo consentono, ma avete capito: faremo contenti tutti, ad aprile o dopo).
Ovviamente se non raccoglieremo abbastanza fondi per poter fissare una data di partenza, il progetto sarà dichiarato fallito e risarciremo tutti coloro che hanno contribuito.
"Non posso fare contributi in denaro ma vorrei aiutarvi. Come?"
Se non puoi contribuire un singolo centesimo alla nostra causa, andremo d'accordo comunque. Ecco qualche altra cosa che puoi fare per me e Serena. 


Fornire una sistemazione a NY (beh, non c'è da precisare che saremmo eternamente grati, ovviamente, ma ammetto che siamo in zona "speriamo in una botta di fortuna");
Passare a salutare a NY, se hai la fortuna di viverci;
Dirci dove mangiare i migliori hot dog del posto (ma non soltanto gli hot dog);

story:
The Story:

Love and madness are two of the most powerful forces in nature. Throughout history, men and women have clutched at the shores of love, too often torn from this one redemption and swept into the angry seas of time, either by fate or the madness bred by society. Men and women both are shaken by this force, which continues to awe, terrify, lift them to heights beyond comprehension and occasionally destroy them. This novel is a deep exploration of passionate love. A strong erotic charge burns through the story.

The novel, about a love story that lasts 600 years, is divided into two parts. The first half is set in The Hundred Years' War (1337-1453) and sweeps across a background encompassing the birth of modern warfare; alchemy; the birth of the theater; and the emergence of a personal art, which lays the foundation for the Renaissance. It also shows the outrages of the Church and the demise of feudalism, with its resultant poverty, savagery and marauding.

The second half of the novel occurs in present times. The chief characters and incidents of Part One exist in contemporary form, and new characters are added to their lives as they advance through the teetering structures of modernity. The eternal crumbling of society brings confusion into each individual life. Elements of a central mystery fall into place as the book stares into the heart of madness. This novel paints a vivid picture of the battle between society and passion - passion blinding, fated and fatal. Yet love emerges even from the grave, triumphant and all-redeeming.

Despite this synopsis, there is plenty of humor in this one. This is a surrealist novel. And a true story.

But descriptions are not novels. Nor can one know a book by an excerpt. In fairness, the only way you people can get a sense of the writing at least is to read some, so below I have put a link to the opening pages.

The Backstory:

In the winter of 1995, I went alone to a magical forest I knew from my youth, locked the door and wrote this novel. Nearly 500 pages in four months and one week. Remarkably, an agent picked it up right away. She spoke of selling it for an advance of 'six figures' and expected to find a publisher promptly. What I was later told was that the industry was in a major transition then, with conglomerates, big houses and medium houses all embroiled in a buy-up frenzy. So I was told, anyway.

What I did get from that ordeal was:

One top editor said it was some of the most beautiful prose he'd ever read...but he didn't know if he'd still be in his post the next week.

Another leading editor, at another end of the spectrum, wrote (to the agent): "There is something very unique about Tristan Winter's lush, erudite voice, and I agree with you about the 'edginess' of the work: he certainly takes risks and from what I have seen of Banquet of the Sapphire Moon, he pulls them off." I still have that letter.

Normal people who've read it have called it "the modern The Red and the Black," though some have placed the writing closer to Lautréamont than Stendhal (astounding compliments). A few have for whatever reasons compared it to The Master and Margarita.

A writer many consider the leading poet in America wrote an endorsement saying the book must be must be published.

The agent somehow lost the poet's letter and I never received a copy. The big sale was always "two weeks" away, and this seemed to mean two weeks from forever. All this led to was a kind of manic-depression imposed on me from the outside, and after a year or so I called it off. However, aside from the mysteries of the publishing industry, I should say that I'd been marketing a novel I never did one word of rewrite on, and I should now confess that I have still never even read it.

Now it's time I read it, and possibly do something about getting it to the public.


The Math:

I checked with some colleagues and the consensus was that for a rewrite of this nature I'd need six months to do it well. That's six months of working only on the novel. During this period, I will have to pay rent, pay the gas, electricity and all other utilities, and will have four mouths to feed every day -in the household, I mean...I don't have four in my face. And feeding the little dog the kids hoodwinked me into getting them. Oh...and a couple of birthdays in that period. Barely keeping all this alive costs a minimum of some three thousand dollars a month.


The Perks:

This is the first time I've ever tried any sort of crowdfunding. I have no idea whether or not it will help at all, and to this we can add the embarrassment of putting myself online; I don't use Facebook or any social networking, although if you wish to help the book you can use them to spread the word. Since, at this point, I am undecided about publishing the book, I cannot be promising signed copies in hardback or whatever tiered rewards people usually invent to promote their projects. Instead, I decided that the only fair system would be to email the finished novel to everyone who contributes. Books are to be read by everybody and I can't justify not sharing this one with anyone who wants to read it, whether they contribute 1 dollar or 5 thousand. So everyone gets the same book, and the support you grant it I leave to your generosity and circumstances.

Here is the link to some opening pages of the book. This is the raw, unedited text as I wrote it in 1995. Keep in mind, however, that it's only the opening, so it's just setting the stage for all that follows. If you wish to read more, please donate whatever you can.

Grand Skies and Thanks to All

T.W.

story:
Short Summary

My campaign is to ask the great public to fund my book project that's been on my mental burner for 10 years. Yes, for 10 years my bedroom has been the house of my notes written on everything from the back of magazine to letters, cards and anywhere else there was room for a note. I've always been interested in love as many are, but my infatuation has drawn me to study men, women and couples over the years, finding myself instantly giving friends and family advice. I believe it's time to tell the world of my many fascinating findings. By the time you have read this book, your understanding of the different ways men love will be more clear and enlightening.

What We Need & What You Get

What I need from the public is your mental and financial support. What you get is advice you will need to free yourself from making painful decisions when it comes to choosing a partner for love.

The Impact

The funding of this project needs to go as follows:

  • $6,000 for publishing
  • $2,000 for materials & travel.
  • $2,000 for promotion of my book.
  • Any additional funding will go toward better perks toward the end of the campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to contribute, I would still be happy & grateful if you could pass my project along to your friends that may be interested in a book like mine. This can be done through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc ...

Wish me luck as I wish you love.

story:
Only a FEW Hours Left!  Check out the NEW PERK!!

Introducing the LITTLE LEARNERS FLIGHT LESSON Perk!

You are giving the gift of WRITING to an at-risk youth in Honduras!

An at-risk youth in Tegucigalpa, Honduras will receive their very own JOURNAL and PEN to begin their own writing adventure!

A $2 contribution will also be made in your name towards a SCHOOL SUPPLIES FUND for Zion's Gate Ministries - an organization that is rescuing kids off the streets of Tegucigalpa and giving them new life!

You also get a digital download of the book!

Snag this perk with a contribution of at least $15, check it out--->

Check out a video of Zion's Gate Ministries HERE!

 

In 3 Sentences, What is this all about?!

I am writing a book about my 3-year journey around the world, and releasing it October 3rd. 

Your contribution to this campaign will allow me the time and resources I need to complete this book with excellence.

The stories from my time in Southeast Asia, Eastern Europe, West and East Africa, and Central America will both encourage you to seek God in your daily life, and challenge you to lend your time and resources to the poorest of the poor.

 

 

Short Summary

About me – My name is Michael Sanders.  I am a writer and a voice for the voiceless.  I am currently working towards seeing 100 orphans around the world completely supported, and I am continually advocating in the fight against human trafficking.

The Campaign – The book As You Learn to Fly will be a collection of stories from my last three years of traveling around the world, following Jesus and serving the poorest of the poor.  By partnering with me through this Indiegogo campaign, you will allow me the time and resources I need to complete this book with excellence.

The Book – I’ve had the honor of partnering with countless ministries and organizations throughout Southeast Asia, Central America, West and East Africa, and Eastern Europe.  I have seen the power of God first hand.  I have experienced the heights and widths and depths of His love.  I have been given a testimony, and I want to share it with the world!

I am convinced that God has a great adventure in store for you, and I trust that these stories will ignite your heart with passion to follow God daily.  This book will inspire you to dream bigger, and to truly believe that with God, nothing is impossible!

As You Learn to Fly will include stories of

  • God’s Provision – He’s a good good Father and He loves His children.  What He has called you to He is faithful to bring you through.  These stories will increase your faith and challenge you to dream big in spite of impossible financial odds.

  • Miraculous Healing – I have personally experienced God’s healing and have prayed and seen other people healed by the name of Jesus.  These stories will encourage you to always pray and never give up.

  • Kingdom People – I have met some of the most incredible people in my travels.  These men and women are absolutely making a great impact in the world today.  These stories will challenge you to live a better life story.

  • Injustice – I have met with completely destitute orphans, held children dying from malnourishment, and walked through cities darkened by human trafficking and sex trade, and these experiences have forever changed me.  These stories will move your heart and launch you into action.

These stories need to be shared, and I need your help to make that possible!

What We Need & What You Get

I am planning on releasing the book October 3rd.

What I need is financial support to carry me through this summer – money to cover the costs of publishing the book and to support myself as I work hard towards the books completion.

*If the campaign becomes fully funded, you can still preorder a copy of the book by pledging through Indiegogo (I can raise more than 100%).

What you get is a copy of the book!  You will be one of the first to receive a copy of the book, and will have the satisfaction of knowing you helped to make the book possible!  Check out the other perks to the right! 

The Impact

I honestly believe this book is going to transform people’s lives.  My hope is that many people will be encouraged to walk closer with God, and also challenged to give their time and resources towards bettering the lives of the impoverished and enslaved.

Need one more reason to support this campaign?  A portion of every book sold will be going towards the ministries I support for my mission to see 100 at-risk kids supported.  You can read more about each ministry at http://asyoulearntofly.com/100-kids/

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute financially, or want to contribute in other ways, you can help by getting the word out and making some noise for this campaign!

Use the share tools that Indiegogo has available below the video.  Share the campaign on facebook, through email and twitter.  Share with friends and family, and charge them to share it as well!

Thanks for stopping by!  I am excited for the books release on October 3rd.

And that’s all there is to it.
story_txt:
Only a FEW Hours Left!  Check out the NEW PERK!!
Introducing the LITTLE LEARNERS FLIGHT LESSON Perk!

You are giving the gift of WRITING to an at-risk youth in Honduras!
An at-risk youth in Tegucigalpa, Honduras will receive their very own JOURNAL and PEN to begin their own writing adventure!
A $2 contribution will also be made in your name towards a SCHOOL SUPPLIES FUND for Zion's Gate Ministries - an organization that is rescuing kids off the streets of Tegucigalpa and giving them new life!
You also get a digital download of the book!
Snag this perk with a contribution of at least $15, check it out--->
Check out a video of Zion's Gate Ministries HERE!

story:
It's Time for Chasing Weather

Chasing Weather: Tornadoes, Tempests, and Thunderous Skies in Word & Image features photos by Stephen Locke and poems by Caryn Mirriam-Goldberg, to be published by Ice Cube Press. To make the book widely-affordable, support a wonderful small press, and make our dreams come true, we ask for your help.

Our Story

We love weather. As a girl, it was love at first storm for Caryn, who grew up in the east. When she landed in Kansas, she was hooked for life. Stephen, who grew up in Boulder, Colorado, was captivated by the afternoon thunderstorms from the mountains, especially the cloud-to-ground lightning. We met on Facebook when Stephen asked Caryn the very question she was about to ask him: do we want to create a book together of poetry and photography? For the last four years, we've been creating a whole body of new work in word and image of thunderstorms, tornadoes, hail storms, panoramic lightning, sunset and midnight storms, and spectacular supercells.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Chasing Weather, to be released late summer, will contain over 75 superbly-reproduced photographs and 75 beautifully-written poems. We need to raise approximately $5,000 to supplement the high cost of color printing.

  • Our exciting and unique perks offer you one-of-a-kind art and adventure, from original prints of Stephen's photography with Caryn's poetry, to a storm chase odyssey with Stephen, or a private presentation featuring video, photography, and poetry with Stephen and Caryn

  • Even if we don't reach our goal, your contribution helps make publication of this book possible. If we surpass our goal, all extra dollars will go toward publishing and promoting the book.

Who We Are & Why This Book

"The sky is made of rivers before and after they became rivers," Caryn writes in Chasing Weather. Weather subtly shapes our days, infuses our moods and interactions, and at times, completely re-orients our lives. Catching moments of stunning beauty and surprising shifts in the sky helps make the vibrant and variable world more visible to us, and shows us how to truly see where and who we are.

  • Stephen is a director of photography and professional storm chaser, who produces motion and still photography for businesses and private collectors. His work has been seen on CBS, the Weather Channel, the Discovery channel. He has spent years chasing storms through Kansas, Oklahoma, Texas, Colorado, Wyoming, South Dakota, Minnesota and other states.
  • Caryn is the 2009-13 Kansas Poet Laureate, author of four collections of poetry, including Landed;  a novel, The Divorce Girl; a beloved writing guide; The Sky Begins At Your Feet; and she co-edited the anthology An Endless Skyway. Coordinator of Transformative Language Arts at Goddard College (where she teaches), she offers community writing workshops widely.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can contribute any amount, we're grateful, but if funds aren't flowing enough for you to give money, please consider giving a moment of your time.

  • Please use the Indiegogo sharing tools to post the campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or other networks..

  • If you have a blog or website, or just a lot of pals who might be interested, please spread the word.

We're thrilled to share the wild beauty of the weather with you!

We are very happy and grateful to have made our goal! All further contributions will help even more with the book's printing and publicity. Here's our video to celebration.



Check out our new video (above) featuring the poem "After the Storm, the Stars" and more images from Stephen Locke
