story:
The Situation

Hi.  My name is Jeanne Kalogridis.  I've written 36 published novels, some as Jeanne Kalogridis and some as J. M. Dillard, including historical novels including THE BORGIA BRIDE and THE INQUISITOR'S WIFE, the historical vampire trilogy which includes COVENANT WITH THE VAMPIRE, CHILDREN OF THE VAMPIRE and LORD OF THE VAMPIRES, and the STAR TREK movie novelizations (as Dillard).

I've hit a rough financial patch and have run out of funds.  I've always made my living as a full-time writer.  I'm also pushing 60 and am finding it impossible to get a day job.  At any rate, I need to spend 5-8 hours every day working on THE ORPHAN OF FLORENCE if I'm to meet my deadline and survive financially.

I had an earlier Indiegogo campaign which raised over $4000 and will help me get through the rest of January and the first half of February.   However, it'll take three to four months for me to complete the book and receive payment from my publisher.  Unfortunately, I was unable to meet my goal.

Can you be a patron of the arts and help me?

What I Need

  • I need roughly $4000/month to pay for rent, utilities, gas and food.  I'm asking for $15,000.  The money is going to basics.
  • Please feel free to Google me and see what books I've written.
  • Even if I fail to meet my goal this time, any and all contributions will help me get the book written.

What Your Contribution Will Do:

  • It will help a seasoned professional (me) make her deadline.  It will absolutely be used for necessities--food, rent, gas, paper.  I'm grateful for every day that I'm able to stay in my one-room studio and write.  And I WILL be writing five to six days a week.
  • As you can see, I have quite the track record.  This book WILL be finished AND published.
  • Illness plus the financial crash of 2008 completely wiped me out.  I know a lot of you are struggling because of the economy too.  I'm used to taking care of others, not asking for help, so this is hard for me.  I don't do this likely.

If You Can't Contribute, Please Share

  • I'm grateful to all those willing to share this.
  • Indiegogo has tools that makes it easy to share this message via Facebook, Twitter and other social media.
  • Feel free to contact me via email (jkalo@mac.com), Facebook (Jeanne Kalogridis--I also have an author page as well as a personal one), or Twitter (@jkalogridis).

Thank you for any and all help.  And a deep thanks to all those who contributed to my previous campaign.

story:
Dream BIG: Chapter ONE - A children's story about the power of belief!

I am Jorey Tessier, the author of Dream BIG: Chapter ONE.  Throughout the last two years I've done a lot of self work which led to the journey of writing a series of children's books.  This story came out of conversations I have had with people who kept telling me "I wish I knew what I know now at your age".  It really got me thinking.  I thought to myself "what if there's a way to educate children to believe in themselves" and "could you imagine how confident they would be"?  This is when Dream BIG was made into a story!

2015 was a stepping stone in the creative process.  I acquired an artist, and editor, and a self publishing company that is a great fit.

It's now 2016 and time to make Dream BIG: Chapter ONE a REALITY!

The man behind the art!

Shawn Colbeck, the same artist who worked on Disney's Tarzan and Atlantis, has taken Dream BIG and brought it to life.  His work never ceases to amaze me! From a full spread in the book, to every minute detail, his work is what makes Dream BIG that much better!


HELP US HELP OTHERS

Dream BIG has been in the works for a little over a year now, and it's time to take this idea and make it readily available for the world to see!  The story is written, the images need colour and then it can be sent right to the self publishing company!

The Goal is to raise $15,000 in 40 days.  All contributions will help support the book and the inspiring message of belief in yourself!
The goals are simple:
  • $10,000 - covers the Artist 
  • $3,500 - covers the publishing package
  • $1,500 - covers the first bulk order of Dream BIG: Chapter ONE
Perks
Tier 1  : A signed copy of Dream BIG: Chapter ONE
Tier 2  : 2 Books (1 sign copy + 1 with a personal message) of Dream BIG: Chapter ONE
Tier 3  : 3 books (2 signed + 1 with a personal message) of Dream BIG: Chapter ONE + your name in the book!
Tier 4  : 9 book (8 signed + 1 with a personal message) of Dream BIG: Chapter ONE +  Your in the book as a $250 Indiegogo Contributor
Tier 5  : 30 books (25 signed + 5 with a personal message) of Dream BIG: Chapter ONE + Your in the book as a $1000 Indiegogo Contributor  + Event speaker (plus any applicable travel fees)


The Impact

With your contributions we will be able to get the book out and into the world! Think back to when you were a child.  Think back to when you needed that one person by your side.  Now think of how BIG of an impact teaching children to believe in themselves and dream BIG dreams.  Dream BIG is much more than a story.  It is accompanied with this great companion book that kids can use to further explore their own ideas from the story.  What an amazing thing it would do for their confidence and their self-image!  We have the story, the artist, the editor, and the self publishing company.  Every contribution will help us reach our goal!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can support and help in spreading the word by sharing this campaign on your personal social media platforms, messenger, and email!  Tell everyone you know about Dream BIG: Chapter ONE and this campaign so we can reach as many people as possible! 


Lets make Dream BIG a reality!

story:
Hi Friends and Family!  

I am so happy to have been one of 80 poets (out of 400 who applied!) accepted to The Ashbery Home School, a weeklong writing conference in Miami.  It brings writers like me together with total dreamboat writers like Timothy Donnelly, Adam Fitzgerald, Cathy Park Hong, Dorothea Lasky, Tan Lin, Maggie Nelson and Mónica de la Torre for a week of workshops and readings. 

This is an amazing opportunity for me to advance my craft and immerse myself in a community that, as The Home School puts it, "celebrate(s) writers and artists who break the rules, ignore traditional artistic boundaries and question the very nature of their practice."

As a working artist and adjunct Professor I am unable to cover all the expenses on my own-- your kind donation will help me cover the cost of tuition and travel/lodging for the week of creative growth.

Any amount you can contribute is so appreciated.  In gratitude I will make and send you a little something featuring some of my poetic and crafty skills! 

A huge thank-you in advance for your generosity, kind hearts.


xoxoxo

story:
A group of expat ladies meets every Thursday morning - rain or shine - for a brisk two hour walk through Singapore. We love exploring and going to areas that are a little bit off the beaten track. And at the end of the walk there is always… coffee!

Because we do so much exploring, we figured we should put the most interesting routes in a book for everyone to enjoy! And the proceeds of the book could then be donated to charity.  The drivers of the project (Sandra and Pleun) both work for charities in Singapore, so it was decided to donate the books to RDA (Riding for the Disabled) and NCA (Netherlands Charity Association). Both charities sell their merchandise at Fairs in Singapore as one method of fundraising for the Singaporean causes they support. Click on the logos for more information about both charities.

  

What We Need

To make sure as much money as possible goes to charity, we are raising money to get the book printed. And this is where you could help. We would like to have 2,000 copies of the book printed professionally, which would cost about S$ 3,600 (all the money we don’t spend on printing, will go directly to RDA and NCA). We then need to spend some money on postage (for the copies we sell during the campaign) and we would also like to throw a small launch party for everyone who helped making the book and to officially handover the book to NCA and RDA. We guestimate that we’d need about S$ 400.00, making it a total of S$ 4,000.-- (which in Euros is +/- 2,650.--)

 

About the book

The book will contain about 15 walks through all areas of Singapore. It will have point by point instructions on how to walk and what to look out for. The picture below is not the definitive layout, we are working on that as we speak, but it does give you an idea of where we are going with it!

 

What's Next?

First of all, we would like to sell as many books as possible through this campaign. After we ship the books that are sold here on Indiegogo, we will donate the rest to RDA and NCA (50% each), who are planning to sell the books for around S$ 15.00 each.

We would like to have 2,000 copies of the book printed professionally, which would cost about S$ 3,600 (all the money we don’t spend on printing, will go directly to RDA and NCA). We then need to spend some money on postage (for the copies we sell during the campaign) and we would also like to throw a small launch party for everyone who helped making the book and to officially handover the book to NCA and RDA. We guestimate that we’d need about S$ 400.00, making it a total of S$ 4,000.-- (which in Euros is +/- 2,650.--)
 
About the book
The book will contain about 15 walks through all areas of Singapore. It will have point by point instructions on how to walk and what to look out for. The picture below is not the definitive layout, we are working on that as we speak, but it does give you an idea of where we are going with it!

 
What's Next?
First of all, we would like to sell as many books as possible through this campaign. After we ship the books that are sold here on Indiegogo, we will donate the rest to RDA and NCA (50% each), who are planning to sell the books for around S$ 15.00 each.

story:
THE CAMPAIGN FOR THE NEW BOOK HAS JUST LAUNCHED!

We're pre-selling copies of Gifts from the Goddess: Selected Words of Sri Amritananda Natha Saraswati, the new collection of Guruji's work and volume 2 in this series. Head over to the new campaign to reserve your special edition copy!

Awaken to the ancient Sri Vidya path of tantric goddess worship

Nearly four decades ago, a series of intense spiritual visions led one of India’s top nuclear physicists—until then a religious skeptic and man of science—to walk away from his prestigious post at the heart of the country’s missile-defense complex.

Retreating into the remote jungles of eastern India, he discovered the remains of a centuries-old Tantric mother goddess shrine and embarked on a life-altering quest to revive and expand it—eventually attracting tens of thousands of followers from across India and around the globe.

His journey took him from the sprawling metropolises of South Asia to the developing world of south-central Africa, from an unlikely Hindu goddess temple thriving in rural upstate New York to a mass Tantric prayer chant at the summit of New Hampshire’s Mount Washington. Along the way, he encountered a credibility-stretching array of saints and gurus.

The Goddess and the Guru chronicles the astonishing, inspiring and yet deeply human life of Dr. Nishtala Prahlada Sastry, later best known as Sri Amritananda Natha Saraswati, or simply “Guruji.” In the tradition of Yogananda’s iconic Autobiography of a Yogi or Brunton’s A Search in Secret India, The Goddess and the Guru is part biography, part spiritual guidebook—geared toward a new generation of seekers.

More than merely the story of one man and his particular path, it explores the universal questions of why we believe, why we practice, and how to establish and (above all) sustain a meaningful spiritual life while remaining fully engaged in the world.

Drawing upon reams of original documents and years of candid, in-depth interviews with Amritananda, his family, friends, colleagues, disciples and closest associates, as well as scholars of Indian religion, history and archaeology, The Goddess and the Guru offers unprecedented insight into the making of a modern-day spiritual master. Grounded in the ancient Sri Vidya school of Tantric Hinduism – the world’s oldest surviving and most sophisticated school of goddess worship, with roots tapping back to prehistoric India – Amritananda’s work reveals powerful teachings that were, for millennia, passed orally from guru to disciple.

Who are we?

My name is Michael Bowden. I am an attorney and former New York Times Company reporter with three decades of publishing experience. I’ve written for newspapers and magazines ranging from the ABA Journal to India Today. I was a longtime features editor for Lawyers Weekly Publications in Boston, and I now direct communications for Roger Williams University School of Law, Rhode Island’s only law school. My freelance magazine features have appeared in national and international publications, and I was awarded the American Bar Association’s prestigious Ross Award for my legal journalism.

In 1999 I co-founded the Shakti Sadhana Group, which collected, published and hosted discussions of Hindu Shakta scriptures. I met Amritananda in 2003, and we collaborated on a number of projects together over the years. I wrote The Goddess and the Guru with his full cooperation and participation, and he approved the manuscript just months before his death in October 2015

I am now working closely with Guruji’s family and the Sri Vidya Trust on the publication of the book. Any profits from the advance special edition hardcover over and above production, distribution and marketing costs will help support Devipuram and carry on Guruji's work.

We’ve partnered with a firm in Vancouver, Canada, to handle the editing, design, indexing, proofreading and printing of the book. Their terrific organization has produced dozens of books, including the second editions of Tantra Illuminated: The Philosophy, History, and Practice of a Timeless Tradition by Christopher Hareesh Wallis and Exquisite Love: Reflections on the Spiritual Life based on Nārada’s Bhakti Sūtra by William Mahony.

The money raised in this campaign will go toward the fees for these services, as well as to print the first edition paperback and the special edition hardcover.

 

The Rewards

 

This campaign is fully funded, and most perk levels have closed! But you can still pre- order your first edition paperback or e-book of The Goddess & the Guru at this page.

Are you our unicorn?

We still have lots of expenses to cover, so you can still get the “unicorn” perk! All of the money raised will go directly toward paying for the production, printing, shipping, distribution and advertising costs for the paperback and hardcover books. Contribute $5,000 to the project and receive:

  • A commemorative bookmark
  • An early edition of the e-book of The Goddess and the Guru
  • A paperback copy of The Goddess and the Guru
  • A special-edition hardcover of The Goddess and the Guru
  • Four high-quality art prints of Devipuram and Guruji
  • Have dinner with the author (in or near Boston, MA)
  • Paperback copies of professor Corrinne G. Dempsey’s The Goddess Lives in Upstate New York: Breaking Convention and Making Home at a North American Hindu Temple; Sarah Tomlinson’s Nine Designs for Inner Peace: The Ultimate Guide to Meditating with Color, Shape, and Sound; Christopher Hareesh Wallis’s Tantra Illuminated: The Philosophy, History, and Practice of a Timeless Tradition; and Ekabhumi Charles Ellik’s The Shakti Coloring Book: Goddesses, Mandalas, and the Power of Sacred Geometry.
  • A two-week stay in Devipuram in a private room at the Sri Villa guesthouse (airfare not included)
  • A week-long Sri Vidya class tailored to your level of experience; and/or a puja/homam performed for your specific needs
  • A private, one-on-one tour with a family member to Guruji-related places around Vizag that are pivotal to his story and discussed in “The Goddess and the Guru”
  • An afternoon tea with Amma, Guruji’s sister and one of Guruji's children
  • A Devipuram Meru
  • A special gold-foil Devipuram bookmark
  • A deluxe DVD of the upcoming documentary film on Guruji by celebrated director Raja Choudhary
  • A copy of the Amrita Bindu Book of Quotes
  • A Devipuram signature pooja mandir (46 x 23 x 56 cm (LBH)), designed with Devipuram-specific themes

 

 

All stretch goals met!

 

Not only did we meet our goal, but we met all of our stretch goals! That means that:

The interior of both the paperbacks and hardcovers will be printed in two colours, black and red.

The hardcovers will be bound with a special illustrated frontispiece with a reproduction of a hand-drawn Sri Chakra drawn by Guruji himself, each of which will be individually signed by a member of Guruji’s family.

All backers who contributed by 10/25 will receive a postcard-sized print of Guruji.

In addition, the hardcovers will be bound with designed end-papers at the front and back of the book featuring a Goddess prayer handwritten and translated by Guruji.

 

And finally, all backers (from $5 upward!) who contributed by 10/25 will receive a keepsake piece from one of Guruji’s favorite shawls (like the blue-green and gold shawl seen in this photo).

 

 

How to Check Out

YES you CAN pay with a credit or debit card—but Indiegogo makes the process a little confusing! Here’s how you do it.

  • 1. Select your perk.
  • 2. Fill in your shipping information and select “Continue to Paypal.” You will not have to log in to Paypal or create a Paypal account.
  • 3. Under “Choose a way to pay” on the Paypal screen, select “Pay with a credit or debit card.”
  • 4. Fill in your card information and complete your purchase.

 

Questions?

Got a question about something not covered here? Send an email to michaelmbowden@gmail.com.

 

Thank you for your support!

story:
Who am I and why I wrote this book

My name is Sahil Jaswal and I am an author and a copywriter for a leading firm in India. I hail from the military background, so I have travelled all my life accumulating knowledge from various regions and societies. Through my travels I realised that i liked people a lot and different kinds of people and over the years it became my strength to read into every single thing a person does and then it evolved from a person to society and to religions, countries, the world, the infinite. I have faced all the cultures and harsh reality the people bring about and I would like to expose people for they really are in order to inspire change, because sometimes all we need is a hard look at ourselves, to know where we changed and became what we are. 

Short Summary of my Book

A journey through life of a lone soul. The pangs of the world, the nuances of communities, the politics of religions, the death of dreams, end of life as it is. This book inspires fantasy and dreams, it tells you what you can already see but can't look at. It's like air that you breathe constantly but don't take notice of. The book tells you exactly how heavy the is the burden of education, jobs, family, relationships and life itself. 

A journey of a boy from when he was a child to when he grows and graduates from the most reputed college and then gives everything up for a higher path. How the values and ethics instilled in him by his simple-minded folks lead him to carry not only his burden but that of the worlds'. The loss of life, the rapes and molestations, the political dogma, the religious tacts, the wars, how they all end up in his basket of burden and how he tries to find salvation while bringing salvation to the world. 

What We Need & What You Get

Your contributions will help to pay for the publishing  and promotion of the book. This involves designing the book cover and the cover art, creating the inner book design, editing, and copy editing, and then printing the book as well as advertising and publicity.  If we don’t reach our goal, the money that is raised will still help us with the cost and is very important to getting this project of the ground. And we have some wonderful and unique perks for you when you contribute.


    The Impact

    There are some gruesome and wildly inappropriate people in this world. People who don't know the difference between right and wrong and people who are incapable of judging one from another. A small mistake can lead to consequences that can't be reversed. We have come in a world where we see people making egregious comments on television that they can not support but still we will listen to them and in some countries even worship them because we are powerless. All the power that leaders say we have is make believe, we do not control anything. I realised this long back and realised we have gone so deep into the filth that people have forgotten how illuminated we once were. My book is a way to remind them of days where we were our own masters and we could get answers for anything we wanted, when we wanted because it wasn't complicated, it was just the truth, it was plain, simple, sometimes hard, but at least it was the truth. 

    Risks & Challenges

    I have the first copy of the book ready with me that I got printed on my own. Finishing a book of 260 pages already, some say is commendable, I disagree, but I have. And then getting it published on my own without anyone's help is another thing I have accomplished. I have done everything I can do with the funds I have, I just need a little help to put my book out there and carry my message across to the world. 

    The risks I may face:

    1. Even with all the money I put into the marketing and promotions of my book, it still may not be received well and I might not make any money out of it to promise anyone any accolades or free copies. (I hope I can though) 

    2. This industry is shaky and sometimes takes a toll. I think I can tackle it and hope I never crumble, but who knows the future. I have come this far on my own just a few painstaking steps more to go. 


    Every other detail is already thought of and weighed upon. I have a team of designers waiting to be paid for the book and a team of editors and hopefully some more will join the team for PR and marketing of the book.


      Other Ways You Can Help

      I urge you more to please spread the word about my book and the message it carries. I just want the world to be a better place. As cliched as it may sound and it may be unoriginal but it succinctly delivers my message. I have seen the harsh reality and I hope no one goes through it. Please use the tools that Indiegogo also provides to help me with my journey of making this world safer and secure for all of us.
